Рахима запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки скота. В будущем она мечтает открыть собственную ферму. Рахима ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Rahima is married and raising three children.  She wants to start her own animal husbandry business.  Rahima participated in the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women.  Rahima has a good opportunity to develop her animal husbandry business because she lives in a rural area.  She will sell livestock at a local market.  Her husband will help her run this business.  Rahima is requesting a loan in the amount of 7500 somoni to buy livestock.  In the future, she dreams of opening her own farm.  Rahima awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start her own business

loans.name: Zina

texts.ru: Зина родилась в 1955 году. Зина живет и работает на юге Таджикистана. Она вдова и имеет 3 детей. Ее дети совершеннолетние. Зина работает в государственном медицинском учреждении. Зина выполняет свою работу отлично. Она всегда старается для благо получения своих детей. Зина хочет купить компьютер для своих детей, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки компьютера. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Zina was born in 1955.  Zina lives and works in the south of Tajikistan.  She is a widow and has 3 children.  Her children are of age.  Zina works at a government medical facility.  Zina does her work with excellence.  She always tries hard for her children's well-being.  Zina wants to purchase a computer for her children, but does not have money.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to purchase a computer.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy computer for her children

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 41 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre vive con su esposo  y con sus hijos, de 2,20 y 15 años. Vive en el  Cantón Pueblo viejo provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama LA PAULINA se encuentra ubicada en el parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto La Paulina, pertenece al cantón Pueblo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Sonia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, cría gallinas y patos desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar. 
El crédito solicito para arrendar un terreno y  comprar fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado a cambiar el estilo de vida de su familia. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
le gusta salir a pasear con el esposo y  trabajar en el campo.
texts.en: Sonia is 41 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She lives with her husband and her children, who are 2, 20 and 15 years old.  She lives in the canton of Pueblo Viejo in the province of Los Rios.    The communal bank is called La Paulina, and is located in the Puerto Pechiche parish, in the province of La Paulina, which belongs to the canton of Pueblo Viejo.  Its members work in agriculture and livestock.  Sonia has worked for several years growing corn and rice, and raising chickens and ducks.    She buys her products in Ventanas, and sells them in the market in Ventanas.  She is requesting a loan to rent land and to buy fertilizer in order to plant corn and rice.  The loan will help her to change her family's living conditions.  Her dream is to buy land and to provide the best to her children.  She likes going out for walks with her husband and working in the fields.

loans.use: to plant corn.

loans.name: Olimpio Valentin

texts.es:
Olimpio tiene 63 años de edad estado civil unión libre,  vive con su esposa y Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama LA PAULINA se encuentra ubicada en el parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto La Paulina, pertenece al cantón Pueblo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Olimpio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en Agroquímicos Briones y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado a fomentar su economía. Su sueño es comprarse un carro.
Le gusta viajar con su familia.
texts.en:
Olimpio is 63-years old, married and lives with his wife in Ventanas Canton, de los Ríos Province.
His communal bank is called "La Paulina"  and is located in Puerto Pechiche Parish, La Paulina Precinct, Pueblo Canton.  The members of the communal bank make their livings in agriculture and ranching. 
Olimpio makes his living in agriculture; he grows corn and rice.  In addition, he raises chickens.  He purchases his supplies from Agroquímicos Briones in Ventanas and sells his products in the Ventanas market. 
Olimpio is requesting the loan to purchase compost, urea and liquid fertilizers to plant his corn and rice.  The loans have helped him to advance his finances.  His dream is to buy himself a car. 
Olimpio likes to travel with his family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for planting corn.

loans.name: Yeimy Arely

texts.es:
Yeimy, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar  blusas, camisas, faldas, pantalones, entre otros, así contara con un inventario surtido con el que responda  a las exigencias de sus clientes en esta fechas en las que las ventas incrementan.
Con el capital que se le facilito antes, su negocio fue fortalecido, sus ventas mejoraron su economía mejoro y le permite cancelar las cuotas de la deuda, así como también tiene mejores condiciones familiares.
texts.en:
Yeimy is asking for a new loan to buy blouses, shirts, skirts, pants and more. This way, she will have a selection of inventory to respond to her customers' demands at this time when her sales increase.

With the capital that was facilitated for her before, her business was strengthened. Her sales increased and this allows her to make the loan payments. she also has a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, skirts, pants and more.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.es: Silveria, de 38 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y amable, está casada y tiene 03 hijos de 18, 16 y 14 años de edad, habitando su propia casa que logró construir con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Silveria  es la venta de cosméticos, los cuales compra por catálogo y los vende entre sus amistades, además de contar con un salón de belleza instalado en su casa propia donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes brindándoles un buen servicio. Le gusta su negocio de belleza pues aprendió en un centro de educación ocupacional, donde logró aprender  todo lo relacionado a la belleza y sus productos, ahora contando con los ingresos económicos que le genera, desea continuar con su negocio, y con la ganancias desea ampliar su salón de belleza para poder atender a más personas  y darles una mejor comodidad a sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/.800  Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado comenta se siente cómodo con su banco comunal pues considera a sus integrantes ser personas responsables y amables. Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales para implementar su salón de belleza como tintes, líquidos de uñas, champúes y otros.
texts.en:
Silveria, 38 years old, is a hardworking and persevering woman in addition to being cheerful and friendly.  She is married and she has three children who are 18, 16 and 14 years old.  She lives in her own house that she built with a lot of effort.  The activity that she carries out is the sale of cosmetics which she buys from a catalogue and sells among her friends.  In addition she has a beauty salon set up in her house where she attends to her customers very kindly, offering them a good service.  She likes her beauty business which she learned in an occupational education center, where she managed to learn everything related to beauty and its products.  

Now, having the financial revenue that it generates for her, she wants to continue with her business and with the profits she wants to expand her beauty salon in order to be able to serve more people and give a better service to her customers.  On this occasion she will be requesting 800 Peruvian soles (PEN) and she hopes for a small loan so that she will be able to achieve her objectives.  She also mentions that she feels comfortable with her communal bank as she considers the members to be responsible and friendly people.  

With the amount requested she will buy materials to implement in her beauty salon like dyes, nail polishes, shampoos and other things.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 58 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos quienes ya son independientes. Vive cómodamente en su casa propia. Isabel se dedica a la venta de comidas durante los fines de semana. Ha acondicionado un pequeño espacio en la vereda de su casa y ahí ofrece a la venta sus platos regionales. Su actividad empieza levantándose muy temprano para realizar las compras de sus ingredientes para la preparación de los platillos que ofrecerá durante el día. Ya  lleva más de 10 años en este negocio y cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo y de su nieta para atender al público. Considera que su trabajo es bastante rentable por la clientela constante que ha mantenido gracias a la buena sazón de sus comidas. Le gusta su negocio pues le ha traído muchas satisfacciones personales y económicas, asegura que es una actividad que no requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, por tanto agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para acceder al crédito que necesita para continuar con el logro de sus metas. Se compromete a ser un cliente puntual y muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará víveres e ingredientes como arroz, pescados, condimentos, aceites, huevos y otros que necesita para la preparación de una mayor variedad de platillos.
texts.en: Isabel, who is 58-years old, is married and has two grown children.  She lives comfortably in her own home.  Isabel makes her living selling food on the weekends.  She has set up a small space in the path leading to her house for selling the regional dishes she makes.  She starts her work by getting up very early in the morning to purchase the ingredients she needs to prepare what she will offer during the day.  Isabel has run her business for more than ten years, and her son and granddaughter help her to serve the customers.  She feels that her business is quite profitable because of her consistent clientele, which she has maintained thanks to the good flavor of her food.  Isabel likes her work, as it has brought her a lot of personal as well as financial satisfaction and doesn't require a lot of physical effort.  At this time, Isabel is requesting a loan of S/. 2000 (USD $725).  She is grateful for the opportunity offered to her in accessing the loan, which she needs in order to continue meeting her goals.  Isabel promises to be punctual and very responsible in repaying her loan.  With the requested sum, she will purchase supplies and ingredients like rice, fish, condiments, cooking oils, eggs and other items that she needs to prepare a greater variety of dishes.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as condiments, cooking oil, eggs and other items.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura, de 39 años, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora.  Está casada y tiene 02 hijos de 08 y 02 años de edad, quienes son su principal motivo para segur trabajando y lograr así brindarles una calidad de vida.  Ellos viven juntos en su casa propia que pudo comprar en base a esfuerzo y muy sacrificio. El negocio que tiene Laura es la venta de comidas regionales, todas las mañanas instala su mesa en el frontis de la casa de sus padres y pone a la venta todas las comidas que prepara con mucho esmero, además también pone a la venta diversos refrescos elaborados con frutas típicas. Atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes quienes mayormente son sus propios vecinos y la recomiendan a otras personas que con el tiempo se vuelven sus clientes habituales. Hasta el momento trabaja sola pero en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de su hermana. Comenta que le gusta su trabajo porque siempre sintió pasión por la cocina, además al ver las ganancias económicas que obtenía, no dudó en emprender este negocio y generar su propia fuente laboral. Espera seguir trabajando de la misma forma para que su labor continúe en progreso. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes como arroz, orégano, huevos, pescados y otros productos que usa para la preparación de comidas regionales.
texts.en:
Laura, 39, is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is married and has 2 children, 8 and 2 years old. They are her principal motive to continue working and therefore achieve providing them quality of life. They live together in her own house that she could buy based on effort and much sacrifice.

The business that Laura has is the sale of regional food. Every morning, she installs her table in the façade of her parents' house and puts out for sale all of the food that she prepares with great care. Additionally, she also sells various drinks made with typical fruits. She tends to her customers in a very friendly way, who mostly are her own neighbors and recommend her to other people who, with time, become her regular customers.

Up to now, she works alone but on occasions receives support from her sister. She says that she likes her work because she always felt passion for the kitchen. In addition, upon seeing the economic profits that she obtained, she didn't doubt in launching this business and generating her own source of labor.

She hopes to continue working in the same manner so that her labor continues in progress. On this opportunity, she will apply for 1500 Soles. She is very content to know that she will have financial support, since this way she will feel sure of advancing with her business. On the other hand, she is committed one more time to fulfill her payments on time. With the amount requested, she will buy ingredients like rice, oregano, eggs, fish and others that she uses for the preparation of regional foods.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, oregano, eggs, fish and others.

loans.name: Dúo Buena Vista Group

texts.es: La encargada de este grupo es la señora Marta Lucrecia quien se dedica al bordado de blusas a máquina, venta de delantales y también le hace cuellos a los güipiles típicos a los estilos que lOS cliente le pida se ha dedica ha esta actividad desde hace 20 años.  Cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y al lado de sus 4 hijos cada mañana le agradece a Dios por las oportunidades que recibe en la vida.  Se acercan las fechas navideñas y ya tiene varios pedidos de blusas que bordar pero el hilo que tiene no le alcanza por ello tiene pensado comprar por cajas los conos de hilo y así obtener bonitas ganancias ya que se gasta menos.  Por esa razón nuevamente pide un crédito para poder comprar los hilos que necesita y así poder terminar las blusas sin quedarles mal a sus clientes.esta es su tercer credito que solicita a kiva y no a caido en mora esperando que nuevamente le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado
texts.en: The one in charge of this group is Marta Lucrecia. She does machine embroidery of blouses and sells aprons. She also makes traditional güipiles collars to order for her customers. She has done this for 20 years. She has her husband's unconditional support and with her 4 children she thanks God every day for the opportunities she has been given in life. Christmas time is coming and she already has several orders of blouses to embroider but the thread that she has isn't enough. That is why she has planned on buying the cones of thread by the box so she can make some good profit because she will be spending less. That is why she is asking for a loan again to be able to buy the thread she needs to be bale to finish the blouses and not look bad to the customers. This is her third loan that she has asked Kiva for and she hasn't made a late payment. She hopes that you can help her again with the loan she has asked for.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to do embroidery.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana, se dispone a surtir su venta de ropa en estas fechas que sus clientes buscan diversidad de productos, comprara blusas, pantalones, faldas, camisas, etc., de esta forma atraerá más clientes y fortalecerá su negocio.
Con la inversión anterior su negocio tuvo una variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, sus ventas aumentaron, sus ingresos mejoraron, y su familia se encuentra muy saludable.
texts.en:
Ana needs to stock her clothing sales at this time because her customers are looking for product diversity. She will buy blouses, pants, skirts, shirts, etc. This way, she will attract more customers and fortify her business. 

With the previous loan, she had a variety of products to offer her customers. Her sales increased, her income improved and her family is in very good health.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, skirts, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Celia Cristina

texts.es:
Celia, se le presenta la oportunidad de invertir en su  tienda para esta temporada de fin de año, comprara bebidas, golosinas, pan, aderezos, entre otros productos necesarios para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes.
El crédito anterior le permitió surtir el inventario de su negocio de ropa lo que le dio como resultado más clientes mejores ganancias, ha cancelado sus deudas, y ha mejorado su vida familiar. También ha incluido en la tienda ya diversifico la mercadería que ofrece a sus clientes aparte de ropa ofrece productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Celia is presented with the opportunity of investing in her store for this end-of-year season. She will buy drinks, snacks, bread, condiments, among others.

The previous loan allowed her to stock the inventory of her clothing store, which gave her more clients and better income as a result. She has paid off her debts and has improved her family life. She has also already included diversified merchandise in the store that she offers to her customers. Apart from clothes, she offers staple products.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snacks, bread, condiments, among others.

loans.name: Jhilouna Mae

texts.en:
Due to economic hardship, Jhilouna Mae aims to make her business more profitable. She needs to support the education of her three children and provide for their needs. Due to family conflict, she is separated from her husband. 

Jhilouna would like to acquire more stock for her grocery store. However, she has inadequate capital. Therefore, she is asking for a PHP 7,000 loan to buy additional canned goods, snacks, laundry soap, noodles, beverages, seasonings, soft drinks, and frozen food to sell in her store. As a hard working mother, she hopes that her business will continue to become more profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her store

loans.name: Norma Maricela

texts.es:
Norma tiene 26 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre vive con el esposo  y con sus hijos, de 1 y 2 años. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama LA PAULINA se encuentra ubicada en el parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto La Paulina, pertenece al cantón Pueblo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Norma se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años, también se dedica a la cría de animales. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en el Dr. Agro y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, abonos, insecticidas y balanceados de cianza y engorde.
El préstamo le ayudado para cambiar el estilo de vida de la familia. Su sueño es tener un terrero para construir una casa.
Le gusta viajar con su familia y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Norma is 26 years old and lives with her husband in a common-law marriage and with her children who are 1 and 2 years old.  She lives in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos.  Her communal bank, La Paulina, is located in the Puerto Pechiche parish in the La Paulina district, which belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton.  The people here work in agriculture and raising livestock.

Norma has worked in agriculture planting corn and rice for some years now.  She also works raising animals.  She purchases her products in Ventanas at Dr. Agro and sells them in the Ventanas market. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, urea, manure, insecticides and balanced feed to raise and fatten her animals.  The previous loan has helped her to change her family’s lifestyle.  Her dream is to have land on which to build a house. 

She likes to travel with her family and listen to music.

loans.use: to plant corn and rice.

loans.name: Bersabe

texts.es:
Bersabe es una señora muy dinámica y trabajadora de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta 8 grado, está casada. Hace varios años emigraron  hacia los Estados Unidos en busca de una mejor vida,  allá ella consiguió trabajo en un restaurante donde trabajó por 5 años, luego regresaron a su país natal con algunos ahorros y se establecieron como familia viviendo en la ciudad. Posteriormente, decidieron irse a vivir a un cantón,  pues vieron que tendrían más oportunidades de crecer productivamente en este lugar, trabajando la agricultura y la ganadería. Junto con ellos también vive un sobrino que lo crían como a un hijo. Sus dos hijos dependen económicamente de ellos.

Bersabe , administra una tienda en la casa,  con la cual provee de productos a los vecinos que se acercan para conseguir los productos necesarios para el hogar. Tiene 4 años de tener la tienda, aparte de esto también se dedica a la venta de ropa en la época más demandada,  como lo son el verano y la época festiva como la navidad;  su hijo de 13 años le ayuda también a la venta cuando ella se encuentra ocupada con los quehaceres domésticos.

Ella ha solicitado el préstamo, pues en todo este tiempo que han tenido de vivir en su casa, , no han gozado de tener su propia luz eléctrica, y la obtienen de la casa de su padre que vive enfrente de ellos. La pareja espera con el dinero del préstamo,  mandar a establecer los dos postes que hacen falta para instalar  la energía eléctrica en su casa y de esta manera no incomodar a su padre.
Bersabe sueña con ir mejorando su casa,  para que luzca bien bonita a futuro, también aspira con  cancelar todas las deudas que tuviese pendiente y ver que sus hijos se superen y lleguen a ser buenos profesionales y que tengan un lugar próspero y agradable donde vivir.
texts.en:
Bersabe is a very dynamic and hardworking woman of 33 years. She studied until 8th grade; she's married. Several years ago, they emigrated to the United States in search of a better life. There, she obtained work in a restaurant where she worked for 5 years. Later, they returned to their home country with some savings and established themselves as family, living in the city. Later, they decided to go live in a canton; they saw that they would have more opportunities to grow productively in this place, working at agriculture and animal husbandry. Along with them also lives a nephew that they raise like a son. Their two children depend on them economically.

Bersabe runs a store in the house, with which she provides products to the neighbors who stop by to obtain necessary products for the home. She has had the store for 4 years. Apart from this, she also works selling clothes in the seasons with most demand, like summer and Christmas. Her 13 year-old son also helps her sell when she is found busy with the domestic chores.

She has applied for this loan. In all of this time they have had to live in their house, they have not enjoyed having their own electricity. They obtain it from the house of her father who lives in front of them. The couple hopes that with the money from the loan, they will send to have two posts established that are needed to install the electricity in their house and, in this manner, not inconvenience her father.

Bersabe dreams of improving her house, so that it shines beautifully in the future. She also aspires to pay off all of the debts that she's had pending and see that her children improve and become good professionals and so that they have a prosperous and agreeable place to live.

loans.use: to install electricity in her house.

loans.name: Fatima Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Fátima es ciudadana del municipio de Juigalpa, labora como docente de primaria en una escuela pública, es soltera sus hijos ya son grandes e independientes, ahora ella colabora con ellos cuidándoles sus nietos. Doña Fátima ayuda a su madre en sus diferentes gastos, actualmente la señora tiene en mal estado el techo de la vivienda, por lo que doña Fátima solicita el crédito para comprar las laminas de zinc,  tablones y el pago de la mano de obra, con esta inversión su anciana madre estará más tranquila y en mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Fatima lives in the municipality of Juigapa.  She works as  teacher in a public elementary school.  She is single, and her children are already grown and independent.  She now helps them to care for her grandchildren.  Fatima helps her mother with some of her expenses.  Currently, her mother's roof is in bad condition, and so Fatima is requesting a loan to buy sheets of corrugated metal roofing material and wooden planks, and also to pay for labor.  With this investment, her elderly mother will be more tranquil and will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal, wooden planks, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
Melchor, who is married with an only child, runs and operates a service based business providing motor transportation in the community to make a living. His wife is earning an income from their sari sari store, and he sometimes helps her in that business. 

To improve the transportation service, Melchor borrowed a loan from GDMPC Microcredit to buy new tires. It had been more than a year since he bought the old tires. His effort and determination make him dream of having a better living with his family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana has a food business. She sells banana fruits to the local community, while her husband is working to earn a living. She has been selling fruits for more than eleven years earning well to provide for the family,  and has successfully repaid her previous loan that she used in her business.

Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy more variety of fruits to resell. In the future, she hopes to expand her fruit business and build her own fruit stand in the city.

loans.use: to buy more variety of fruits to resell

loans.name: Gemeniano

texts.en:
Gemeniano has a service-based business providing motorcycle transportation to local community members and has been doing it for years. From this he was able to provide the needs of his family and had successfully repaid his previous loan used in the business.

To gain more income, Gemeniano engaged in another business which he likes the most. Without hesitation, he borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy additional motor spare parts and other vehicle accessories to be used in repairing the vehicles of his costumers. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional motor spare parts and other vehicle accessories

loans.name: Diego Gerardo

texts.es:
Diego tiene 53 años de edad estado civil Unión libre vive con la esposa  y con sus 8 hijos, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama LA PAULINA se encuentra ubicada en el parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto La Paulina, pertenece al cantón Pueblo Viejo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Diego  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y a la cría de gallinas desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras y la alimentación para los animale. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para su familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener dinero para comprar un terreno.
Le gusta trabajar, jugar naipe y reunirce con la familia.
texts.en:
Diego is 53 years old and lives with his wife in a common-law marriage and with his 8 children.  He lives in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos.  His communal bank, La Paulina, is located in the Puerto Pechiche parish in the La Paulina district, which belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton.  The people here work in agriculture and raising livestock.

Diego has worked in agriculture, planting corn and rice, and raising chickens for some years now.  He purchases his products in Ventanas and sells them in the market in the same area.  

With the help of the loan he will be able to purchase what is necessary for planting and feed for his animals.  The previous loan helped him to increase his family’s income and to invest.  His dream is to have money to buy some land. 

He likes to work, play cards and get together with family.

loans.use: to improve his corn production.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Maria to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as body lotion, toothbrushes, fish, and soy sauce. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable in running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Maria independent because she can be responsible for herself and also for helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy body lotion, toothbrushes, fish, and soy sauce

loans.name: Leai

texts.en: Leai is a 40-year-old married woman with 6 children. She would like to start a small business to sell Elei fabric printed clothes. In order to do this, Leai needs a loan to buy fabric paints, materials, stencils, brushes and an Elei carved printing board. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business. She has been a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy fabric color paints, materials, stencils, brushes and an Elei carved printing board.

loans.name: Mang

texts.en:
A villager from the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Mang is 56 years old and widowed. The main source of her family’s income is from farming rice, planting various kinds of vegetables and growing beans. She and her husband have been in this business for ten years.
 
Mang has been with VisionFund for one cycle and has successfully paid back previous loans which have helped her better support her business. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield in order to make a living better and have a bigger house to live in.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 32 years old.  He is married and has three children.  He would like to use his loan to buy fertilizer to use during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production.  With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that, in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will further enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).  Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations.  For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions.  Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
A USD 1,000 loan is offered to Natalia to improve her business. She is married and has five children. She opened her kiosk in 2003 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy inventory to keep in her store like milk, fish, water, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt and bread. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in business. She lives in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy milk, fish, water, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt and bread

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 54 years old and married with four children, one child is in school.  Merlinda  works very hard to provide for them.

Merlinda  runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, toothbrushes, chips, eggs, and canned goods.

Merlinda  has been in this business for 5 years.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, toothbrushes, chips, eggs and canned goods.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros works hard to support her family.  Milagros is married and has a business, buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines.  She has been in business for 20 years now.

Milagros has requested a loan of 24,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase additional items like hotdogs, tocino (sweetened cured pork) and longganisa (pork sausage flavored with local spices) to stock and sell.

In the future, Milagros would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like hot dogs to stock and sell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sugar, bananas,  and cooking oil.

Nida has been in this business for 25 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell including sugar, bananas, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 63 years old and is married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pig in the Philippines. Norma is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Norma has been raising pigs for 27 years and also earns additional income from raising chickens.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, from Nyandarus, is 48 years old and married. She has five children between the ages of 27 and 13.

Esther has had a farming business for many years. Esther has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy fertilizer and seedlings to use in her farm. She is optimistic that her farm will do well.

She hopes to expand her farming business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 56 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosemarie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of shampoo, soap, oil, etc. to resell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 12 years and she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of shampoo, soap, oil, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
This is Melisa. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan in order to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her in sustaining her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Melisa hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams to have a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients such as rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Shaheen Group

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 52-year-old housewife.  She lives with her husband, a daughter and three sons in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Since 2009, her husband has had a general store and he works very hard to meet his family needs.  He needs additional capital for the growth of his business.  His wife Shaheen is a member of a two-person lending group and she has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan.  With the loan, her husband can buy a variety of goods for his general store.  The expanded inventory will allow him to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings to provide a better future for his children.

Shaheen and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to buy goods for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Nasir Abdi

texts.en: Nasir Abdi is 28 year old.  He studies at the University of Hargeisa, Faculty of Medicine.  His problem is the lack of a laptop to watch video tutorials, prepare assignments, present class presentations and read lessons when provided in soft copy.  It is common for lecturers to use a projector during class and give the students a soft copy for their lessons.  He cannot afford to pay the full cost all at one time.  Therefore, he approached Kaaba MFI and Kaaba will provide him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for educational purposes.

loans.name: Athanase

texts.en:
Athanase is 37 years old. He is married to a farmer, and together they have one child, age ten. He would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers for use during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Valens

texts.en:
Valens is 38 years old. He would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to use during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 29 years old. He would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers for use during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. He wishes to invest profits from his farming into his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Pors' Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Pors is 49 years old and married with six children. She earns a living growing rice to feed and support her family members. She has been in this business for 30 years and is able to earn about 25,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 15,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Pors is with VisionFund for this cycle. She now leads her group to ask for this loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to grow more rice and earn additional income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Phally is 38 years old and is blessed with four children. Now, only three kids still depend on her. To support the daily cost of living, she raises pigs for resale as the main income source. This business has earned her about 34,000 KHR per day. 

Having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages, Phally has managed to utilize her past loan wisely to upgrade her lifestyle, and finally she also has repaid the past loan completely. Currently, she is leading a group of two to get a new loan. She is applying for 1,400,000 KHR, and her co–borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more piglets for raising. She hopes that she can make a good profit from this business so that she can improve her lifestyle progressively.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for raising and selling.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for repacking. Her loan is helpful not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting with her family's everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan for her to buy peanuts, sweet beans, chestnuts, garlic and misua to repack. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosa hopes to have more customers and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for peanuts, sweet beans, chestnuts, garlic and misua to repack.

loans.name: Sern's Group

texts.en:
Sern is 45 years old.  She is married and has four children, two of whom are dependent on her.  She lives in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Moung Russey district. 

She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee.  Having been in this business for 25 years, she manages to earn about 41,000 KHR per day and can save about 25,000 KHR each day for future needs.  

Sern has been with VisionFund for one cycle.  She successfully used the first loan to better support her living.  Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan.  Sern wants to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.  She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income so that she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Chanthy is a 30-year-old mother of four kids, two of whom are schoolchildren while the remaining two are too young for schooling. She is a local farmer who does rice farming as the main source of income and works for others for a fee. She can earn about 17,500 KHR per day from the current business that she has had since she was 20 years old. 

Chanthy is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loan completely. The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to improve her lifestyle better than before. She is now forming a group of two to get a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her crops. She highly hopes that she can boost her crop yield higher than before, and as a result can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her crops.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 33 years old, is married, and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Sarah has been farming sugarcane for 2 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertiizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
Doña María Inés tiene 34 años de edad en una relación de unión libre, ama de casa y agricultora por vocación familiar ya que su familia se ha dedicado a la caficultura por muchas generaciones. Doña María Inés tiene un grado de estudio de primaria incompleto cursado hasta el 5 grado que por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres no pudo completar su primera etapa educativa. De su relación junto a su compañero de hogar procrearon 7 hijos de los cuales dependen 2 de ellos ya que los demás están en hogares a parte y como personas independientes quienes en temporada de corte ayudan a sus padres minimizando de esa manera el pago de mano de obra generando mayores ingresos para su familia y hogar. Fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra enseñándole el cultivo de café, maíz y frijol siendo ellos quienes también le heredaran un pedazo de tierra para poder trabajar y gracias al trabajo en equipo y la buena administración compraron un pedazo de tierra más ubicado a 30 minutos de su casa de habitación.
Sus metas y planes como toda productora de café seguir ampliando sus cultivos de café, y mediante este financiamiento solicitado poder limpiarla, abonarla y fortalecerla de manera que su trabajo de meses no se pierda en días o en horas. Como madre de familia poder heredar la tierra que hoy en día trabaja junto a su compañero de hogar a sus hijos para que ellos sigan trabajando y generando ingresos para el bienestar de sus familias. Ella ha solicitado financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de abono, foliares, fertilizantes y de esa manera proteger y asistir sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
María Inés is 34 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She is a homemaker and is in the family trade of being a farmer, as her family has worked cultivating coffee for many generations. María Inés was in primary school until the 5th grade; due to a lack of economic support from her parents, she was not able to complete the first phase of her education.

From her relationship with her partner, they had 7 children, 2 of whom are still dependent on them. The others already have homes and are independent people who help their parents during the harvest season, in this way minimizing the cost of labor and generating greater income for their family and household.

It was her parents who showed her how to work the land, teaching her to cultivate coffee, corn and beans. It was also they who bequeathed her a plot of land for her to work, and thanks to teamwork and good management, she purchased a land plot located 30 minutes from her house.

Her goals and plans as a coffee producer are to continue expanding her coffee crops, and with this requested loan, to be able to clean them up, fertilize them, and strengthen them in such a way that her hard months of work will not be lost in a few days or hours; also, as the mother of the family, to be able to bequeath the land that she and her partner currently work to her children, so that they will continue working and generating earnings for the well-being of their families.

She has requested the loan from the cooperative COMIXMUL for the purchase of compost, liquid plant food and fertilizer, and in this way protect and support her coffee crops.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies with which she will support her coffee crops.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a 31-year-old married man from Nyandarua South. They have four children between the ages 10 and 4 years old. 

Samwel has a farming business that he has been running for many years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy a calf. He is optimistic that his farming business will do better after the loan. 

He hopes to expand his business in the near future and also improve his family's standard of living in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a calf for his farming business.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Gustavo, de 60 años, está casado y es padre de dos hijos de 21 y 19 años de edad, tiene una casa propia en donde comparte todos los días el gusto de criar a sus hijos y trabajar mucho para brindarles lo mejor. El negocio que tiene Gustavo esta relacionado al sector salud, Tiene un consultorio médico en un local alquilado y ahí recibe diversos pacientes que llegan con dolencias leves para encontrar soluciones a sus malestares. Estudió enfermería y hoy pone en práctica a diario todo lo que aprendió desde suturas, curaciones, inyecciones y otros. Lleva en esta actividad 10 años y hasta el momento le va bien. Trabaja con ayuda de otra enfermera. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite aplicar todo lo que aprendió en sus estudios, además siente satisfacción cuando sus pacientes regresan a casa contentos por haber solucionado sus malestares, espera incrementar su consultorio con la compra progresiva de los equipos necesarios para detección de enfermedades mas complejas.  En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 4000, está agradecido y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio.El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de agujas, jeringas, alcohol, gasas, medicinas de mayor uso y guantes quirúrgicos para que pueda seguir realizando su trabajo.
texts.en: Gustavo is 60 years. He is married and the father of two children, aged 21 and 19. He owns his own house where he has the pleasure of raising his children every day and working to give them the best. The business that Gustavo has is related to health. He has a medical office in a rented locale and he receives diverse patients who go with their minor maladies to find solutions to their discomfort. He studied nursing and now he puts into practice what he learned every day, from sutures, dressing wounds, injections, and more. He has been doing this for 10 years and so far it is going well for him. He works with the help of another nurse. He likes his business because it allows him to apply everything he learned in his studies, and he feels satisfied when his patients go home happy because he has cured their maladies. He hopes to expand his office by the progressive purchase of equipment he needs to detect more complex illnesses. At this time, he will ask for S/. 4000. He is grateful and happy to know that he still has the financial support he needs to advance with the progress of his business. The amount he has asked for will be invested in buying needles, syringes, alcohol, gauze, the most commonly used medicines, and surgical gloves, so that he can keep doing his job.

loans.use: to buy needles, syringes, alcohol, gauze, the most commonly used medicines, and surgical gloves.

loans.name: Emile

texts.en:
Emile is 33 years old. He would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to use during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. He wishes to invest profits from his farming into his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 42-years-old and married with one child.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, biscuits, soap, etc. to sell in her general store.

Teresita has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

Teresita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, biscuits, soap, etc.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Sokha, 49, is a single lady living in Kampong Cham province. She is a rice grower and grocer who can earn almost 34,000 KHR per day from the business that she has had for more than 10 years. This is the first microloan for Sokha with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Currently she seeks 1,500,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay the reaping fee. She hopes that she can collect her yield on time and sell with a good price so that she will receive more income in return.

loans.use: to pay the reaping fee for rice growing.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey, age thirty-eight, is a resident from Kampong Cham province where she runs her business—rice farming and recycled junk items trading. This business generates her about 38,000 KHR per day. Now, she is seeking her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) in the amount of 1,500,000 KHR in order to pay for a reaping fee and to use a portion of it to buy more recycled items for resale. She hopes that she can have sufficient capital to improve her businesses so she can grow her business to a bigger scale than before.

loans.use: To pay for a reaping fee and to use a portion of it to buy more recycled items for resale

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Qamar

texts.en:
Qamar is a 34-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband, daughter and son in Rawalpinedi, Pakistan. 

Since 2009, her husband has had an auto spare parts store and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business.  His wife Qamar has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of auto parts for his shop to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children.

Qamar and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to buy auto parts for her husband's store.

loans.name: Sok Lieng's Group

texts.en: One of the breadwinners in the family consisting of one little kid, Sok Lieng is 30-years-old and a villager from Kampong Cham province. For her family, rice farming and the salary from her husband's job working at a construction site are the main sources of income to support her living.  Never having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, Sok Lieng and the other two borrowers in her group of three are seeking their first microloan of 1,000,000 KHR each. For Sok Lieng, she will spend her entire loan portion in order to pay for the labor fee for harvesting her rice. She hopes that she can gain a good yield with a good profit.

loans.use: To pay the labor fee for harvesting her rice.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Dúo San Francisco Group

texts.es:
DÚO SAN FRANCISCO
El grupo está conformado por la señora quien es Aura Elizabeth de 31 años de edad su negocio es una tienda que tiene ubicada en su  domicilio desde hace 14 años inicio con la ayuda de su esposo y de su mama, tiene  dos hijos menores de edad, necesita el crédito para invertir en la compra de  productos de consumo diario ( jabón , pastas, azúcar etc.) para poder ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes, y también para la elaboración de bordados de blusas y adquirir   materiales de costura ( hilo, adornos para blusa)  su deseo es seguir creciendo y agrandar su tienda.
texts.en:
SAN FRANCISCO DUO

Sra. Aura Elizabeth, who is 31 years old, is one of the members of this duo. Her business is a store located in her home. She started it 14 years ago with the help of her husband and mother. She has two minor children.

She needs a loan to purchase daily consumption products (soap, pasta, sugar, etc) so that she can offer a variety of products to her customers. She will also use the funds to acquire sewing materials to embroider blouses (thread and decorations for the blouses). She wants to continue growing her business and expanding her shop.

loans.use: to purchase soap, pasta, sugar, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando, de 22 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres, en compañía de sus 3 hermanos y padres a quienes apoya y quiere mucho. La actividad que realiza Fernando es la de electricista que consiste en realizar arreglos de equipos eléctricos, equipos de sonido entre otros. Aprendió este oficio estudiando en un centro de adiestramiento industrial.  Le gustó y decidió desarrollar esta función desde hace 02 años. Viendo que su mano de obra era requerida constantemente empezó a comprar los materiales básicos que se necesita para cumplir su labor con mejores resultados. Ahora trabaja con empresas privadas que necesitan de su servicio. Cuenta con la ayuda y complicidad de otro electricista quien le presta algunos equipos eléctricos con los que él no cuenta por ahora. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le ha permitido tener ingresos económicos sustanciales con el cual poder pagar los gastos propios de su hogar y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hermanos, lo que no le gusta de su actividad es el riesgo que implica su cumplimiento y tiene que estar hasta muy tarde en las noches para poder terminar y entregar los planos de electrificación que le piden en las fechas solicitadas. Estas horas de trabajo le han dado algunos malestares de salud, pero eso no lo desanima y sigue adelante. Desea instalar su propio taller de servicio eléctrico. En esta oportunidad solicitara s/. 2500; Por ello agradece la confianza y la ayuda que le brindan para que pueda concretar sus planes. Asimismo, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en su totalidad comprar herramientas de básicas de electrificación como pinzas, algunos cables de aislamiento y otros.
texts.en: Fernando is 22 years old. He is single and has no children. He lives in his parents' house with his 3 siblings and his parents whom he loves and supports very much. Fernando's activity is being an electrician. This consists of making repairs to electronic equipment, stereos and more. He learned this trade by going to an industrial training center. He liked it and has done this work for 2 years. Seeing that his labor was required constantly, he started to buy basic materials needed to do his work with the best results. Now he works with private companies that need his services. He has the help and support of another electrician who lends him electronic equipment that he doesn't have right now. What he likes about this activity is that it has allowed him to have substantial income with which he is able to pay for his own household expenses and give his siblings a better quality of life. What he doesn't like about his activity is the risk involved in its execution and he has to be working until very late at night to be able to finish and deliver electrical wiring plans by the date they are ordered. These work hours have caused him some health problems, but he is not discouraged and he keeps going forward. He wants to open his own electrical workshop. At this time, he will ask for s/. 2500. He is grateful for the confidence and help that has been given to him so that he can firm up his plans. In addition, he is committed to making his payments on time. With the loan he has asked for, he will invest everything in buying basic electrical tools such as pliers, some insulation cable and more.

loans.use: to buy electrical materials.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is 52 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Warlita runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like coffee, milk, sugar and other items to sell.

Warlita has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like coffee, milk, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 36 years old. He is a father of three children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production, he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase the farm's production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for use during maize production

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita sells vegetables, pork meat and fish in their village. She's working on hard on it while her husband is working on their farm. Anita drives her motorcycle with a side cart and roams around their village to sell. Her income is spent on the school allowances of her children. Her goal is to finish her children's education and become a professional someday. Anita is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy meat, fish, chicken and vegetables to sell. She hopes to gain more income to improve more of her business.

loans.use: to buy meat, fish, chicken and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 26-years-old. He is married with two children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production.  With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou previously accessed a 51,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for their personal, household and business expenditures.

Marilou would like to apply for another 51,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilou hopes that her business will last longer and dreams to always help her family. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

Note: All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her general store business.

loans.name: Vahram

texts.en:
Vahram is from Nor Amasia village of the Armavir region. He is an agronomist with many years of experience working in that field. Vahram runs a farm where he cultivates sunflowers, and he owns a grape orchard. Years of hard and tireless work gave Vahram the opportunity to become a specialized farmer. He produces a good harvest and sells it in the local market. High quality grapes which he gathers from his orchard are used in wine production and are highly demanded among local wine producers. 

Vahram applied for the loan to be able to enlarge his farm. By requesting this loan of USD 1,000, Vahram would like to pay for renovation of the greenhouse and also purchase fuel for organizing the cultivation process of the sunflowers. He took a loan before from a local financial institution, but unfortunately he wasn't able to pay it back; however, thanks to his hard work during recent times, Vahram has been able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. Therefore, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. The loan will be a great support for this hardworking farmer, as he will be able to ensure better living conditions for his family.

Vahram lives with his wife and three children (his son is in the photo).

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse and purchase fuel for organizing the cultivation process

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en: Chea is a young mother of one little kid originally from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To provide decent food for her child, she grows paddy rice on four hectares of land and works for others for a fee to earn additional income. Both of these businesses have earned her almost 40,000 KHR per day. Chea is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) whereas her co-borrower is a first-time borrower. The past loan has supported her business promptly and has returned a decent income to maintain her living conditions. Now, she and her joint borrower are seeking 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy potash for her crop. She hopes that she can gain triple yield better than last year.

loans.use: To buy potash for her crop

loans.name: Iris Ivon

texts.es:
Iris, tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula.
Ella se dedica a la venta de lácteos como quesos, mantequilla, huevos, frijoles y chicharrones. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 2 años en un local donde hay mas afluencia de clientes. El préstamo que solicita es por 25,000 lempiras para comprar quesos y frijoles y poder incrementar sus ventas.
Ella tiene como meta que su negocio crezca y se mantengan para poder seguir adelante y sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Iris is 28 years old. She is a single mother with two children who lives in the town of San Pedro Sula.  She sells dairy products such as cheese, butter and eggs as well as beans and pork rinds. For two years, she has had her business in a shop with more access to customers.

Iris is requesting a loan for 25,000 Lempira to purchase cheese and beans in order to increase her sales. 

Her goal is for her business to grow so that she can support herself and insure that she and her family continue to move forward.

loans.use: to purchase cheese and beans to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more gold scraps and jewelries for her business. Her loan is helpful not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy gold scraps and jewelry needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Susana hopes to have more customers and dreams to have a happy life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gold scraps and jewelry needed in her business.

loans.name: Iriana

texts.en:
Iriana is married and this is her first loan. She is applying for a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She sells second-hand clothes. She will use the loan to buy clothes such as shirts, long pants and shorts.
 
Iriana opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $200. She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy shirts, long pants and shorts.

loans.name: Marie Belle Group

texts.en:
Bassima is the featured borrower of the Marie Belle group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to develop their businesses and improve their families' socioeconomic situations.

Bassima is a 37-year-old married mother of three children who has been working as a tailor for seven years. Her acquired loan will be invested in re-starting her business, as it will enable her to buy a special updated tailoring machine. This will help her in responding quickly and professionally to her customers, who are very anxious to support her during her comeback. She will work hard on helping her beloved husband in improving their family's socioeconomic situation, since she stopped working for a while to take good care of her children. She'll start her business again from her house since she is not ready to open a separate shop outside her house.

Bassima is the first lady on the left. As for the other group members, Naziha is on the right with a pink top and Marcel is at the center.

loans.use: to re-start her business by buying a special updated tailoring machine which will help her in responding quickly and professionally to her customers

loans.name: Sinar Rejeki Group

texts.en:
Dewa Ayu is very greatfull. She earns more than the last period and she succeeds to make her payment to MUK on time and the group also make their payments. The payment is attended to by all member and they are enthusiastic to tell each other about their story to raising pigs.

Dewa Ayu, as the head, is fully responsible for the payment. One month earlier, she’s already made an announcement to the members about the payment day. Dewa Ayu sold her 3 pigs and earned a net profit of 1.500.000 IDR. She plans to continue the loan to expand her bussines. She will give mix feed to reduce the cost. She hopes she can earns more and increasing her saving.

Dewa Ayu, head of the Sinar Rejeki group, lead her members to receive their eight loans and continue the group with 5 members and total loan 7.500.000 IDR. The group set aside for saving in every profit they earned. They hope can have enough saving and run the bussines independently by the saving.
Dewa Ayu will use her loan to purchase 3 new piglets for fattening. She will sell them after 6 month. Dewa Ayu has a plan to build a new cage beside the old cage and she hopes she can increasing the population of her pigs.

loans.use: To buy three piglets

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.en: Nuriddin was born in a village that is located at the north part of Tajikistan. He is not married and does not have any children. He works in IMON International. He used to meet his family's needs using his salary, but later he found that his salary alone could not meet all his financial needs. That’s why he is asking for a loan of 7,000 Tajikistan Somoni (TJS) to buy building materials, such as cement, wood, and paints, for house repairs. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as cement, wood, and paints, for house repairs.

loans.name: Maria Rosela

texts.en:
Maria Rosela is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more grocery products for her variety store. Her loan is also helpful for the education of her children who are in college and high school, respectively. Her income from her business assists their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan so she can buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maria Rosela hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nang

texts.en:
Nang, aged twenty-seven, is an experienced farmer from the village of Trapeang Thum, Prasat Bakong district, Siem Reap. Nang lives with her husband and two children. She has worked in the agriculture business for more than ten years. Nang’s husband works in the construction sector as a constructor. He supplies workers for building and sometimes supplies, as a package, both materials and workers according to the client’s demand.

As the demand in Nang’s husband’s business is increasing, Nang is asking for a loan of USD 1,200 as a working capital to invest into the construction sector. This way, it will allow Nang’s husband to satisfy his clients' needs and improve income for the family. She and her family will be grateful to all the lenders for their goodwill in helping them develop their family-owned businesses.
