loans.use: to invest into the construction sector in order to satisfy her husband's clients' needs.

loans.name: Paul Clyde

texts.en: Paul Clyde is single with an only child, and makes a living by selling barbecue in their town. He earns well and was able to improve this business by repairing the shelter where he does business. He borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy raw ingredients and things used in making barbecue to offer more cooked and grilled foods. He wants to earn more income to save money that he can use in settling his own family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and things used in making barbecue

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child, in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials like fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Grace dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 25 years old. He would like to use Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to use during maize production.

loans.name: Hunan

texts.en:
Hunan is a 60-year-old farmer from the village of Artamet in the Armavir region. He lives with his family of five: his wife, son, daughter-in-law and two little grandchildren.

Hunan has been involved in agriculture for many years. He runs a livestock farm which includes two cows and two pigs and also cultivates wheat, tomatoes, watermelon and grass. He gathers the harvest and sells it in the local open markets. Hunan's son and daughter-in-law work at a local school and receive monthly income, but agriculture is the main stable source of income that helps the family cover its basic costs.  

Currently this hard working farmer and breadwinner of the family would like to enlarge his farm. The loan of USD 2,500 that Hunan has applied for will greatly assist him in purchasing six oxen and forage for feeding the livestock.

He will be very grateful to lenders for support.

loans.use: to pay for six oxen and forage for feeding livestock

loans.name: Cula

texts.en:
Cula is 50-years-old with three children, two of whom are in school.  Cula works very hard to provide for them.

Cula runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of mineral water, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

Cula has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Cula would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of mineral water, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Maria Suyapa

texts.es: María, tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. María se ha dedicado al comercio en la venta de ropa y sandalias y hace un año inicio con la elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz.  Ha decidido solicitar un segundo préstamo a ODEF por 8,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar ropa y sandalias para vender y entregar pedidos y también harina de maíz para la elaboración de tortillas. Su objetivo es hacer crecer el negocio para obtener mejores ingresos y brindar bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old, a single mother and has three children. She lives in a village in the municipality of Arizona, Atlántida.  Maria has been working as a vendor selling clothing and sandals, and a year ago began making and selling corn tortillas. 

She has decided to request a second loan from ODEF for 8,000 lempiras with which she is going to buy clothing and sandals to sell and to fill orders, and also corn flour for making tortillas. 

Her aim is to see her business grow so that she can obtain better income and provide family well-being.

loans.use: To purchase corn flour for making tortillas, as well as merchandise such as clothing and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Jackelyn De La Cruz

texts.es:
Jackelyn, es madre de dos hijos de 10 y 5 años de edad, se esposo trabaja en la agricultura, por la necesidad de tener más ingresos para darle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida se dedica a la venta de tortillas y verduras, es un oficio que aprendió de su mamá.
Adquirirá maíz, leña, gas propano y variedad de verduras, lo que le facilitara el fortalecimiento de su negocio, atraerá más clientes, mejorara sus ganancias, cancelara sus deudas y podrá cancelar puntualmente las cuotas de sus crédito.
Aspira a tener un negocio mucho más competitivo para tener los recursos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jackelyn is the mother of two children, aged 10 and 5. Her husband works as a farmer. Out of a need to have more income to give her family a better lifestyle, she sells tortillas and vegetables. It is a trade she learned from her mother. 

She will acquire corn, firewood, propane gas, and a variety of vegetables. This will facilitate her fortification of her business, attract more customers, improve her earnings, pay off her debts, and make her payments on time.  

She aspires to having a much more competitive business to to have the resources she needs so she can have an opportunity to improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to acquire corn, firewood, propane gas, and a variety of vegetables.

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia is 31 years old and she is married. She is now applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $20. She earns a good income from her business.

Irenia will use her loan to buy some stocks to keep in her store such as cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, body lotion and beer. She is a very hard-working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, body lotion and beer.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: Joana is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is married and is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, tea and biscuits. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600. She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: to buy  noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, tea and biscuits.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira, a 31-year-old hard-working woman, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, two sons, and daughter. The daughter and both sons are studying, and her husband is an auto barber. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Samira is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. 

She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. Samira has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for the future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Babek

texts.en: Babek is 51 years old, married, and raising four children together with his wife. His wife is a housewife, and his children attend school. To provide the primary income for his family, he is involved in animal husbandry, having started 30 years ago. Thanks to Babek's hard work, today his business contains one dairy cows and two calves. Babek and his family already prepared one ton of barley and eight tons of corn. Babek sells 20 liters of milk daily to distributors. The monthly income amounts to 150 AZN. Now, Babek requested a loan of 500 AZN from the Aqroinvest CU to buy feed for his cows. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy feed for his cows.

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.ru: Mahammad was born in Baku region in 1969 year. Now he is married and father of two children. One of his children is 17 age, he is go to 11 class of school and preparation to University. Daughter goes to musical college. She is so talented girl, play on piano and in the future she wants to be a famous musician. His wife is a teacher for long years and Mahammad is a taxi driver. He transported passenger between various locations of Baku region. He is hardworking man and loves his job. Now he needs a loan amount of 800 AZN(Azerbaijan New Manat). Therefore he was applied to Komak company. With this loan he wants to buy new winter wheels and anti-crash chain. Thus he wants to reduce the risk of accidents. Mahammad thankfull to Kiva organization and lenders for help. In the future he wants to change his car.
texts.en: Mahammad was born near Baku in 1969.  These days, he's married and has two children (a son and a daughter).  His son is 17 and finishing up secondary school with plans to go to college, while his daughter is already in college and majoring in music; she is very talented, and hopes to one day become a famous musician.  His wife is a teacher and has been working as one for several years, whereas Mahammad is a taxi driver.  He does his best to transport passengers in and around the vicinity of Baku, and loves his job.  At the moment, he is in need of a loan (800 AZN) to buy new winter tires and an anti-crash chain for his taxi to make his taxi safer and reduce the risk of accidents.  Eventually, Mahammad would also like to get a new taxi.  He is grateful to Kiva and their lending partners for making it easier for him to secure a loan.

loans.use: to buy new winter tires and an anti-crash chain for his taxi.

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en:
Han, age 46 and a mother of four kids, is a citizen from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Nowadays, only one son is living with her and helping the family’s business. The two hectares of rice farming and the paid-working job are the main sources of her income. Han, a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), has repaid her past loans completely, and it has improved her lifestyle better than before.

Now, she leads a group composing of three female borrowers to get a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She and one of her co-borrowers are seeking 1,400,000 KHR, whilst the remaining member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for reaping fees. She hopes that she can harvest her crop on time with a high selling price, then she can continue to grow bean instead, to earn more income.

loans.use: to pay for reaping fee.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña Elena de 36 años, casada y tiene una hija, quien ya estudia,  su esposo se dedica a la venta de carbón por quintal en diferentes lugares, doña Elena tiene una tienda de consumo diario desde hace 18 años, que heredo de su mama, ahora ella ayuda a su esposo con las ganancias del mismo, ella vende en su tienda, arroz, azúcar, maíz por libra y quintal, golosinas, aguas gaseosas, jugos, también productos lácteos, doña Elena atiende de lunes a sábado de 6 de la mañana, a 9 de la noche, los domingos le paga a una señora para que atienda, doña Elena se siente feliz y satisfecha por los logros que ha tenido,Y gracias al apoyo de kiva y espera seguir ayudando  a su esposo con la economía y mejorar su vivienda ya ha travajado varios creditos en kiva y es una buena persona puntual y responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Elena is 36, married and has a daughter who already goes to school. Her husband sells charcoal by the quintal (a quintal is about 100 lb) in various places. Elena has had a grocery store for 18 years which he inherited from her mother. Now she helps her husband with the earnings from it. 

In her store she sells rice, sugar, corn by the pound and quintal, candy, soft drinks, juices, and also dairy products. Elena runs the store from Monday to Saturday from 6:00 in the morning to 9:00 in the evening. On Sundays she pays a woman to run it. 

Elena feels happy and satisfied with the achievements she has had thanks to Kiva's support. She hopes to continue helping her husband with the finances and improving her home. She has taken out various loans with Kiva and is a fine individual– on time and responsible with her payments.

loans.use: To buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Suyapa

texts.es: Suyapa,tiene 56 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, y vive con ellos en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Hace un año que ella se dedica a vender ropa nueva y usada, para damas, caballeros y niños, como ser blusas, pantalones, camisas etc. El negocio lo tiene en su casa. Ha decidido solicitar 5,000 Lempiras para surtir con nuevos productos de la temporada como vestidos, ropa de niños, jeans, camisetas y otros y aprovechar la época navideña para aumentar las ventas. Su meta a futuro es poner una tiendita de novedades y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Suyapa is 56 years old, a single mother with four children, and lives with them in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. 

She has been selling new and used clothing for a year: clothing for women, men, and children, such as blouses, pants, shirts, etc. She has her business in her home. 

She has decided to request 5,000 lempiras to stock her business with new seasonal products such as dresses, children's clothing, jeans, T-shirts and other items. This to take advantage of the Christmas season for increasing her sales. 

Her future goal is to have a small notions store and for her and her family to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To stock her business with new seasonal products such as dresses, children's clothing, jeans, T-shirts and other items.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en:
Elvis previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that he used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for his children’s education, and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.
 
He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for him to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. His profits from business will definitely help sustain his family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Elvis hopes to have another branch and dreams that his children will finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to his inventory.

loans.name: Doeng's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Doeng is 39 years old and has five children. To make a living, she has been planting pineapple and farming rice for 12 years. The current business earns about 75,000 KHR per day for her to meet the family's needs. 

Doeng has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan, which has helped her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her pineapple. She hopes this loan will enable her earn more income from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Lydie

texts.fr: Lydie est une femme de 45 ans mariée mère de 6 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 10 et 25 ans.Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (maniocs, plantains, noix de palmes et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis quelques années. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterait acheter un pick up des régimes de plantains et bananes pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Lydie is a 45-year old woman. She is married and has six children ranging from 10 to 25 years of age. She is a vendor and has been working for some years selling staple foods (manioc/cassava, plantains, palm nuts and fruits), according to the season, at a local market. She knows the suppliers well, and she knows her customers as she has been able to grow her customer base thanks to her long experience. However, she keeps running out of stock because she is forced to sell all her  produce before restocking, given her small working capital. She would like to buy a  truckload of banana bunches in order to have a large stock, which will allow her to meet customer demand and avoid running out of produce for sale. She will save her revenues in order to not only expand her business but also provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy a truckload of plantains and bananas.

loans.name: Marnia

texts.en: Marnia is applying for a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is married and has one child. She is running a business in front of her house by washing cars. She is making a good income from her car washing business and she wants to buy water pipe and hose with the loan. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to her car wash every day. She ran her business a year ago with her own working capital. Her husband is a driver.

loans.use: To buy water pipe and hose

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle works hard to support her family. Annabelle is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines.

Annabelle requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients, such as yeast, milk, sugar, flour, etc.

Annabelle has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients, such as yeast, milk, sugar, flour, etc. fr her Bakery.

loans.name: Dúo Los Eucaliptos Group

texts.es: Dúo Eucalipto, esta conformado por la señora elida bricelda se dedica a la venta de producto comestibles desde hace 3 años,ella tiene 5 hijos ( de 18,15,13,8,6 años respectivamente,)los cuales estudian, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles y surtir un poco mas su tienda para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Duo Eucalipto includes Elida Bricelda. She has worked selling groceries for the past three years. She has five children (18, 15, 13, 8, 6 years old respectively), who study. On this occasion, she is applying for this loan for the purchase of grocery products and to stock her store a little more to have better profits.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, se dispone a surtir el inventario de su sastrería por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar telas, botones, zippers y una nueva máquina de coser industrial, para mejorar la producción de su negocio.
Para Víctor el crédito anterior le ayudo tener los materiales necesarios para trabajar por un tiempo sin limitantes para entregar sus encargos, su economía ha mejorado y le brinda a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Victor is getting ready to stock the inventory of his tailor shop, and for this reason he is applying for a new loan to buy fabrics, buttons, zippers, and a new industrial sewing machine, in order to improve the production of his business.

The previous loan helped Victor to have the necessary materials to work for a time without limitations in order to deliver his orders. His economy has improved, and he is offering his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, buttons, zippers, and a new industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en:
Jean Paul is 33 years old. He is married with four children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Kassin

texts.en:
Kassin is 61 years old. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers to use during maize production.

loans.name: Angela Oneyda

texts.es: Ángela, tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos a su cargo y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al negocio, anteriormente vendía pan, y hace dos años inicio con la venta de golosinas, ella las prepara en su casa y vende de manera ambulante, tiene una galera frente a una maquila, elabora pastelitos de harina de maíz rellenos de carne, tacos, horchata, tamales y jugo de naranja. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo que es por 5,000 Lempiras para ampliar su actividad de negocio, piensa en vender almuerzos y desayunos también, para eso comprara los insumos como carnes, arroz, frijoles, manteca, condimentos etc. El plan que tiene es aumentar el negocio aprovechar a vender mas comida y en un futuro piensa instalar una glorieta para la venta de variedad de comidas.
texts.en:
Ángela is 54 years old, a single mother, and has two children in her care. She lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. She has always worked as a vendor; previously she sold bread and two years ago started selling candy–she prepares it in her home and sells it as a street vendor. 

She has a stand in front of a manufacturing plant, and makes pastries made from corn flour and filled with meat, horchata (traditional drink made from jicaro seeds ground with rice and spices), tamales and orange juice. She is requesting a second loan, this one for 5,000 lempiras, in order to expand her business. 

She is thinking about selling lunches and breakfast also, and for this will buy the ingredients such as meats, rice, beans, lard, condiments, etc. The plan she has is to increase her business, taking advantage of the opportunity to sell more food. Someday she hopes to set up an eatery selling a variety of meals.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as meats, rice, beans, lard, condiments, etc. for making meals and selling them.

loans.name: Leodan

texts.es: Leodan de 37 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar y se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 12 años. Cultiva principalmente maíz, frijoles, tomates y  chiles y de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales construyendo un cuarto dormitorio ya que su casa es pequeña y no hay espacio suficiente. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, arena, cemento y hierro para comenzar la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Leodan, 37, has been living in his own house along with his family and he has working in agriculture for the past 12 years. He mainly grows corn, beans, tomatoes and chilies. In this manner, he earns a living and brings sustenance to his home. He wishes to improve his living conditions, constructing a bedroom given that his house is small and there is not enough space.

He is applying for this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of bricks, sand, cement and iron in order to begin construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy: bricks, sand, cement and iron to build a room.

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.ru:
Этого молодого и начинающего бизнесмена зовут Абдукарим. Ему 22 года. Абдукарим житель села района Кубодиен. Он собирается заниматься скотоводством. Свою деятельность он будет реализовать дома. Для его скотов у него имеется коровник. Абдукарим планирует разводить барашек. Многие жители сел и деревень в Таджикистане занимаются животноводством и растениеводством. И Абдукарим не уступает своим соотечественникам. Он будет приобретать скотов на скотном рынке своего района, и будет кормить и содержать в коровнике. 
  На данный момент он уже приобрел двух барашек. Но для начала бизнеса животноводство такое количество скотов не достаточно и Абдукарим просит кредит, чтобы купить еще несколько голов баранов. Он верит в Вашу поддержку и понимания.
texts.en: The name of this budding entrepreneur is Abdukarim. He is 22 years old. Abdukarim lives in a village in the Qubadiyon region. He intends to launch a livestock business. He plans to do it at his home. He has a cow stall by his house. Abdukarim plans to raise sheep. Many rural residents in Tajkistan raise livestock and grow produce. Abdukarim also wants to follow this local tradition. He will buy sheep at the animal market in his region and will fatten them, keeping them in a stall. He already has two sheep. But this is not enough of a livestock to launch his business. Abdukarim is asking for a loan in order to buy several additional sheep. He counts on your support and understanding.

loans.use: to but two sheep.

loans.name: Cimi

texts.es: Cimi, de 49 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos a quienes les brinda mucho amor, actualmente vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo y sus pequeños luchando por salir adelante. El trabajo de Cimi consiste en el corte y confección de prendas de vestir, tiene un taller en su casa y lleva realizando este trabajo hace 17 años, todo lo que sabe lo aprendió trabajando desde joven como empleada de una señora que se dedicaba a este oficio, poco a poco y con mucha paciencia fue conociendo sobre técnicas de costura y decidió independizarse para generar sus propios ingresos poniendo en práctica todo lo que le enseñó su empleadora de aquel entonces. Actualmente forma parte de un taller de costura que estableció con una socia. Durante el tiempo que está dedicada a esta actividad siempre ha buscado la mejor forma para realizar su trabajo ya que muchas veces la presión de sus clientes la ha llevado a sentir que no iba a poder cumplir eficientemente su labor, sin embargo le hizo frente a las adversidades y actualmente tiene planes de expansión para su negocio, pero sabe que el camino para lograrlo es largo y por el momento desea mantenerlo como una meta a largo plazo, ahora se preparará para empezar a confeccionar sus propios diseños y venderlos ya que tiene pedidos de sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1800, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable.Con el monto solicitado implementará su taller de costura comprando telas, agujas, hilos y otros accesorios que necesita para continuar con su trabajo de confecciones.
texts.en: Cimi, who is 49 years old, is married and has two children, to whom she offers much love. She now lives in a rented house along with her husband and her little ones, striving to advance. Cimi's work consists of making articles of clothing. She has a workshop in her home, and she has been doing this work for 17 years. Everything that she knows she learned by working since she was a young woman as an employee of a woman who worked in this occupation. Little by little and with much patience, she learned the techniques of dressmaking and decided to become independent to generate her own income, putting into practice everything that her employer taught her up to that time. Now she is part of a sewing workshop that she established with a partner. During the time that she has done this work, she has always searched for the best way to do her work, since many times the pressure of her customers has made her feel that she was not going to be able to complete her work efficiently. Nevertheless, she has coped with adversities, and now she has plans to expand her business, but she knows that the road to achieve this is long, and for the moment she wants to keep this as a long-term goal. Now she will prepare to begin to make her own designs and sell them, since she has orders from her customers. At this time she is applying for 1800 PEN. She is very happy to know that there are people who will offer her financial backing to continue developing her business. She also promises to be a punctual and responsible partner. With the amount she has applied for, she will stock her sewing workshop by buying fabrics, needles, threads, and other accessories that she needs in order to continue with her dressmaking work.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking materials such as fabrics, needles, threads, and other accessories.

loans.name: Rovshen

texts.en:
Rovshen is 45 years old, married, with 3 kids ages 3, 9, and 11. Seven years ago, he decided to open a business so that he could support his family. He works together with his two assistants in a small cafeteria, which he built through hard work and sacrifice. His business is well known due to its strategic location and good service.

Rovshen's biggest dream is to expand his business so that he can service more customers. Therefore, he has applied for a loan 600 azn to remodel and buy inventory. Rovshen awaits your support

loans.use: to remodel and buy inventory for his cafe.

loans.name: Niyamaddin

texts.en:
Niyamaddin is 36 years old and married, with three kids. 

He has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than seven years. He is very hard-working and passionate about his work. He considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumbers and to plant fruit trees with his wife. 

He sells his crops in the central bazaar to make profits, in order to support his family. Niyamaddin ’s income from business is AZN 80. 

In order to improve the living conditions of his family, he plans to expand his business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. 

He needs a loan of AZN 700. This loan is for buying more fertilizer and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to obtain more revenue in the coming winter, which will help him to cover his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy more new fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en:
Mehman is 57 years of age and married. He and his wife are raising four children. 

Mehman's economic activity is his grocery store near his house, where he sells different kinds of food. His project is going well, but it needs financial support for further developing. 

Now, Mehman is requesting a loan of AZN1,500 to add to the stock of merchandise in his store. With the received amount, he will buy items such as rice, dairy products, snacks, and other products. He will enlarge his store and attract more customers.

Mehman plans to increase his turnover gradually and invest the profits in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more products such as rice, dairy products, and snacks

loans.name: Malik

texts.en: Malik is a hardworking man. He lives with his wife and 2 children. He is the only bread-winner of his family as his wife Halicha does not have her own business. She helps Malik with managing his business. Malik grows vegetables and crops on rented land. Malik’s sons help him to grow vegetables. He works hard but his income still is not enough for improving living conditions for his family. He must sow crops, but he does not have enough money. He is asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, and to pay for rent of land. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, and to pay for rent of land

loans.name: Ana Delmi

texts.es: Ana de 41 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su hijo desde  hace mucho tiempo. Ana es una mujer emprendedor quien todos los días sale a las calles de las principales colonias de su localidad para vender hojas de huerta las cuales son muy demandadas por sus vecinos ya que son  útiles para la elaboración de tamales (comida típica elaborada a base de masa de maíz, carne y verduras).  Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir su casa la cual necesita algunas mejoras. Actualmente el baño sanitario está cubierto a base de plástico lo cual no es muy seguro y desea cambiarlo. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento y arena con el fin de dar solución lo antes posible y contar con mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Ana, 41, has been living in her own house along with her child for a long time. Ana is an enterprising woman who, every day, goes to the streets of the main neighborhoods of her area to sell banana leaves, which are in high demand by her neighbors. They are useful for making tamales (a typical food made out of corn, meat and vegetables). 

With much effort, she has achieved constructing her house, which needs some improvements. Currently the bathroom area is enclosed in plastic sheeting, which is not very secure and she wishes to change it. For the aforementioned, she is applying for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of bricks, cement and sand in order to solve the problem as soon as possible and have better security.

loans.use: Para comprar: ladrillo, cemento y arena para construir baño.

loans.name: Dúo La Ahorradita Group

texts.es:
DUO LA AHORRADITA
La señora Miriam quien es propietaria de una venta de ropa americana y venta de juguetes americanos es madre de 2 hijos los cuales uno de ellos tiene en el colegio y el otro es una nena de apenas 2 actualmente se dedica a atender un negocio el cual está ubicado en el mercado de ciudad peronia en el cual vende variedad de ropa americana de niños y adultos ella desde ya hace más de un año se motivo a aperturar  su propio negocio ya que ella tiene muchos sueños y metas que desea cumplir no solo para ella si no que también para su familia ya que desea lo mejor y poder brindarles un mejor estilo de vida a los mismos. Y es por eso que ella toca las puertas de kiva para poder adquirir un crédito en el cual desea invertir un lote completo de zapato americano ya que en vista de las fechas que se asercan son muy buenas para poder trabajar y administrar la venta de zapato americano, esperando que le puedan ayudar en su negocio.
texts.en:
La Ahorradita Team: Miriam, who is the owner of an American clothing business and an American toy business, is a single mother of two children. She has one of them in school and the other is a little girl, just two years old. Currently, she works tending to a business, which is located in the Peronia city market where she sells a variety of American clothing for kids and adults.

For more than a year, she has been motivated to open her own business given that she has many dreams and goals that she wants to achieve, not only for her but also for her family. She wants the best and to be able to give them a better lifestyle.

For this reason, she knocks on the door of Kiva in order to be able to acquire a loan which she wishes to invest in a complete storefront for American shoes. Given that the holidays approach, it is really good to be able to work and manage the sale of American shoes, hoping that you can help her in her business.

loans.use: to buy second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anyar Sari 2 Group

texts.en:
As agreed, the Anyar Sari 2  Group made their loan payment on time. During the loan period, they managed the pigs well. With the instructions from their Veterinarian, the group kept the pigs and gave them nutritious feed and vitamins.

Ni Made sold her three piglets and earned a net profit of 1.5M IDR after deducting the cost of feed and making her payment. She’s really happy with that and decided to continue her loan to increase her pig population. All the profit was used for her family's daily needs and school fees.

After calculating and evaluating the last loan period, the Anyar Sari 2 group decided to continue with another loan. The loan will be used to increase their pig businesses by purchasing new piglets and quality feed. This time, three members resigned for various reasons and the group has one new member. The group received 28M IDR, with each member receiving 3.5M IDR.

Ni Made used her loan to purchase three super quality piglets for fattening. With her own money, she purchased feed and renovated her cage. She plans to sell the pigs near the holidays to get a good price. She hopes her plan works well. She and the group still need advice and loan support for their businesses until they are ready and have enough capital to continue the businesses by themselves.

loans.use: to purchase three super quality piglets.

loans.name: Cyprien

texts.en:
Cyprien is 29 years old. He has been a farmer for the past six years. With the loan, He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married with one child and her child goes to school. She has a clothing boutique business and had been in this business for 4 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of clothes. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity.   She works in a shop and sells on retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of low interest charged. She resides in rented house and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en:
Phylis is 57 years old and her spouse adds additional income to the family. She supports three adults. She has been in business for 17 years and earns a monthly income of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She will use the loan to enlarge her farming.

This is her third loan with KADET LTD, of which she repaid the previous loan successfully. Her dreams and hopes in future are to live a sustainable life.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Shamsy

texts.en:
Shamsy is 54 years old. She is widowed and has four children who are adults. Her children have their own jobs, but Shamsy wants to have her own business because she needs the money. 

Shamsy decided to start new business in animal husbandry in order to generate an income that she can contribute to her home’s finances. She studied at the course of "To Get Ahead" of a women's organization and got enough skills about the business.  Her children will help her with it. 

She will be very successful business woman as she is hard-working and smart. She is asking for a loan of TJS 1,300 to buy cattle for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to start a business in animal husbandry

loans.name: Maria Marleny

texts.es:
María, se dedica  a vender ropa para apoyar con los gastos de su hogar, vive con sus tres hijos de 13, 9 y 5 años de edad, su negocio lo emprendió por su cuenta, lo hace de forma ambulante ya tiene 2 años de poseerlo lo que la da suficiente experiencia par a administrarlo.
Comprará variedad de ropa para caballeros, damas y niños, con el fin de preparar su inventario para estas fechas de fin de año lo que le da oportunidad de crecer con su negocio, espera aumentar sus ganancias para pagar las deudas.
Sueña con tener un puesto en el mercado de su localidad y darles a sus hijos mejores condiciones como una buena alimentación, vestuario y educación.
texts.en:
Maria sells clothing to support her household expenses and lives with her three children, ages 13, 9, and 5.  She set up her business on her own and sells on foot.  She has had it for two years and has enough experience managing it.

She will buy a variety of clothing for ladies and children so she can stock up for the end of year season, which will give her the opportunity to grow her business and increase her income so she can pay off her debts.

She hopes to have a stall in the local market and provide better living conditions, food, dress, and education for her children

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: María Elía

texts.es:
María de 30años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado de educación básica, siempre se ha dedicado al trabajo de campo; está casada y su compañero de vida se dedica a la albañilería, sus tres hijas viven junto con ellos, pero de ellos solo la de 8 años está estudiando y aspira a ser profesional. La mayor de las hijas le ayuda a su mamá en los trabajos de oficios domésticos. También vive su mamá con ellos, que contribuye a la vez en los quehaceres de la casa.

María es una mujer completamente de campo, entregada al cultivo del maíz, actividad que aprendió con sus padres desde temprana edad  y que seguirá ejecutando hasta que Dios así se lo permita trabajando de sol a sol.  Las tierras que ellos alquilan para poder cultivar quedan a 500 metros aproximadamente desde su vivienda

Ella ha solicitado el préstamo pues necesita realizar todas las actividades posteriores a la cosecha del maíz, como lo son el desgrane, almacenado del grano y la picada de zacate para la venta. Esto les ayudara a realizar una buena actividad agrícola, sin poner en riesgo el dinero destinado para los gastos familiares y de esta manera estarán más tranquilos con su producción.

María sueña con tener sus propios terrenos y animales , de esta manera crecer productivamente para ver que sus hijos crezcan sanamente y logren establecer familias estables que contribuyan con el desarrollo social y productivo de la comunidad.
texts.en:
María is 30-years old.  She went to school through three years of primary school.  She has always made her living working in the fields.  María is married, and her husband makes his living in construction.  Their three children live with them, but only their 8-year old daughter goes to school and wants to have a career one day.  The eldest daughter helps María with the household chores.  María's mother lives with them as well, and she also helps out around the house.

María is a completely country woman who is dedicated to growing corn.  She learned the skill from her parents at a young age, and she will keep at it day after day as long as G-d allows it.  The land that they rent for their crops is located about 500 meters from their home. 

María has requested a loan because she needs to carry out the post-harvest activities for the corn, such as husking, storing the grain and cutting grass for sale.  The loan will allow them to complete this agricultural activity without putting the money they have set aside for the family's expenses at risk.  And that will lessen the stress of their work. 

María hopes to one day have her own land and animals.  That would allow her to grow her business and see her children grow up healthy and have their own, stable families that would contribute to the social development and productivity of the community.

loans.use: to carry out the post-harvest activities for their corn, such as husking, storing the grain and cutting grass for sale.

loans.name: Domingo Ramón

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Estrella  Del Mar  se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive Don Domingo, tiene  60 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos  mayores e independientes. Su esposa es ama de casa.
El señor Domingo tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende productos   como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, ciertos artículos de bazar, helados entre otras cosas, a pesar de que su tienda es pequeña sus clientes consiguen de todo, ese es el éxito para que tantos clientes,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposa le acompaña y le ayuda cuando él tiene que realizar otras actividades, tiene su negocio 7 años y que gracias  a él salen adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos. Lleva tres ciclos en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Estrella  Del Mar" (Star of the Sea) meet every two weeks in the beautiful coastal area of San Mateo in the city of Manta.  Manta is known for its lovely beaches that are visited all year round by both national and foreign tourists.  The majority of the area's residents make their livings in fishing and sea-related work.
This is where don Domingo lives.  He is 60-years old and married.  He and his wife had five children who are now grown and live on their own.  His wife is a home-maker.  
Señor Domingo has a general store set up in his home.  He sells products such as rice, sugar, cooking oils, detergents, some convenience items and ice-cream, among other items.  Even though his store is small, his customers can find whatever they may need- which is the secret to his success in having so many customers.  Señor Domingo works every day from 6:00am until 8:00pm, and sometimes even later.  His wife works with him and helps out when he has other things he needs to do.  Señor Domingo has had his business for seven years, and thanks to it, they have been able to get ahead. 
Señor Domingo is going to use this loan to stock up his store even more.  He is going to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents and other products.  He has been with the communal bank for three lending cycles.  He likes it because the loans are helpful.  Señor Domingo's goals are to keep moving forward with his business and for his store to grow, day by day.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents and other products.

loans.name: Ramel

texts.en: Ramel is married with two children and is a resident of Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. He runs a service-based business providing motorcycle transportation in their community to make a living. He has been doing this for more than three years while his wife works as a teacher. He borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to repair the motorcycle he uses in his transportation business. He wants to have a better life in the near future.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Liber Feligia

texts.es:
Liber es una mujer de 48 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato en secretariado comercial, es madre soltera y ha tenido que velar para que sus hijos tengan siempre lo necesario.  Aparte de sus hijos, su hermana también vive en la casa, ella le tiene un gran cariño y por eso siempre le brinda apoyo incondicional. De ella solo depende el hijo menor, pues las dos hermanas mayores ya trabajan y cubren con sus propios gastos.

La cliente es una persona esforzada que siempre piensa en el bienestar de su familia, por lo tanto ha tenido que trabajar arduamente. Se ha desempeñado básicamente, como ordenanza en diversas instituciones, actualmente lo es de un liceo adventista, donde le va bien pues no queda muy lejos de su casa y por lo tanto su único medio de transporte son sus dos pies, ya hace 6 años que la contrataron y espera seguir por mucho más tiempo. A parte de su empleo,  Liber los días domingos  hace los oficios domésticos en casa de una profesora, y esto le ayuda a conseguir un dinerito extra para el hogar.

La cliente necesita el préstamo para cubrir con los gastos de graduación de su hija, quien ha culminado sus estudios de técnico en computación en la Universidad. Siempre ha soñado con ver a sus hijos superarse y con trabajo duro y siempre poniendo a Dios en primer lugar. Lo que aspira es ver el momento, cuando su hija suba a la tarima y reciba por parte de los delegados, el título que la acredita como profesional 

Liber, planea seguir trabajando hasta cuando Dios se lo permita y de esta manera apoyar a sus hijos para que sigan adelante y logren ser buenos profesionales, para así poder asistir a todas las graduaciones y logros que alcancen.
texts.en:
Liber is a 48 year old woman who completed her technical degree to be a commercial secretary. She is a single mother who has had to watch carefully to make sure her children always have the necessities. Apart from her children, her sister also lives in the house. Her sister has great affection for her and has always given her unconditional support. Only her youngest son depends on her since the two older daughters are already working and cover their own expenses. 

The client is a strong person who always thinks of the well-being of her family, therefore she has had to work arduously. She has basically worked as an administrative assistant in various institutions, presently in an Adventist high school. She does well there, and it isn't far from her house since her only method of transportation are her two feet. It's already been six years since they hired her, and she hopes to continue for much longer. Aside from her job, Liber performs household chores on Sundays in the house of a professor. This helps her earn extra money for the home.

The client needs the loan to cover the costs of her daughter's graduation who has completed her information technology degree at the university. She has always dreamed of seeing her children surpass her with hard work and always putting God first. What she aspires to see is the moment when her daughter climbs the platform and receives from the delegates the degree that authorizes her as a professional. Liber plans to continue working as long as God allows her. In this way she plans to support her children so that they continue forward and achieve becoming good professionals, and to be able to attend all the graduations and achievements they reach.

loans.use: to cover the graduation costs for her daughter who has completed her information technology degree at the university.

loans.name: Aya Al Kematiyeh Group

texts.en:
Simar is the featured borrower of Aya Al Kematiyeh group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to support their families in a well managed way. They have always been neighbors and friends. That's why they trust each other and put their hands together to acquire the current loan.

Simar is a 56-year-old married mother of five children. She has been working in preparing and selling Mouneh (conserved food) and selling clothes from her house for twenty years. She is well known in her domain with the good quality of products she serves in addition to the competitive prices she provides to her customers.

Today, Simar is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to improve, develop, and expand both businesses with the necessary requested items. For conserving food, she has to buy current-season fruits and vegetables and work on conserving them for other seasons, and she will increase her clothes merchandise with a new winter collection, especially for the Holy Christmas season celebrations to fulfill customers' needs and requests. She hopes to be capable of expanding her businesses more  and moving them outside her house in the future.

Simar is the first lady from the right side of the picture. As for the other members, Roudaina is the second from the right, Amal is the second from the left with a black veil with white spots covering her hair, and Zeinab is the first from the left side.

loans.use: to buy current season fruits and vegetables and to increase her clothes merchandise

loans.name: Ulviyya

texts.en: Ulviyya is a 25-year-old single, young client. She lives with her parents in Agdas region. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables and fruits to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. In this business her mother is also helping her. Her monthly profit from this business is 100 Azerbaijani new manat (AZN). Ulviyya has requested a loan of 1,200 AZN to buy chemicals, fertilizers and seeds. With her profits, Ulviyya hopes to support her family and improve her plantation.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Alex Antonio

texts.es: El joven Alex de la de edad de 38 años, es la cabeza de la familia es casado, su esposa es ama de casa, ambos procrearon dos hijos de los cuales uno está en edad escolar y el menor aun esta pequeño, como padre su prioridad es el bienestar de sus hijos, por eso trabaja a diario vendiendo calzado movilizándose a los alrededores de los departamentos y dentro de la ciudad de Managua, para poder vender la mayor parte de su mercadería. Solicita el apoyo de crédito para abastecerse de chinelas, sandalias para damas y caballeros, los cuales son los productos que comercializa. Alex tiene muchas ilusiones para en un futuro tener su propio establecimiento fijo en algún mercado de la capital.
texts.en: Alex is 38 years old and is the head of his family.  He is married, and his wife is a stay-at-home mother.  They have two children, one of whom is in school while the other is still very young. As a father, his priority is the well-being of his children.  For this reason he works every day selling shoes, travelling around to the surrounding areas and in the city of Managua, so that he can sell the majority of his merchandise.  He is requesting a loan to supply himself with sandals for women and men, which are the products that he sells. Alex dreams of one day having his own stall in one of the markets in the capital.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Joy Ann

texts.en: Joy Ann owns and operates a general store and has been selling grocery goods for more than seven years, earning for the family. She was able to repay her previous loans from GDMPC successfully. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to resell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Linah is 35 years old and supports four adults. Her spouse adds additional support to the family. They are blessed with two children, aged 11 and 9 years. She has been in the business for seven years and her monthly income is 8,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She wants to buy cereals, especially maize, for sale.

She will use the anticipated profits to build rental houses, pay school fees and employ some workers. This is her third loan with KADET LTD, of which she repaid the previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy cereals for sale

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 56 years old. He is the father of seven children; they all go to school. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.  

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Maximilla's Group

texts.en:
Imani Farmers is a group of nine group-leader farmers in the Chwele District, with Maximilla selected as the Kiva group representative.  

Maximilla has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 76 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here, but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Maximilla is a reliable member of the community.  She is married with four children.  Maximilla is 40 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 18 years to support her family.  In addition to this, Maximilla is very active in her community and is involved in activities such as women's group.  

She described her harvest last year as good and hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund enjoying the success she is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.							

Maximilla joined One Acre Fund in 2010, and she is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Maximilla joined One Acre Fund so that she could earn enough to feed family and send children to school.  

Because she wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers, Maximilla has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Maximilla's life because she has more profits from her harvest.  In the future, Maximilla hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send children to school.  							

Maximilla and the Imani Farmers Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo, standing on the left.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Andrew's Group

texts.en:
Chepsitat is a group of nine group leader farmers in the Chwele District with Andrew selected as the Kiva group representative. 

Andrew joined One Acre Fund because he wants to promote the area he lives in. He has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 82 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here, but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Andrew is a reliable member of the community, and  he is married with no children.  Andrew is 39 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 20 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Andrew is very active in his community and is involved in activities such as the men's group, prayer group and burial committee. Andrew is also involved in the community's public barazas.  

He described his harvest last year as excellent and hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and enjoy the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.

Andrew first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Andrew joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed the family.  

He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  

Andrew plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to repair his home, save for the future, buy a cow, and invest in a business.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Andrew’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest, more farm training, more farm group support, able to save money and feed the family.

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Andrew and the Chepsitat Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continue providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo.

loans.use: To buy hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 15 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school, Norma works very hard to provide for them.

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, rice, eggs, sugar, groceries, etc..

Norma has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Norma would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, rice, eggs, sugar, and other groceries

loans.name: Nurfrederie

texts.en:
Nurfrederie works hard to support her family. Nurfrederie is widowed and has a tailoring shop business in the Philippines.

Nurfrederie has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like fabric, sewing machines and thread.

Nurfrederie has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Nurfrederie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like fabric, sewing machines, thread, etc.

loans.name: Luyen

texts.en:
Hanh was born in 1994. She lives in Bac Ninh with her parents and three siblings. In this picture, Hanh is sitting next to her mother. Both her father and mother have not finished secondary school. They are farmers. In their spare time, her mother makes sacks and her father works as a builder to raise more income. The monthly income of her family is about VND 11,000,000.
 
Hanh studies at Bac Ninh Teacher Training College (http://www.cdspbacninh.edu.vn/).  In 2015, when her course finishes, she will become a primary school teacher. Hanh expects that she will be able to find a stable job with a monthly income of VND 3,000,000. Hanh chose her major as she hopes that she will have the opportunity to educate the youth and create a strong foundation for their future. Hanh wants to borrow VND 15,300,000 to pay her tuition fees and living costs. 

Hanh would like to express her appreciation for the help of people all around the world who have contributed to this program, which has supported her individual education greatly, as well as the Vietnamese’s youth in general.

loans.use: pay tuition fees and living costs.

loans.name: Almaza

texts.en:
Almaza is a 60-year-old married mother of three children. She has been running her convenience store for fifteen years in order to support her husband in their family's needs and requests.

Because of Almaza's low income business, she is requesting a loan, which will be invested in paying for her son's university tuition fees. She will also use part of the loan to increase her business merchandise with the necessary requested items to support and develop her business in order to improve its income, and make it capable of covering her family's increasing needs.

Almaza sells cereals, grains, cleaning detergents and canned food, but she doesn't have enough income to develop her business, that's why her loan is very important for both her son's education fees and for developing her business.

She is planning to start up selling fruits and vegetables in the future to increase her income and develop her business to make sure it will cover all of her family and customer needs.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition fees and to increase her business merchandise

loans.name: Sanija

texts.en:
As a married woman with six children, Sanija lives together with her family in a small village in an Ashkali community. The majority of people in her area are unemployed, and live in very poor conditions.

Sanija owns and works on agricultural land and she keeps cows. She works with agricultural machinery on farmland belonging to other people in her area together with her husband. This is how she earns a living. 

Now she is in need of a loan to buy new working tools for a tractor. To support her family, she works hard and is very committed and responsible in her work. This loan will be a great help to her and her family. She hopes to keep on making her own living in order not to ask for help from others. Her goal is to add more cows. 

Sanija wants to thanks all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: to buy new working tools for a tractor

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia raises pigs for sale and has been in her business for more than 13 years. She has been earning enough to provide the needs of her family and has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase feed and materials to repair her livestock's shelter in order to improve her business. She wants to have a better life with her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and repair her pig's shelter

loans.name: Jasper Lyoise Faith

texts.en: Jasper Lyoise Faith studies for a Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education at Misamis University of Science and Technology, Oroquieta City. Recently, she's on her on-the-job training level as one of her school's requirements. To  purchase OJT uniforms, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit where she had joined this year. She hopes to continue her studies and wishes to become a teacher in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase uniforms for her on-the-job training

loans.name: Rosa Herminia

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Estrella  Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 49 años de edad  hace muchos años su esposo falleció pero de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos vive en su casa. 
Doña Rosa es una mujer que le ha tocado luchar mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que desde hace 20 años su marido desapareció en el mar en sus faenas de pesca dejándola sola con sus hijos, es así como ella se hizo cargo de las lanchas contratando personal para que se dedicaran a la pesca, luego sus hijos fueron creciendo y son los que actualmente se adentran en el mar por más de 15 días para poder sacar los peces los mismos que entregan en alta mar a barcos pesqueros, una vez que ellos ya han conseguido suficientes peces regresan al puerto junto al barco pesquero.
Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, combustibles y alimentos para los días que tienen que estar en alta mar. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la unión que hay en el grupo. Sus sueños son tener un gran barco para que sus hijos realicen sus faenas de pesca con mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
The loan group Estrella del Mar (Star of the Sea) meets every two weeks in the beautiful beach resort of San Mateo, in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches, which are much visited in every season of the year by national and foreign tourists. In this place the majority of the inhabitants work in fishing and fishing-related jobs.

Señora Rosa lives in this place. She is 49 years old. Her husband died many years ago, but from this relation she has four adult children, one of whom lives in her house.

Doña Rosa is a woman who has had to work hard to raise her children since her husband disappeared at sea while fishing, leaving her alone with her children. This is how she took charge of the boats, hiring people to work in fishing. Then her sons grew up, and they are the ones who now go to sea for more than 15 days to catch fish, which they turn over to the big fishing vessels on the high seas. Once they have caught enough fish, they return to the port together with the big fishing boat. 

This loan is to buy nets, ropes, fuel, and food for the days that they have to be out at sea. She has been in the loan group since its beginning, and she likes it because of the unity that exists in the group. Her dream is to have a big boat so that her sons can fish with greater security.

loans.use: to buy nets, ropes, fuel, and food

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising pigs.  Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 62 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Virginia is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Virginia has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream - to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sarma

texts.en:
Sarma is 55 years old and is married with seven children.

Sarma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Sarma has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Sarma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 47 years old, married and blessed with five children.

Yolanda supports her husband in planting rice and vegetables to ensure a high production. Due to insufficient capital, Yolanda is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000.00 to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed in vegetable production. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted so that she can further improve their vegetable production business. 

Yolanda and her husband plan to improve their farming business in order to support the education of their children and satisfy their daily necessities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika is 36 years old. There are three people in her family: she lives with her two children, both of whom are boys. Her husband left them and married another woman. Malika is the only food provider for her two boys. She works at a factory. Malika uses her salary for buying food products and for education of her boys.

Since last year, she has been repairing her house and there is still some work to be done to finish it completely. She does not have the money for buying building materials. Malika is asking for a loan of 3,000 Tajikistani somoni (TJS) to buy building materials. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Helen Liliana

texts.es: Helen de 22 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 5 años y 10 meses de edad. Helen se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, responsable y sobre todo trabajadora quien hace todo lo que  esté a su alcance para mantener junto a su esposo a sus pequeños hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de limones, mandarinas y hojas de huerta (muy útil para la elaboración de tamales típicos del país). Desea mejorar las condiciones de su cocina ya que actualmente está construida a base de lámina  la cual se ha deteriorado. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en  la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro y así poder reparar la cocina lo antes posible.
texts.en: Helen is 22 years old and lives with her husband and two children, ages 5 and 10 months.  Helen is known for being enterprising, responsible, and above all hardworking.  She and her husband do everything within their reach to support their children.  She sells lemons, mandarin oranges, and leaves (very useful for making tamales, typical in that country).  She wants to make improvements to her kitchen, which is currently made of metal which is deteriorating.  She is asking for a loan through FUSAI so she can buy bricks, cement, sand, and iron bars so she can make the repairs as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Guillermo Enrique

texts.es: Don Guillermo Tiene 27 años de edad es unido con su esposa t tienen un hijo de año y medio, el se ha dedica a la venta de aguas gaseosas desde hace 10 años el comenzo a distribuir en varias tiendas de la comunidad donde el vive, y gracias a Dios le ha ido bien, en esta ocacion solicita la ayuda de Kiva ya que le ha echo pedidos de agua nuevos clientes, esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado, ya que el sueño de el es darle lo mejor a su hijo y creser en su negocio.
