texts.en: Guillermo is 27 years old, married, and has a year and a half old son.  He has been selling soft drinks for 10 years and began by delivering to various stores in his community.  Thanks to God things have gone well for him.  He is asking for Kiva’s help because he has customer orders.  He hopes that you can help him with a loan.  His dream is to provide for his son and grow his business.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle owns and operates a coco land business venture growing and harvesting coconut and other crops to make a living. She has been in this line of business for more than six years earning well for the family. She had successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC that she used in purchasing farm inputs. 

To gain more income, Annabelle has engaged in another business in raising pigs for sale, and has been doing this for more than a year. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase materials for building pig's shelter. 

In the future, Annabelle wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for building pig's shelter

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram is 39 years old from Nyandarua South, is married, and has three children who are aged between 8 and 19 years old.

Joram has a motorcycle business that he has been running for the past two years and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy a new motorbike and also buy spare parts for the old one. He is optimistic that his business will do better after the loan. 

He hopes to improve his businesses so as to boost his income and uplift his family's living standards in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Shufaa

texts.en:
Shufaa is 35 years old, a female and widowed. She has five children aged 16, 14, 13, 12 and 10 years respectively, whom she supports. Shufaa was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer, and she runs a grocery business, which has lasted for four years now. 

In her business she earns a monthly income of 6,250 Kenyan shillings (KES). She is taking her first loan of 10,000 KES, which she intends to use in adding stock to her business that includes tomatoes, potatoes, vegetables and cabbages. 

Shufaa will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and her family are to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, vegetables and cabbages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell poultry and veterinary supplies business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional supplies to sell for her buy and sell poultry and veterinary supplies business.

Emma has been in this business for 8 years. Emma earns more income from raising pigs and chickens.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies to sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell kitchenware business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of kitchenware to sell.

Daisy has been in this business for eight years. Daisy earns more income from food vending.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of kitchenware to sell

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 45 years old. He would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers. During maize production, he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase crop yields. 

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during maize production

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita helps her husband work on their farm to make a living. She has been doing this for many years earning good money for the family and she successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. She used this previous loan to buy farm supplies. 

Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy organic fertilizer in order to improve their farm. She hopes to gain a bigger harvest this cropping season in order to gain more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is 37 years old and lives with her spouse and four children in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham. She makes a living from growing rice and raising pigs, which she sells into the local markets when they mature. From her current businesses, Tom is able to earn approximately KHR 20,000 per day.

At this time, Tom has asked for a loan to buy piglets and feed, so she can sustain her current business and make a consistent income for the family. The increase in income she expects from the business, she will use to improve the daily living conditions of the family. She will be grateful to all the lenders for their goodwill in helping her develop her agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Sipho's Group

texts.en: Sipho, aged 26 and a mother of two children, is residing in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To support her two dependent kids who are still young, she does paddy rice farming on three hectares and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. Sipho, a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) is leading a group of two to get a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay the reaping fee for her rice crop. She hopes to collect a high yield with a good income in return.

loans.use: to pay the reaping fee for her rice crop

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jenalyn works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns income from motorcycle transport. Jenalyn is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Jenalyn has sustained her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 60-year-old widow who has been working in selling women's and children's clothes and underwear to make her living and cover her needs since her husband passed away two years ago.  Siham is well known in her region with her special quality and prices. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to  increase her business merchandise with a special Christmas and winter collection that will fulfill her customers' needs and increase her income.
She hopes to keep on developing and improving her business to make sure that she'll have a financially secure future since she has no one to rely on concerning this matter.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with a special Christmas and winter collection that will fulfill her customers' needs and increase her income

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a farmer in Oloitoktok town where he plants cash crops for selling. He is 45 years old and married. Together with his spouse they have been blessed with four children. He has been in the farming business for 12 years and right now his monthly income is KES 9,500. He will use this loan to buy fertilizer and agrochemicals for use in his farm. This will enable him to get more yield. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

In future Benson hopes to be a successful farmer and to give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Jenta

texts.en:
Jenta is a married woman with four children. She lives at her own house that has no electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a food selling business to passersby and neighbors. She mentioned the high cost of purchasing foodstuffs as her major challenge and that is the reason for her request so that she can add capital. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael is 45 years old. She is single and has two children who she supports. Rachael was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet staff member and she is taking her fourth loan from KADET of KES 60,000.  She has a second hand clothes shop which has lasted five years now and earns monthly income of KES 18,000.  Her previous loan of KES 40,000 was repaid successfully. She will use her loan to buy more second hand clothes. Also, she will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business are to open a wholesale shop and make sure her children live well.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes to sell to her buyers.

loans.name: Unidos Al Futuro Group

texts.es: Jaquelin  tiene 31 años es casada con 02 hijos menores. En el grupo “UNIDOS AL FUTURO” cumple la función de secretaria. Ella se dedica a la venta de cervezas y gaseosas en su domicilio. Y adicionalmente presta servicios de auxiliar en un centro educativo.  De esta manera puede apoyar a su es posos con los gastos de su familia. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de más cerveza y gaseosas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Jaquelin es la segunda del lado derecho y de la misma manera esta incluida la foto de Zosima en la parte superior derecha que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos de salud.
texts.en:
Jaquelin is 31 years old. She has two young children and is a secretary in the group Unidos al Futuro. She works selling beer and soft drinks in her home and additionally, works as an assistant at a school. This allows her to support her husband with the family expenses.

She will buy more beer and soft drinks with the loan. The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan. Jaquelin is the second on the right. In the top-right corner is Zosima who could not attend the meeting for health reasons.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks

loans.name: Amygail

texts.en:
Amygail previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase more stock and more types of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and for her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another loan, for 12,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help meet her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Amygail hopes that her business will last longer and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets with her co-fellowship members every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 42-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as a focused and determined person. 

Grace operates a vet business where she offers artificial insemination, animal treatment, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a place with much potential and her customers are primarily livestock owners. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of funds to buy medicine for animals. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more medicine for treating animals. 

Grace hopes that she will have a bright future. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy medicine for clients' animals

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 58 years old and married, with four children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Elsa has been farming vegetables for ten years and also earns income from selling purified drinking water.

Elsa is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is 32 years old. He is a father of two children aged six and sixteen. He has spent eight years in farming. With the loan, he would like to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Jacob's Group

texts.en:
Jacob is a member of Imani WG Group in Chwele District.  He is pictured here in a group of 6 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 70 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Jacob has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Jacob is a reliable member of the community. He is married with four children. Jacob is 34 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 10 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Jacob is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group and savings group.  He described his harvest last year as excellent.  He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and enjoying the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.							

Jacob first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2009 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Jacob joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader and an active community member.  Jacob plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to repair the home and buy a cow.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Jacob’s own life was improved because he has more farm training and more farm group support. 

Jacob and the Imani WG Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to access hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is 34 years old and she lives in Koghes village in Lori region. Hasmik is not married and she lives with her parents and her brother. Hasmik works at the school as a teacher of mathematics and IT. She is a very clever and kind person, who is seriously engaged in the education process. As she says, her work demands great knowledge and forbearance, love towards children and sureness that someday, in some place her pupils will remember her words and given knowledge and use it positively. Hasmik’s mother is also a teacher and they work together at the same school. 
Hasmik asks for a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer and some professional literature. This purchase will be very useful both for Hasmik and her mother as well.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some professional literature

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen is an experienced agronomist from Nor Kesaria village. He lives together with his mother, wife and two school age children aged 15 and 12 years old.  Armen owns a farm where he keeps two cows and cultivates land. He cultivates wheat and corn and sells the harvest in the local market.  Nonetheless, Armen hasn't been able to save enough money to care for the needs of his family and, at the same time, to cover the upkeep of his farm. He has applied for this loan to purchase three oxen, fertilizer and fuel.  Realizing the importance of the income that Armen gathers from agribusiness, the loan will greatly assist Armen to enlarge the farm and ensure a better life for his family. He will be very grateful to the lenders for support.

loans.use: to purchase three oxen, fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida was born in 1959. She is married and has a daughter. Her daughter is 25 years old and she is married. Farida began her business selling children's clothes 30 years ago. Little by little she developed her business skills and abilities. Now, Farida sells fabrics in a local market. She has regular customers. Farida is going to buy goods for the new season but she does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan of 4000 TJS to buy fabrics for the new season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Balbina

texts.en:
This is Balbina. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Balbina dreams of being more successful in her business and hopes that her children will have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and products needed in her business

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en:
Eduard is 55 years old and he lives in Kapan city in Syunik region. Eduard is the father of three very nice girls. For many years he worked at the shoe factory, but after it was closed he established his own business. Using his own car he provides transport for people in the territory of Kapan. He has a lot of loyal customers who always trust him and know that despite driving long distances they are safe and comfortable. Eduard is the only bread-winner in his family, so he tries always to keep his car in order and clean, but with the coming of winter he has some problems connected with his car tires. 
He asks for a loan of 250,000 Armenian drams in order to buy tires for his car for the winter season.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car for the winter season

loans.name: Erimina

texts.en: Erimina is a hard working woman. She supports her family through her food-selling business. The previous loan helped her to buy food consumables to sell. She is again requesting another loan of KES 20,000 to buy sugar, salt, soap, maize flour and rice to add stock to her business. She appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, soap, maize flour and rice to add stock to her business

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Kabero SHG is a group of four group leader farmers in Chwele District with Betty selected as the Kiva representative.  Betty has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 42 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Betty is a reliable member of the community.  She is married with six children.  Betty is 42 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 20 years to support her family.  In addition to this, Betty is very active in her community and is involved in the women's group.  She described her harvest last year as good and hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund to enjoy the success she is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.
							
The 2014 Long Rains season won’t be Betty’s first season with One Acre Fund.  She first joined One Acre Fund in 2007 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  As an active member in her community, Betty also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes being a leader and wants to help more farmers.  Betty plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school.  Her life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because she has more farm training, more farm group support, and is able to save money and feed the family.							
	
Betty and the Kabero SHG Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase their harvests of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Coumba's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc villageois de Diatamine Saféré est né le 15 décembre 2008 à l'inauguration du Banc villageois. Les membres du groupe habitent le même village  et sont animés d’un esprit d’entre aide et de soutien mutuel. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la transformation des produits locaux.

Madame Coumba  (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 59 ans, mariée  et mère de huit  enfants dont cinq garçons et trois filles. Elle achète des graines d’arachide et autres céréales qu’elle transforme en vu de la revente dans les différents marchés dans sa zone surtout au marché international de la sous région.

 Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter des céréales et particulièrement de la patte d’arachide pour la transformation et la vente.

 
Les bénéfices lui permettront d’assurer les besoins familiales (habillement, santé, scolarité, nourriture).
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" of Diatamine Saféré was formed December 15, 2008. The members of the group live in the same village and are motivated by a desire for helping each other and mutual aid. They are in the primary business of producing local products.

Coumba (pictured sitting on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group and its representative. She is 59 years old, married and the mother of eight children, five boys and three girls. She purchases peanuts and other cereals which she processes in order to resell them in different markets in her area, especially the international market of the sub-region. 

This new loan will allow Coumba to purchase cereals, especially peanut paste, to process and resell. The profits will allow her to provide for her family's needs (clothing, health, education, and food.)

loans.use: to purchase cereals and specifically peaut paste to process and resell

loans.name: Bahozi

texts.fr: Le Client Bahozi est un docteur, médecin expérimenté travaillant dans une  Fondation d’œuvre Médicale. Il est parent de 3 étudiants à l’université (respectivement une fille en G1 Technologie appliquée, 1 garçon en première licence en droit  public et 1 garçon en G3 économie). Il a été informé des nouvelles opportunités de financement de frais académiques par l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais académiques pour ces 3 étudiants en fin qu’ils ne soient plus exclus de cours durant toute l’année académique 2013-2014. Ce parent médecin, rêve voir sa fille devenir ingénieur architecte et ses deux fils hauts cadres magistrat et chef d’entreprise.  Il remercie l’IMF Hekima pour son nouveau produit innovant  dédiés  à l’éducation de leurs enfants en leur donnant de crédit d’impact social  surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Bahozi, is an experienced doctor working in a medical foundation. He is the parent of three students at the university level (respectively a daughter in the G1 applied technology track, a son in undergraduate studies in public law, and a son in the G3 economics track). Bahozi was informed about new opportunities in the financing of education costs by the microfinance institution Hekima. 

Thus, this new loan will be used to pay the education costs for these three students, so that they are no longer excluded from classes throughout the 2013-14 academic year. This parent physician dreams of seeing his daughter become an architect-engineer and his two sons become an attorney and a company manager. 

He thanks the microfinance institution Hekima for its new innovative product dedicated to their children's education through lending with social impact, especially during this critical time of war in the country's east.

loans.use: to pay the education costs for three students

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Kakule

texts.fr: Le Client Kakule est un fonctionnaire dans une organisation évangélique baptiste. Il est parent de 2 étudiants à l’université, tous en première année de graduat  respectivement dans les facultés d’économie et de sante publique. Il a été informé des nouvelles opportunités de financement de frais académiques par l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais académiques pour ces 2 étudiants (fille et garçon) en fin qu’ils ne soient plus exclus de cours durant toute l’année académique 2013-2014. Ce parent fonctionnaire, rêve voir sa fille et son fils devenir hauts cadres en santé publique et chef d’entreprise. Il remercie l’IMF Hekima pour son nouveau produit innovant  dédiés  à l’éducation de leurs enfant en leur donnant de crédit d’impact social  surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Kakule, is a staff member in a Baptist evangelical organization. He is the parent of two students at the university level. Both are in their freshman year in economics and in public health, respectively. Kakule was informed about new opportunities in the financing of education costs by the microfinance institution Hekima. 

Thus, this new loan will be used to pay the education costs for these two students (a boy and a girl), so that they are no longer excluded from classes throughout the 2013-14 academic year. This parent staff member dreams of seeing his daughter and son as a high-ranking public health worker and a company manager. 

He thanks the microfinance institution Hekima very much for its new innovative product dedicated to their children's education through lending with social impact, especially during this critical time of war in the country's east.

loans.use: to pay the education costs for two students

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Xuan's Group

texts.en:
Xuan was born in 1961 in Dong Anh, Hanoi. She and her husband own a small grocery store, which generates a monthly income of 7,000,000 VND.  Now, she is facing the problem of capital shortage to maintain her family business. Thus, she would love to borrow 6,758,000 VND to restock her grocery store. This is the second time Xuan has participated in the SEDA program. The revenue collected from the shop will be spent on improving her family's living conditions. 

Xuan is the leader of a group of 5 members. Similar to Xuan, the other members also want to borrow money to invest in their family businesses. 

Hue is a 51-year-old farmer. She would love to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her small vegetable selling business. 

Nhan is a 45-year-old business woman. She would love to borrow 8,938,000 VND for her vegetable shop.

Thom is 31 years old. She is a fishmonger. For the purpose of expanding her business, she would love to borrow 7,630,000 VND.

Mai is 37 years old. She is currently a worker. However, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to raise chickens and provide more income for her family.

loans.use: to restock her grocery store

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is 43 years old and married with four children.

Lani works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Lani has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Lani aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a 29-year-old single woman. She has one child who is five years old. She describes herself as a determined person. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. 

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are small-scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low sales. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to add a stock of clothes for resale. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add a stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 65 years old and has nine children; she works very hard to provide for them.

Lydia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, milk, noodles, eggs, etc. 

Lydia has been in this business for two years.

In the future Lydia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, milk, noodles and eggs.

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en: Clemence appreciates the previous loan that helped her to buy a stock of clothes for her business. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to add stock of second-hand clothes for sale to get income and support her family.

loans.use: to add to her stock of second-hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Solidario Mary De Patzun Group

texts.es: Solidario Mary de patzun La señora Andrea se dedica a la  venta de  pan,pasteles,y como actividad secundaria se dedica a la venta de tamales tiene 3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de arina y meteriales para la elaboracion de pan y pasteles esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito que esta solicitando ya que el anhelo de ella es tener un negocio mas grande y darles a sus hijo todo el estudio que nececitan.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of the Solidario Mary de Patzun group and she sells bread, pastry, and as a second activity she also sells tamales.

She has engaged in this activity for three years and she is asking for a loan in order to buy flour and other products to make bread and pastry. She hopes that you can help her with the loan she is asking for, because it is her aim to have a bigger business and to enable her children to go to school for as long as they need.

loans.use: to buy flour and other products to make and sell bread and pastry.

loans.name: Kibet

texts.en:
Kibet is a 23-year-old single man. He describes himself as confident. He operates a retail business where he sells bread, milk, eggs, drinks and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. 

His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are small-scale. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of bread, soap, drinks and other items. His business goal is to be successful within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add a stock of bread, soap, drinks and other items.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a 28-year-old single woman. She has one child. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for three years. 

Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are small-scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to buy more stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add a stock of vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to have a self-reliant business within five years. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add a stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Berlina

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Berlina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried coconut meat.  Berlina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Berlina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 42 years old. She is a married mother of two children, who are both in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lourdes has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Lourdes has been in this business for six years. In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 34 years old and married with six children, five of whom are in school. Amelia works very hard to provide for them.

Amelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, spices, etc.

Amelia has been in this business for seven years.

In the future Amelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk and spices.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah works hard to support her family. Jonah is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jonah requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs, noodles, etc.

Jonah has been in this business for a year now.

In the future, Jonah would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs and noodles.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lorena is 39 years old and has three children who are in school.

Lorena has a general store business in the Philippines. Lorena requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like snack foods, sugar, shampoo and other items.

Lorena has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lorena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like snack foods, sugar, shampoo and other items.

loans.name: Dienabou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 29 juin 2008 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Diènabou (en médaillon en haut et à droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 34 ans et mère de trois filles et un garçon. Comme la majorité des femmes de la zone elle s’active dans la vente et la transformation d’arachide qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires de la zone pour la transformation et la revente.

Avec son crédit, elle compte acheter le sac à 7 000 F CFA moyennant 800 F CFA de frais de transport par sac et  des frais de transformation de 1250 F CFA le sac.

Elle peut obtenir en moyen des bénéfices nets de 9 000 F CFA tous les dix jours ce qui lui permette d’apporter sa contribution dans les charges de la maison et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
This group and "banc villageois" were created on 29 June 2008.  The group is made up of women who have a lot of experience working with the "banc villageois".

The women all come from the same village, and are very closely linked through working together and helping one another.  They all work in small businesses.

Diènabou (on the right of the photo, and in the inset photo) is the loan representative.  She is married and has three daughters and a son.  Like most of the women in the area, she processes and sells peanuts.  She buys her supplies at the local weekly markets, and processes them before reselling them.

Diènabou will use her loan to buy peanuts.  She pays 7,000 francs CFA per sack, 800 francs CFA per sack for transportation, and it costs 1,250 francs CFA to process the nuts.  She can earn a net profit of 9,000 francs CFA every ten days.  In this way, she contributes to the running costs of her household, and the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy, transport, process and resell peanuts.

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es: María de 41 años de edad  es madre de dos hijas de 20 años y  17 años de edad. Habita en casa humilde pero propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus queridos hijos.   María trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace  mucho tiempo y de esta forma es como junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales por lo que ha solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo del corredor y para encementar el piso de la vivienda. Con el crédito pretende comprar lámina galvanizada, cemento, arena y grava. De esta forma espera mejor sus condiciones habitacionales y las de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old and has two daughters, who are 20 and 17 years old. She lives in a house which is humble but her own, together with her live-in partner and her beloved children.

María has been working as a domestic employee for many years, and in this way she and her partner cover the household expenses. She wants to improve their living conditions and therefore is asking for this loan with FUSAI, in order to repair the roof of the hallway and to put a concrete floor into their house. With the loan she wants to buy metal sheets, cement, sand and gravel. By this she hopes to improve the living conditions of her own and of her family.

loans.use: To buy: metal sheets, cement, sand, and gravel to repair the roof and to put a concrete floor into the hallway.

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es: María de 60 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo quien ya es mayor de edad y le ayuda con los gatos diarios. María trabaja en un comedor como ayudante en oficios varios. Tienen mucho tiempo de trabajar en este lugar y es así como ha llevado el pan de cada día a su hogar.  Con mucho esfuerzo construyó su vivienda junto a su esposo, y esta es su principal patrimonio por lo que poco a poco va mejorando. Desea terminar de construir un cuarto que comenzó y no logro dar fin. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, ladrillo, arena, hierro, grava y arena para continuar la construcción y finalizarla lo antes posible.
texts.en:
María is 60 years old and lives in her own house, together with her husband and their son, who is already grown up and helps with the daily expenses.

María works as a help for various tasks in a restaurant. She has worked in this place for a long time and by this has provided for the household. With great effort she built the house together with her husband, and this is her main asset which she wants to improve bit by bit. She wants to finish the construction of the room she started butcould not complete it yet. Therefore, she is asking for this loan with FUSAI in order to use it to buy cement, bricks, sand, steel, and gravel in order to continue the construction and finish it as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy: cement, bricks, sand, steel, and gravel to complete the construction of a room.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Eden works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle transportation. Eden is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy kitchen wares and ingredients for her food business.

Eden has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy kitchen wares and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Diabou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 04 Juillet 2002 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois, actuellement elles viennent d’étamer leurs vingt deuxième cycles. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce accompagné de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Diabou (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, est âgée de 55 ans et mère de quatre enfants : dont deux garçons et deux filles. Elle est vendeuse de patte d’arachide au marché international de la sous région. Elle se procure le produit fin auprès de ses camarades transformatrice pour la revente en gros par seau et au détail selon le besoin.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle prévoit d’acheter au moins 05 seaux à 10 000 F CFA pour la revente.

Les bénéfices, elle compte les utiliser pour appuyer son mari dans la gestion quotidienne des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This group and the "banc villageois" were created on 4th July 2002.  The group is made up of women who have a lot of experience with the "banc villageois" programme.  This will be their twenty-second loan with the field partner.

The women all come from the same village and have very strong ties as a result of working together and helping one another.  They work as small traders and also in rain-fed agriculture.

Diabou (sitting on the far right of the photo, with her hand raised) is the loan representative.  She is 55 years old, married and has four children, two boys and two girls.  She sells peanut paste at the regional, international market.  She buys the finished product from her friends who have processed the peanuts.  She then sells the paste wholesale by the bucket, or in small quantities.

Diabou will use her loan to buy at least five buckets (at 10,000 francs CFA) to be used in the resale of the peanut paste.  She will use her earnings to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses and needs of their family.

loans.use: to buy at least 5 buckets (at 10,000 francs CFA) for use in the resale of peanut paste.

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es: Juan de 29 años  de edad se encuentra acompañado y  tiene tres hijos de 4 años, 9 años y 12 años de edad quienes a la fecha se encuentran estudiando  en la escuela pública de su localidad. Juan trabaja como ayudante de albañil desde hace mucho tiempo y de esta forma junto con la ayuda de su compañera de vida  mantienen la economía del hogar.  Para él lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que hace todo lo que esté a su alcance para dar mejores las condiciones de su familia. Solicita  este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del piso de su vivienda ya que hace algunos años le puso ladrillo de cemento pero con el tiempo se ha dañado y desea repararlo. Con el crédito comprará cemento, arena y ladrillo de piso.
texts.en:
Juan is 29 years old and has a domestic partner and three children. The children are 4, 9, and 12 years old and go to the school in his neighborhood.

Juan has been working as an assistant bricklayer for a long time and by this and with the help of his partner provides for their household.

For him, the most important thing is his family, and he does all he can to improve the living conditions of his family. He is asking for this loan with FUSAI in order to use it for repairs to his home. A couple of years ago he installed a flooring of cement bricks, but over the time the floor was damaged and he wants to repair it.

With the loan he will buy cement, sand, and bricks for the floor.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, and bricks to repair the floor.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets. Evelyn has been in this business for 10 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Belfort Group

texts.fr: Le Banc Villageois a été inauguré le 9 Mai 2001. Le groupe qui constitue ce dossier est composé de 8 membres qui ont toujours remboursé leur prêt sens difficulté. Madame Aminata qui est à la droit de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 filles et de 2 garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente de jus et de légumes. Elle est très expérimenté car elle pratique ses activités depuis plusieurs années. Madame va acheter avec le crédit sollicité de la matière première pour le jus et le maraichage. Malgré la forte affluence de son activité dans le marché, elle s'en sort très bien. Les bénéfices serviront à aider son mari dans le ménage plus précisément dans la scolarité, la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" was created on 9th May 2001.  The Belfort Group has eight members who have always repaid their loans correctly, and on time.  

Aminata (on the right of the photo with her hand raised) is the group representative.  She is married and has six children, four girls and two boys.  She sells juice and vegetables, and has done this work for several years, so she is very experienced.

Aminata will use her loan to buy raw materials to produce juice, and materials for vegetable growing.  Despite the large number of people who work in this area, Aminata's business is very successful.

She will use her earnings to help her husband with their household expenses, particularly those for schooling, food and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to produce juice and materials for vegetable growing.

loans.name: Martha María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San José se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo  de 4 años que está en jardín de infantes. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le agrada por la rapidez con que salen los créditos.
Doña Martha es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica al comercio, ella tiene un pequeño local con su mamá donde venden globos y todo tipo de accesorios para fiestas, ella también en este lugar vende productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas).  En ocasiones ella sale a ofrecer sus productos puerta a puerta y que esos momentos su mamá se encarga del local pero por lo general la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza allí mismo. Tiene 3 años dedicada al comercio con el cual puede ayudar a su marido a salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar artículos de fiesta, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos.  Sus sueños son tener seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
The group San José meets fortnightly in the Jaramijo canton, a beautiful place famous for its beaches. Most of its inhabitants work hard in the fishing sector.

Martha lives here. She is 31, married and has a four-year-old son that goes to the kindergarten. Her husband is a fisherman. This is the group’s third cycle and they like the fact that loans are easily approved.

Martha works as a housewife and, in order to generate her own income, in commerce. She runs a small establishment together with her mother where they sell air balloons and all kinds of party supplies. She also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women). Every now and then, she also sells door-to-door and her mother stays taking care of the store. However, most of the sales are done at the store. She has been doing this for three years and it has enabled her to help her husband to get ahead.

She will use this loan to buy party supplies, perfumes, creams and cosmetics. Her dream is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy party supplies, perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 46 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. Monica works very hard to provide for her family.

Monica runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of items to sell such as chips, eggs, milk, spices, shampoo, etc.

Monica has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Monica would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of items to sell such as chips, eggs, milk, spices, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 45-year-old resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Norberto, a worker abroad, and is a mother to their children. She, together with her partner, manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Lourdes maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular brands (Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, etc.). A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, thus providing a profit for the dealer. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise, like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products needed in her business.

Lourdes dreams to be successful in business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. Here, she also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy merchandise including clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is 23 years old with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ritchel has a general store business in the Philippines. Ritchel has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as  chips, eggs, bread, coffee, etc.

Ritchel has been in this business for one year. In the future, Ritchel would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as chips, eggs, bread, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 27-year-old hardworking gentleman. He is married to Emily and is a father of three children between 1 and 3 years old. He has been involved in the motorcycle transport business for the last four years. He earns KES 25,000 a month. He learned about Vision Fund from some of his colleagues who have already been funded by the organization.

Charles has acquired his third loan of KES 90,000, which will enable him to purchase another motorbike in the quest for business expansion. He is likely to earn more money due to his already established customer base. Charles plans to use the proceeds to repay his loan as well as to boost his savings account. He hopes to buy a taxi from his accumulated savings.  

He is an industrious gentleman who is determined to achieve his goals and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Rasmiya

texts.en:
Rasmiya is a 32-year-old married mother of four children. She is a Palestinian refugee who has been working for 17 years in the embroidery business. Just like most of the Palestinian refugees who live in a Palestinian camp, she had to find a suitable job that will help her support her family's needs.

Rasmiya is very talented in her business, and highly recommended in her region. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to make necessary maintenance to her house. The ceiling is leaking and she would like to repair it before the coming winter season to keep it a healthy living place for her precious family. She would also like to help her husband to pay for his car registration fees which is very important for facilitating his business.

Rasmiya hopes to keep on supporting her family in their needs, especially covering her children's education, and wishes that one day she'll be capable of spreading her work outside the camp.

loans.use: to repair a ceiling leak and pay for car registration.

loans.name: Hambardzum

texts.en:
Hambardzum is from Miasnikyan Village of the Armavir region. He is a teacher with many years of experience teaching at the local school. He lives with his wife who is also a teacher. In addition to his work at school, Hambardzum also works in agriculture. He keeps a pig and cultivates wheat and grass. The gathered harvest is sold locally in the open market.

They work hard to cover their daily costs and to sustain their living. Realizing that agriculture is an important source of income for his family, Hambardzum has applied for this loan. With the requested amount of USD 3,000, Hambardzum will be able to purchase seeds and cover labor costs for cultivation of the harvest.

Hambardzum will be very grateful for the loan and he hopes for lenders’ good will.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and pay for labor.

loans.name: Vital

texts.en:
Vital is 63 years old. He is married to a farmer. He would like to use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizer, which is needed to increase maize production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for maize production.

loans.name: Gellen

texts.en:
Gellen is 34 years old and has five children. She is married and four children are in school. Gellen is in an agricultural business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to sustain it.

Gellen requested a 19,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her pigs. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Razmik

texts.en:
Razmik is 23 years old and lives in the Tsovazard village in the Gegharkunik region. Razmik is a student of Yerevan State Economical University and is also involved in farming. His father is a builder who does not always have time to help his son around the farm. But Razmik alone manages the care of his farm perfectly and cutely. On his rich farm he has five cows, two heifers, two bulls, four calves, seventeen sheep, eleven lambs, two piglets, four horses, and twenty chickens. With the help of his mother, Razmik organizes the sale of a great range of dairy products, meat, and eggs. Razmik’s father is really proud of his son, who is so young, so laborious, so successful, and already a skilled farmer.

Razmikm requests a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams. He will use this to buy three more calves, in order to enlarge the sale of meat, and to buy a lot of animal fodder for winter.

loans.use: to buy three more calves and animal fodder for winter.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 56 years old. She wants to use her Kiva loan to buy fertilizer to increase maize production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has one child who has finished school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has owned a hotel business, with her neighbors and town dwellers as customers. She also sells water to supplement her income.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase stocks of goods for the business (sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour, cooking fat, etc.). She dreams of expanding to a modern restaurant in the business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anzazi

texts.en:
Anzazi is a widowed woman with five children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a shop kiosk business selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentions seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With this  40,000 Kenyan shilling loan she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking  oil for her shop.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr: Ce Banc Villageois qui abrite ce groupe de 06 femmes a été créé le 28 Mai 2001. Elles qui habitent le même quartier. Madame Dieneba qui à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée est mère de quatre filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de petit déjeuner et de détergent. Elle a une bonne maitrise de l'activité pour l'avoir exercer depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle compte investir avec le prêt sollicité 100 000fcfa pour l'achat de détergents et 200 000 fcfa pour achat matière première pour la vente de petit déjeuner. Les bénéfices serviront de payer la scolarité de ses enfants et de soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" loan association which includes this group of six women who live in the same neighborhood was created May 28, 2001.

Madame Dieneba, who is on the right of the photo raising her hand, is the representative for the group. She is married and the mother of four daughters.

She prepares breakfasts for sale and also sells detergents. She masters this business activity rather well, having over ten years' experience.

With the requested loan she intends to invest 100,000 CFA francs to buy detergents and 200,000 CFA francs to buy the basic ingredients to prepare breakfasts for sale.

The profits will serve to pay tuition fees for her children and support her husband in dealing with family expenses.

loans.use: buy products to prepare breakfasts for sale, and detergent

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, de 43 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 4 hijos.  Vive en compañía de sus hijos y su hermana en su casa propia la cual adquirió gracias a muchos años de esfuerzo en su trabajo. La actividad que realiza Roció  es la compra y  venta de carne de res en diversas presentaciones como filetes, carne molida y otros. Compra la carne en el camal municipal y en los fundos ganaderos y los vende en un puesto en el mercado de la localidad donde atiende a sus clientes con mucha cordialidad quienes siempre la buscan por la buena calidad  de la carne que vende. Esta actividad lo realiza en el mercado  con la ayuda de una señorita para la atención al público. Se inició hace más de 25 años  con un capital propio, comprando en pequeñas cantidades,  luego fue aumentando en volumen de sus compras viendo la demanda de sus carnes de res. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, logrando tener una buena acogida  y siendo muy conocida  en el mercado. Antes de empezar con su negocio, tuvo dificultades económicas ya que los gastos aumentaron, debido a que en ese entonces se encontraba realizando sus estudios universitarios. Sin embargo, ha superado los obstáculos y continuó trabajando. Ahora desea continuar progresando por el bien de su familia. En esta oportunidad solicitara s/. 3800, por ello agradece la confianza plena que le brindan para acceder al crédito que le ayude a concretar sus planes.,Con el monto solicitado, comprará mayor cantidad de carne de res para continuar vendiendo en su puesto del mercado.
texts.en:
Rocío is 43 years old, single, and the mother of four children. She lives with her children and her sister in her own house that she acquired as a result of many years of hard work. Rocío buys and sells beef in various forms such as fillets, ground meat, and other products. She buys the meat from the municipal slaughterhouse and from cattle ranches. Rocío sells her products from a stand at the market in her town where she attends to her customers with great friendliness. People are always looking to buy the high quality meat that she sells.

Rocío manages her business at the market with the help of another woman who waits on the customers. She started out more than 25 years ago with her own capital. Rocío bought in small quantities, but later she increased the volume of her purchases as a result of the demand for beef. She considers her business to be quite profitable as a result of the income she generates. Her business has earned a good reception and is well-known in the market. Prior to starting her business, Rocío had financial difficulty because of increased expenses due to finishing her university studies. Nonetheless, she overcame those obstacles and continued working.

For now, Rocío would like to continue progressing for the sake of her family. She is taking this opportunity to request 3,800 PEN. Rocío is grateful for being trusted to access this loan, which will help to solidify her plans. The amount she requested will be used to buy a large quantity of beef so that she can continue making sales from her market stand.

loans.use: to buy beef in bulk quantities.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa, aged 52, is married and blessed with four children. She owns and manages a transportation business in their town and earns a net income of PHP 300 a day.  With this she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 18,000 to pay for the repair and maintenance of their motorcycle.  Her profits are usually spent on the food allowances of her son. She's hoping that their business will continue to improve so that she can earn more profits.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of their motorcycle.

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jennie works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling chicken.  Jennie is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, etc. for her restaurant business.

Jennie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, etc.

loans.name: Alou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  ALOU  est âgé de 37 ans et vit avec ses quatre enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle dans la sous préfecture  Ouelessebougou, Région de Koulikoro.
ALOU n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales et autres articles divers. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales et d’articles divers. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son quatrième prêt  qui servira à acheter, 2 tonnes de riz, 5 sacs de sucre et des caisses de thé, auprès des grossistes de BAMAKO qu’il revend en détail à OUELESSEBOUGOU à crédit et au comptant à une clientèle mixte.
ALOU espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Alou is a 37-year-old man, who lives with his wife and four children in a traditional family in the sub-prefecture of Ouelessebougou.  This is in the Koulikoro region.

Alou didn't have the opportunity to attend school.  He started to work at a young age, particularly in the buying and selling of cereals and various other items.  His customer base is growing quickly so he has decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be his fourth loan, and he will use it to buy two tonnes of rice, five sacks of sugar and boxes of tea.  Alou buys his supplies from wholesalers in Bamako, and resells them to various customers in Ouelessebougou, on a cash or credit basis.

Alou hopes to earn a monthly average of 100,000 francs CFA, and he will use his earnings to repay his loan and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various items for resale.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is an old member of BRAC and is taking her third loan. She is taking a loan for her son.  In fact, her son drives an auto rickshaw. He has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years with petrol, which is very costly nowadays.  Due to the increase in the cost of petrol he wants to convert his auto rickshaw from LPG (liquefied petroleum gas) but his rickshaw does not have a CNG (compressed natural gas) kit.

Therefore, Shamim contacted Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.  With the loan amount her son will buy a CNG kit for his rickshaw so he can minimize the fuel expense and can grow his income.

Shamim seems very happy after receiving this loan.  She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To help her son buy a CNG kit for his auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Nicolus

texts.en:
Nicolus is 28-years-old and is a very hardworking gentleman.  He is married and a father of one.  He has operated a motorcycle transport business for the last two years with a monthly income of about KES 20,000. He learned about Vision Fund from some of his colleagues who have already been funded by the organization.

He has applied for his third loan of KES 80,000 to repair and service motorcycles.  He plans to use the proceeds to buy a second hand motorcycle, thus, employing his friends into the business.

He hopes to buy a taxi from his accumulated savings. Nicolus is determined to achieve financial stability and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to repair and service his three motocycles

loans.name: Arjwan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Arjwan.  It consists of four members who live in Sana`a, Yemen. The members have developed business activities and applied for a loan of 240,000 YER. 

Yusra is a 31-year-old married woman and has children. She currently has a business drawing tattoos on ladies' hands. She learned the trade and has been in this line of work for many years. She has worked in this business to provide her mother with income for expenses. Most of her customers are brides. She would like to expand her business so she applied for a loan from AMB. She will use the loan to increase her capital and buy pigment (khodhab) materials to draw tattoos on ladies' hands. Working in this manner allows her to help her family move forward.

loans.use: to buy pigment (khodhab) materials to draw tattoos on ladies' hands.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr: charlotte est une femme de 40 ans, célibataire et mère de deux enfants. elle possède et gère un centre d'appel téléphonique où elle vend des crédits de communication dans un quartier de la ville depuis 11 ans. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de crédit de communication afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et augmenter son chiffre d'affaires. les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans son activité et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Charlotte is a 40-year-old, single woman with two children.  She has owned and run a telephone call centre (where she sells call credits)  in her neighbourhood for eleven years. 

Charlotte will use her loan to increase her stock of call credits to satisfy the demands of her customers.  This will improve her business figures.  She will use her earnings to reinvest in her business and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy telephone call credits for resale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 25 years old. He is a very hardworking gentleman who supports his two siblings. For the past three years, Simon has been employed in the motorcycle transport business and he earns about 30,000 KES each month. He learned about VisionFund from some other riders who had already been funded by the organization. Simon is an industrious gentleman who is determined to achieve his goals and improve the living standards of his family. 

Simon is requesting an 87,880 KES loan to help him to buy his own motorbike. His loan will improve his flexibility and ability to provide services for his already-established customer base. Simon hopes to increase his income and plans to use his proceeds to repay his loan as well as boost his savings account. In the future, he hopes to buy another motorcycle from his accumulated savings.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Hortencia

texts.es: María de 20 años de edad habita en condiciones muy humildes junto  a su compañero de vida y  su pequeño hijo. María se dedica a la venta de pan francés  en las principales zonas de su localidad y de esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar y junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales desea construir un cuarto y mejorar las condiciones de su cocina para lo cual necesita invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y lámina. Actualmente, no cuenta con el capital para hacer el desembolso por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de dichos materiales y así comenzar lo antes posible a construir el cuarto y reparar el área de cocina.
texts.en:
Maria is 20 years old and lives with her life partner and their young son in very humble conditions. 

Maria earns a living selling French bread in the central region of her city. This is how, with the help of her partner, she provides for her family.  

In order to improve her living conditions, she wants to construct a room and improve the kitchen area. To do so, she needs to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and sheet metal. She does not have the capital to cover the costs at the present, so she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy the above-mentioned materials. This way she will be able to begin building the room and repairing the kitchen area as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and sheet metal to build a room and repair the kitchen.

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina is 60-years-old and married with six children, one of whom is in school.  Medina works very hard to provide for them.

Medina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Medina  has been in this business for 14 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is 54-years-old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.  Justina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Justina has been in this business for 30 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, a 37-year-old father of one from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. James also runs a restaurant to supplement his income. He has been in the farming business for the past five years. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

This marks his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya after clearing his previous loan successfully. With the loan he has applied for, he will be able to purchase farm inputs, i.e. seedlings and fertilizers. 

The additional income created will allow him to expand on the farming land and buy new chairs and tables for his restaurant. In the future, James would like to offer his child quality education and improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, i.e. seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Martinha

texts.en:
