Martinha is 29 years old. For the past 12 years, she has run a general store. Martinha opened her business with 50 USD of her own working capital. She earns a good income from her business and is a very hardworking woman.

Martinha is requesting a 600 USD loan to buy some stocks to keep in her store such as coffee, sugar, salt, cigarettes, and slippers. In the future, she hopes to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, salt, cigarettes, and slippers

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela, age 42, is a mother of six children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery material to resell. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. 

For that his wife, Shakeela, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of helping her husband.  He will purchase an embroidery machine and a new variety of embroidery materials.  Shakeela is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband purchase an embroidery machine and a new variety of embroidery material to resell.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married with eight school going children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Asha has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past ten years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
DRISSA  est âgé de 40 ans et vit avec ses sept enfants et ses époux dans la sous préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU, Région de KOULIKORO.
DRISSA  n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le troisième prêt il est à son quatrième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 5 tonnes de céréales (maïs, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de DONGORONAN et environnants qu’elle gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, OUELESSEBOUGOU.
DRISSA espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Drissa is forty years old, and lives with his wives and seven children in the sub-prefecture of Ouelessebougou.  This is in the region of Koulikoro.

Drissa didn't have the opportunity to attend school.  He started working at a young age, in the purchase, stocking and sale of cereals.  He learnt his trade from his maternal uncle, who used to be a big trader of cereals.

Drissa started to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to help him satisfy the needs of his growing customer base.  This will be his fourth individual loan with the field partner, the third loan was correctly repaid on time.  He will use his loan to buy five tonnes of cereals (maize, millet and fonio) from farmer-producers in the Dongoronan region.  He will then stock the cereals for three months prior to reselling them to wholesalers from the big towns, such as Bamako and Ouelessebougou.

Drissa hopes to earn a monthly average of 90,000 francs CFA, which he will use to repay his loan and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Mercyline

texts.en: Mercyline is 31 years old. She is married and she has three (3) children aged 6, 3 1/2 and 4 months old, whom she supports. Mercyline was introduced to KADET Ltd by a KADET staff member, and she is a taking her second loan from KADET of 20,000 KES, which she intends to use to buy school furniture. She has a nursery school which has lasted for six years now. It is located at Zhogato and earns her a monthly income of 15700 KES. She paid back her previous loan of 20,000 KES successfully..Also, she will use the anticipated profit to expand her school. Her hopes and dreams for her future business are to open a primary school and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase school furniture to be used by the school kids.

loans.name: Carol's Group

texts.en:
Modern Farmers is a group of 4 group leader farmers in Busia District with Carol selected as the Kiva representative. Carol has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 32 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 KES.
							
Carol is 38 years old and has been a farmer for 18 years. He works as a farmer to provide for his 7 children. The community and other farmers know him as a hardworking and experienced farmer. Other than farming, he is also involved in community activities such as the men's group. Carol described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.
							
The 2013 Long Rains season won’t be Carol’s first season with One Acre Fund. He first joined in 2012 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to learn new farming methods. As an active member in his community, Carol also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to help more farmers. Carol plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he was able to feed the family.
							
One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Carol and the Modern Farmers Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 36 years old and married. Together with her spouse, they have been blessed with two children. She has a taxi business in Kitengela town and has been in the business for three years. It has been profitable. Right now her monthly income is 55,000 KES (Kenyan shillings).

She plans to use this loan to buy spare parts and be able to service her taxi so it can be in good condition. She will use the profits generated to buy another car for her taxi business. 

This is her third loan term and she paid off all the previous loans successfully. In the future, Rose hopes to be successful in her business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and service her car.

loans.name: Kipailoi

texts.en:
Kipailoi is 40 years old and married to Nashiluni. They are blessed with seven children whom he supports. For the last 15 years, Kipailoi has been a wheat farmer in Narok County, Kenya. He earns 20,000 KES monthly. 

Kipailoi is requesting a 90,000 KES loan with VisionFund to prepare his land and purchase farm inputs to increase his yields. This will be his fifth loan. Kipailoi will use the anticipated profits from his loan to support his business and provide for his family’s basic needs. Kipailoi’s dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to prepare his land and purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael, a 32-year-old married father of two in Embu, earns a living for his family by selling second-hand clothes. Due to limited income to fund his business, he has been unable to expand his business; thus, the reason he is requesting a loan from VisionFund Kenya is to enable him to purchase more bales of clothes and thus, expand his customer base. This, in return, will increase his sales and increase his profits too. 

Currently, his business gives him a monthly income of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). With the additional income he will earn from this improvement, he will plow it back into the business and use the rest to save for his children’s education. 

In the future, Michael would like to continue to invest in his children’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 48 years old and married with six children.

Lydia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Lydia has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from fishing.

Lydia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Maria Maritza

texts.es:
María  tiene 24 años es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con la mamá en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

En la VCR 27 de Mayo sus miembros se dedican a la Agricultura todos viven en el sector del Recinto el Cadial Practicamente se han criado en esda zona. Se dedican a Labores Agrícolas u Pecuarias en su Mayoria.

María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, ademas a la crianza de pollos para luego venderlos. Compra y Vende sus productos en Ventanas en Agroquimicos Briones

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, urea, insumos, fertilizantes abonos y balanceados para los pollos. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar los abonos para la agricultura. 

Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la falta de agua para los riegos. El sueño es poder comprar un carro para el trabajo y para salir de paseo con la familia. En los tiempos libres le gusta ver la television y salir con la familia.
texts.en:
María is 24 and single with no children. She lives with her mother in Ventanas Canton in Los Ríos Province. The members of VCR 27 de Mayo work in agriculture and fishing, and all were born and raised in Recinto el Cadial. 

María works sowing corn and rice, and also rears chickens to sell. She trades her products at Agroquimicos Briones in Ventana. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds, urea, supplies, fertilisers and chicken food.

She has to face challenges such as infestations and diseases, and a lack of water for irrigation. Her dream is to be able to buy a car for work and to take her family out. In her free time she likes to watch TV and go out with her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, supplies, fertilisers and chicken food

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is a married woman with six school-going children. She operates a food-making business where she makes food such as rice and beans and chapati bread to sell to school children. Mwanahawa owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Her major business challenge is seasonality.

Mwanahawa is requesting a 35,000 KES loan to purchase items such as wheat flour, rice, cooking oil, sugar, and beans for her business. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establishing a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase items such as wheat flour, rice, cooking oil, sugar, and beans

loans.name: Naghma

texts.en:
Naghma’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw regularly for many years. Over time, the rickshaw has depreciated and needed to be disposed. Naghma’s children are growing older and they have needs as well. Her husband has been worried for many days about how to buy a new, automatic rickshaw and decrease his maintenance costs. For many years, Naghma and her husband have been saving money to purchase a new rickshaw.

Naghma is requesting a loan so that her husband can supplement their savings and purchase a new rickshaw. She hopes that her husband’s income will increase if he does not need to spend his income maintaining an old rickshaw.

loans.use: to buy new automatic rickshaw

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is the age of 52; she is the mother of three children. Her husband owns an electrician shop in which he sells electrical goods; he also provides services for repairing electric water motors and pumps. He binds the motors of washing machines, water pumps and ceiling fans. For this purpose he has to have a lot of copper cable coils, which are so expensive and out of his purchasing power.

Therefore, Parveen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband becomes empowered to buy copper coils to carry on his services. In addition, he wants some extra electric switches, bulbs, bulb holders, sockets, etc.

This is first loan for Parveen; she showed her wish to take a huge amount after this loan.

loans.use: To buy copper coils for troubleshooting electric motors.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over five years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 46-year-old married woman who has run a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To fully stock her store, she has requested a loan, which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. Rukhsana would then be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Milca

texts.en: Milca, who lives in Dili with her family, started her fish-selling business in 2010 with her own working capital. In order to improve her enterprise, she has requested a loan of $1.000.00 to buy a boat. Milca is generating a good income from selling.

loans.use: To buy a boat

loans.name: Rasad

texts.en:
Rasad is 33 years of age. He is married  and he has three kids who all go to school.  Rasad  is the only earning member of the family and as it is a competitive market; his earnings are not enough to provide sustenance. 

Rasad   decided to give financial assistance to his   family by cultivating khurma (persimmons) in their own land. He applied for a loan of 1000 AZN   from  Aqroinvest CU. With this loan he wants to buy   quality fertilizers. He has chosen this business as there is a good demand for khurma in their locality and in the present market.

In the future he wants to develop his business and earn more profit. His  dreams are to provide higher education to his  sons and to meet the expenses of their family with the profits from his  business. Rasad sincerely thanks Aqroinvest  and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to buy   quality fertilizers

loans.name: Xaqani

texts.en:
Xaqani is 51  years old. He earns a living by breeding cattle, and sells their milk and milk products as well as meat to local butchers. He has 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him how to look after cattle. 

Xaqani    usually buys small cows, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and resells them for a more profitable price to butchers. Milk and yogurt are sold to neighbors. He earns about 180 AZN a month, in part because milk, yogurt, and meat are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma, and always use yogurt. Milk products are seen as very healthy and used daily. 

Because his family has only one source of income, he   is requesting a loan for 1100 AZN to buy  two milk cows. This will be his first loan.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows

loans.name: Ladies Of Vision Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 43-year-old Miriam from Masvingo. She is married with three children, all attending school. She also cares for two other dependents. Miriam runs a manufacturing business producing peanut butter. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenges faced are stiff competition and electricity blackouts. 

Miriam has requested a loan of $600 to buy groundnuts for peanut butter production. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve family welfare. In the future Miriam plans to supply many supermarkets in town.  Miriam is a member of Ladies of Vision Group.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts for peanut butter

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 44 years old. He is married and they have been in farming for the past 18 years.  He would like to use his Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is from Armavir. He lives there with his wife, parents and two school-age children. In 2007 Davit opened a taxi service, which includes a number of cars. He is very attentive and responsible with the clients who use his taxi service. Davit perfectly manages to sustain his family's living and provide them with necessary living conditions. 

Now, by applying for this loan, Davit would like to increase the number of cars he owns by purchasing one more. This will enable him to cover more orders and earn higher income for his family. 

Davit will be very grateful for lenders' goodwill.

loans.use: to purchase a new car to provide taxi service

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is married with two school-going children. They own a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a clothes selling business for the past three years. She sells to town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jose Baltazar

texts.es: José de 27 de años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su madre,  hermana y sobrina. José se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo, este oficio es el que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. José es un joven emprendedor, responsable y  trabajador. Desea mejorar su abastecimiento de agua potable por lo que ha tomado la decisión de construir una pequeña cisterna para almacenar el agua y evitar quedarse sin reserva; en la zona en donde vive, el servicio de agua no es constante por lo que hay días que no se cuenta con el vital líquido. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito  FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, grava, cemento, arena y hierro. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así poder solucionar este inconveniente.
texts.en: José is 27 years old. He lives in a house that the family owns, together with his mother, sister and niece. José has worked for a long time in agriculture. This profession is what allows him to suuport his household, since he does not have another source of income. José is an enterprising, responsible and hard-working young man. He would like to improve the family's storage system for drinking water, and thus he has decided to construct a small cistern to store the water and thus avoid water outages. In the area where he lives, water service is not constant, so that there are days when this vital liquid is not available. Because of this, he is requesting this FUSAI loan to invest in buying bricks, gravel, cement, sand and iron bars. He hopes that he will receive this support and thus be able to solve this problem.

loans.use: to buy bricks, gravel, cement, sand and iron bars to build a cistern.

loans.name: Satribegim

texts.ru: Сатрибегим замужняя мать 3 детей. Ее дети совершеннолетние. Сатрибегим работает в государственной организации медсестрой. Сатрибегим работает уже более 10 лет. Она использует свою зарплату для обеспечения своей семьи. Сатрибегим должна провести свадьбу своего сына, так как он хочет жениться, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Satribegim is a married mother of three children. Her children are grown. Satribegim works in a government organization as a nurse. Satribegim has been working for more than ten years. She uses her salary to support her family.

Satribegim must put on a wedding for her son, since he wants to get married but does not have money. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 somoni to conduct her son's wedding celebration.

loans.use: to put on a wedding party for her son

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle, a 25-year-old married woman blessed with three children, wants to start a retail store in her village. She has therefore requested a loan from generous Kiva lenders of PHP 22,000 to start the business and purchase food products and kitchen necessities to sell. Michelle is hoping that her enterprise will grow and generate significant income.

loans.use: To start up her business and purchase food products and kitchen necessities to sell.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 29 years old and married to Michael. Together, they are blessed with two children ages eight and six. For the past five years, Caroline has been running a general shop in Ndunyu Njeru and she also practices farming. 

Caroline is requesting a loan from VisionFund to buy sugar, rice, cooking oil, and other items. This will be her third loan. She plans to use the anticipated profit from her loan to buy more stock for her shop. In the future, Caroline hopes to apply for bigger loans from VisionFund to enable her to expand her business and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, cooking oil, and other items

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 55 years old and married. He and his wife are blessed with eight children who attend school. Daniel is from Sakutiek and has been a farmer for 20 years. 

Daniel is requesting a loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy seeds and fertilizer for this planting season. He plans to use the anticipated profit from his loan to expand his farm and pay school fees. In the future, Daniel hopes to own the biggest farm in his area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 30 years old and comes from Nakuru. He is married to Lucy and they are blessed with two children aged six and four years.

He owns a motorcycle which he uses to transport his customers. He has been in the business for five years and his monthly income is KES.24,000. He is anticipating to use his profits to repay his loan, educate his children, and buy another motorcycle.

Right now he has applied for his first loan of KES. 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the loan to start another business buying and selling fruits and vegetables. He hopes to buy a power saw in future  in order to increase his income.

loans.use: To  start another business buying and selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ninita

texts.en:
Ninita is married and works hard to support her family. For the past three years, she has operated a fishing business in the Philippines.

Ninita is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Julio Alfredo

texts.es:
Julio tiene 26 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre vive con sus padres, esposa e hijo de 1 año. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama LA PAULINA se encuentra ubicada en el parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto La Paulina, pertenece al cantón Pueblo Viejo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Julio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, cría vacas, cerdos y gallinas desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz, arroz,y balanceado para los animales. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia. Su sueño es seguir en la agricultura y cumplir con los proyectos que se propone.
Le gusta hacer deporte, y mirar la televisión.
texts.en:
Julio, age 26, is in a common-law relationship.  He lives with his parents, partner, and 1-year-old child.  He lives in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.  His communal bank is called La Paulina.  It is located in the Puerto Pechiche parish in the community of La Paulina; it belongs to the Pueblo Viejo region.  This communal bank deals with farm and cattle work.

Julio works in farming, having sown corn and rice, and raised cattle, hogs and chickens for some time. He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the market in the same community.

He asked for a loan for the purchase of fertilizers and amendments for his corn and rice fields, and balanced feed for his livestock.  The loan helped him to increase his income and improve his family’s quality of life.  

His dream is to keep going in agriculture and finish the projects he has come up with.  He likes to play sports and watch television.

loans.use: to sew short-cycle crops such as rice and corn

loans.name: Nelson Agustin

texts.es:
Nelson  tiene 33 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre  vive con su esposa e hijo de 12, 11, 9, 8 y 3 años. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama LA PAULINA se encuentra ubicada en el parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto La Paulina, pertenece al cantón Pueblo Viejo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Nelson se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en Cantón.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado a mejorar sus ingresos. Su sueño es comprarse un terrero y tener un negocio propio.
Le gusta asistir a la iglesia.
texts.en:
Nelson is 33 years old. He is in a common law marriage and lives with his wife and children, aged 12, 11, 9, 8 and 3. He lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province. 

The bank is named LA PAULINA and is located in the Puerto Pechiche parish in the community of La Paulina. It belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton and the bank is dedicated to farming and livestock work. Nelson works as a farmer, and has grown corn and rice for some years. He buys his materials in Ventanas and sells his products in the market there and in Cantón.

He asked for the loan to buy fertilizer to grow corn and rice. The loan has helped him to improve his income. His dream is to buy some land and have his own business. He likes to go to church.

loans.use: to grow rice and corn.

loans.name: Gerardo Leonel

texts.es:
Gerardo tiene 24 años de edad, estado civil soltero vive con sus padres, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama LA PAULINA se encuentra ubicada en el parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto La Paulina, pertenece al cantón Pueblo Viejo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Gerardo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventana y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abonos para la siembra del maíz, arroz y un motor de riego. El préstamo le ayudado a mejorar en los negocios. Su sueño es comprar un carro.
Le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 24 years old. He is single and lives with his parents. He lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province. The bank is named 
LA PAULINA. It is located in the Puerto Pechiche parish in the community of La Paulina. It belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton. The bank is dedicated to agricultural and livestock work. 

Gerardo works as a farmer, having grown corn and rice for some years. He buys his materials in Ventanas and sells his products in the market there. He asked for the loan to buy fertilizer to plant corn and rice and to buy an irrigation motor. The loan has helped him to improve his businesses. His dream is to buy a car. He likes to play football.

loans.use: to buy an irrigation motor for his crops.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a hardworking woman who strives to better her standard of her living. The previous loan helped her to boost her business and she comes to you again requesting a loan of Kshs 10,000 to add to her stock of sugar, rice, soaps, salt and maize flour for sale. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to add to her stock of sugar, rice, soaps, salt and maize flour for sale

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en:
Sumera is the wife of a retailer and a responsible mother with children. She lives in a remote area of Lahore, Pakistan. Sumera’s husband works selling a variety of daily use products in his shop, including sugar, salt, rice, biscuits, cooking oils, sweets, ice cream, and many other items. 

Sumera is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can purchase cooking oil and rice for his store to replenish his stock. In the future, she and her husband want to provide a bright and successful future for their children. Sumera says hello and sends best wishes to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil and rice to sell

loans.name: Om-Yusuf Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Yusuf and consists of four members who are all females from Sana`a, Yemen. They primarily work together but in different businesses. The group took a loan of 250,000 YER.

Fatima, 47, is a married woman with children. She has been practicing her profession of dressmaking for a long time. Her main business is sewing and she  has a good reputation. She learned in a sewing lab until she got more experience in order to continue her business.

She is requesting a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB to buy sewing materials such as fabrics, needles and strings to use for her business since competition has affected her sales a great deal and she needs more merchandise to offer her clients. She hopes to increase both her clientele and her income.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as fabrics, needles and strings to use for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 44 años de edad, está casada con Carlos quien se dedica a la construcción civil  y es padre de sus 2 hijos. Juntos habitan cómodamente su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Elizabeth es la venta de cosméticos y accesorios para damas como carteras, billeteras, juguetes, peluches, adornos esmaltes, cremas faciales, perfumes y otros. Ha establecido su local de ventas en un espacio de su casa hasta donde acude su clientela, ahí exhibe toda su mercadería en completo orden ya que se encuentran ubicados en vitrinas o maniquíes para una mejor visión de las mismas. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y familiares quienes le compran al crédito o al contado. Lleva en este negocio 6 años y por fortuna le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su actividad son los viajes que realiza a otras ciudades en donde compra su mercadería, le agrada escoger ella misma las prendas que luego ofrecerá a sus clientes porque sabe que se sentirán contentos con los modelos que obtiene y con la calidad de los productos que tendrán en sus manos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará accesorios para damas tales como carteras, talcos, perfumes, entre otros.
texts.en:
44-year old Elizabeth is married to Carlos with whom she has two children. He works in civil construction. They live in a comfortable house of their own. 

Elizabeth sells cosmetics and accessories such as purses, wallets, toys, stuffed animals, nail varnish, face cream, perfume etc. She has established a space in her house where her customers come to see her products. They are displayed in glass cases or on mannequins so people can see them easily. Elizabeth's main customers are her neighbours or family members who buy on credit or for cash. She's had the business for six years and luckily all is going well. 

The part of her job that she most enjoys is travelling to other towns to buy products. She enjoys choosing the clothing that she then sells to her customers as she knows they will be happy with the styles and the quality of the merchandise.

Elizabeth is now seeking a loan of S/.1500. She is very happy to receive this financial assistance to improve her business. With the loan money she will buy more items such as purses, talcum powder, perfume etc.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and accessories for women

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна замужем. У нее двое детей. Татьяна имеет свой бизнес - продает продукты питания на центральном рынке. Опыт работы у нее 18 лет. Наиболее продаваемыми являются такие товары:  сыр, масло, маргарин и колбасы. Татьяна настойчивая и трудолюбивая.  Татьяна с мужем много работают, чтобы обеспечить семью всем необходимым.

Татьяна уже пользовалась КИВА кредитами и считает их очень удобными и полезными для своего бизнеса. Благодаря КИВА кредитам Татьяна смогла приобрести торговое место и оборудование, что положительно повлияло на развитие ее бизнеса. В этот раз Татьяна просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 13,000 гривен на увеличение ассортимента товара. Кредит поможет увеличить доход семьи.
texts.en:
Tatyana is married. She has two children. Tatyana has her own business: she sells groceries in the central market. She has 18 years of work experience. The best-selling products are: cheese, butter, margarine and sausages. Tatyana is persevering and hardworking. Tatyana and her husband work a lot in order to support the family with the necessities.

Tatyana already used KIVA for loans and considers it very convenient and useful for her business. Thanks to KIVA loans, Tatyana was able to acquire a trading post and equipment, which has had a positive impact on the development of her business. This time, Tatyana is requesting a loan of 13,000 hryvnia to expand her assortment of goods.

The loan will help to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to increase product variety

loans.name: Wabuke's Group

texts.en:
Wabuke is a member of Hope Life Group in Chwele District.  He is pictured here in a group of 7 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  These group leaders represent a total of 88 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Wabuke has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize seeds and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet seeds.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Wabuke is a reliable member of the community.  He is married with four children.  Wabuke is 32 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 10 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Wabuke is very active in his community and is involved in the savings group.  He described his harvest last year as excellent.  He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and also continue enjoying the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.

The 2014 Long Rains season won’t be Wabuke’s first season with One Acre Fund.  He first joined One Acre Fund in 2007 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods.  As an active member in his community, Wabuke also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Wabuke plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school.  His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he has more profits from his harvest.

Wabuke and the Hope Life Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora was born in 1984.  She is the married parent of four children. 

Gulnora is a responsible person. She has been busy with animal husbandry more than 15 years. She has a great experience in this field. She knows all aspects of her deal well. 

Gulnora fattens cows in her house. She grows corn for cattle in her land of house. She also grows potatoes. She wants to increase her working capital and in this way to develop her business. 

She is asking for a loan of TJS 5,000 to buy cattle for increasing her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy more cattle and increase her working capital

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 25 years old and married.  She has two children, 14 and 8 years old, whom she supports. 

She is a fish monger.  She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer.  She has been in this business for five years, located at Kijiwetanga.  In her business she earns a monthly income of KES 4,450. 

She is taking her first loan of KES 15,000, which she intends to use in adding stock to her business by buying more fish. Margaret will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. 

Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to educate her children and live a better life.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es:
Milagro de 35 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos;  el mayor de 15 años, el segundo hijo tiene 11 años y la niña de 3 años de edad, los mayores estudian en la escuela de la comunidad el nivel básico.

Ella estudio hasta tercer grado en la comunidad. Se acompañó hace 16 años y con su esposo siempre han trabajado muy fuerte para sacar adelante a su familia, ella procede de una familia de siete hermanos quienes trabajaron con sus padres en la agricultura. En su casa solo vive con su esposo y sus hijos y también tiene un hijo de crianza a quien también mantiene.

Milagro se dedica, a la venta de verduras desde hace 16 años, cuando ella se acompañó con su esposo y este le enseño el trabajo, al ver que es bastante demandado en la zona, por ser estos necesarios en la dieta alimenticia del ser humano.

Antes solo trabajaba con su familia en la siembra de granos básicos y los quehaceres del hogar. Ella viaja a comprar la mercadería a la ciudad, 4 veces al mes, tiene que viajar en bus por una hora y media para llegar al destino donde compra las verduras, lo hace acompañada de sus hijos o de su esposo.

Ella sale a veces sola, o también la acompaña su hijo mayor a vender en las comunidades aledañas y en la comunidad donde vive. Ella no tiene horario fijo de entrada y de salida, ya que todo depende de la demanda que haya en la zona donde va a vender. Sale de su casa a las 7 de la mañana y sabe regresar a las dos de la tarde, es variable.

El financiamiento que solicita lo necesita, es para comprar verduras (pepinos, tomates, repollo, remolacha, zanahoria, chiles, cebolla, ajo, brocoli, lechuga y especies como canela, achiote, pimienta, cominos, y otros). El resto lo necesita para comprar madera para mejorar su vivienda, pues una parte de la casa la madera está dañada.

Con ello pretende incrementar sus productos y ofertar más a sus clientes y en esta temporada de navidad las ventas se incrementan.

Sueña sacar adelante a sus hijos en los estudios y a la vez ampliar su negocio, producto de las ganancias que ella obtiene en las ventas que realiza en la comunidad y las zonas aledañas.
texts.en:
Milagro, 35, is the mother of three children; the oldest is 15, the second is 11, and the youngest is three years old. The older ones go to the community school.

She went to school through third grade in the community. She got together with her husband 16 years ago and they have always worked very hard to move their family forward. Milagro comes from a family of seven siblings who worked with her parents in farming. She lives with her husbands and children, and she also has an adopted child who she cares for.

Milagro has worked by selling vegetables for 16 years. When she got together with her husband, he taught her how to work since there is a high demand in the area, because these products are necessary in the human diet.

Before, she had only worked with her family by planting basic grains and doing household chores. She travels to buy merchandise in the city four times a month. She has to travel by bus for an hour and a half to get to her destination, where she buys vegetables. Her children or her husband go along with her.

Sometimes, she goes alone, or with her oldest son, to sell in the outlying communities and in the community where she lives. She doesn’t have a fixed schedule for arriving and leaving, since it depends on the demand in the area where she is selling. She leaves home at seven in the morning and tends to return around two in the afternoon, but this varies.

She needs the loan she is requesting to buy vegetables such as cucumbers, tomatoes, cabbage, beets, carrots, chilies, onions, garlic, broccoli, lettuce, and spices such as cinnamon, achiote, pepper, cumin, and more. The rest of the loan will be used to buy wood to improve her home because part of the wood house is damaged.

With this, she hopes to improve her products and offer more to her customers, and in this Christmas season, her sales increase.

She dreams of moving her children forward with their education and also of improving her business from the earnings she makes from the sales in the community and surrounding areas.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as cucumbers, tomatoes, cabbage, beets, carrots, chilies, onions, garlic, broccoli, lettuce, and spices such as cinnamon, achiote, pepper, cumin, and more. The rest of the loan will be used to buy wood to improve her home because part of the wood house is damaged.

loans.name: Luz Enid

texts.es: Luz ha sido una mujer dedicada a su familia y a su trabajo, durante su vida productiva ha obtenido experiencia como vendedora en diferentes legumbrerías y tiendas de abarrotes, pero desde hace 15 años inició su propia legumbrería ya que contaba con el conocimiento necesario para manejar este tipo de negocio y con el ánimo de generar mejores ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar. El establecimiento está ubicado en un espacio que adecuó en la parte externa de su casa, allí trabaja todos los días de 7:00 am a 9:00 pm, ofrece todo tipo de frutas y verduras, además de lácteos, carnes frías y pulpas de fruta, entre otros, de esta manera genera los recursos necesarios para solventar los gastos del hogar. A sus 44 años de edad, solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (frutas y verduras, lácteos, carnes frías, entre otros) y para realizar adecuaciones locativas (poner techo en la parte exterior), esto le permitirá ampliar su negocio tanto en inventario, como en espacio, pues tendrá mayor capacidad de almacenamiento y sus clientes podrán realizar las compras de manera más cómoda, logrando incrementar las ventas con la nueva apariencia que tendrá el establecimiento. Luz manifiesta que su principal meta es ampliar aún más el local, para que le permita tener una mejor rentabilidad y siga siendo su principal fuente de ingresos, con los que dará mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a los suyos.
texts.en: Luz is a woman who is always dedicated to her family and her work. During her working life, she has gained experience as a seller in various fruit and vegetable markets and grocery stores. Then, 15 yeas ago, she opened her own fruit and vegetable store, since she had the necessary knowledge to manage this type of business, and she wanted to generate more income to contribute to her household economy. The business is located in a space that she set up outside of her house. She works there every day from 7:00 am to 9:00 pm. She offers all types of fruits and vegetables, in addition to dairy products, cold meats and fruit purees, among other products. In this way, she generates the resources she needs to cover her household expenses. At the age of 44, she is requesting the help of the loan to invest in buying a variety of merchandise on a wholesale basis (fruits and vegetables, dairy products, and cold meats, among others), and to carry out improvements to her shop (putting a roof over the exterior part). This will permit her to expand her business in terms of both inventory and space. Thus she will have more storage capacity, and her customers will be able to make their purchases in greater comfort. The improved appearance of her shop will also help increase her sales. Luz states that her main goal is to expand her shop even more, so that it will be more profitable and continue being her main source of income, allowing her to provide more well-being and a better quality of life to her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables and other foods on a wholesale basis, and to improve her store by adding an exterior roof.

loans.name: Yudis Ismenia

texts.es:
Yudis de 20 años de edad, estudio solamente hasta noveno grado, dado a que se acompaño muy joven y su padres no lo quisieron seguir ayudando y a los pocos ingresos de su esposo como albañil tampoco la pudo ayudar  y decidió mejor poner un negocio de ventas de tortillas, siguiendo el ejemplo de su mamá. Esta acompañada su pareja es albañil, a la fecha tiene una hija de 3 años.

Yudis tiene un puesto de tortillas y tiene alrededor de dos años de tenerlo. Ademas, de la venta de tortillas también vende frescos, el negocio lo tiene en su casa y solamente se involucra ella. Ella trabaja desde las 9 hasta las 5 de la tarde todos los días.


Yudis ademas de las tortillas, quiere hacer pupusas por las tardes; ya que hacer tortillas todo el día le resulta muy pesado y el dinero del préstamo lo ocupara para comprar, una plancha y comprar los materiales para la venta y hacer una galerita, pues teniendo un negocio mas fuerte y mas productivo aumentara sus ingresos y por siguiente mejorara su calidad de vida.


Los sueños de Yudis es poder seguir estudiando y poder hacer crecer su negocio junto con su familia, ella espera darle un futuro mejor a su hija y ayudar a su esposo.
texts.en:
Yudis is 20 years old. She is in a common-law relationship and has a three year old child. Her partner is a bricklayer. She only studied until Grade 9 as she entered a common-law relationship at a very young age and her parents did not want to continue supporting her. Her husband who did not make much money as a bricklayer could not help her either. So she decided to sell tortillas following the example of her mother.

Yudis has had a tortilla stall for the past two years. Besides tortillas she sells soft drinks. She sells at her house and she works alone. She works from 9 am until 5pm every day.

Yudis wants to also make pupusas in the afternoon as making tortillas everyday is hard work. The money from the loan will be used to buy a grill, and materials for her sales and make a small gallery. This will make her business stronger and more productive, increasing her sales and improving her quality of living.

Yudis' dreams of continuing her studies and being able to grow her business along with her family. She wants a better future for her daughter and wants to help her husband.

loans.use: to buy a grill and buy materials for her sales and making a small gallery.

loans.name: Ngunku Obosongo Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of three farmers called Nguku Obosongo, and it is based within the Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

The person raising her hand in the picture is Tabitha. She is 36 years old and married with four children, who go to school. Tabitha has been a member of the group since 2009, and she is the group’s chairperson.

Tabitha has been learning better farming methods within her group, and she desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on her farm to grow maize, sorghum, and millet during the 2014 long rains seasons.  She is however constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable her to purchase these farm inputs. 

Tabitha believes that the use of hybrid seeds and fertilizer will increase her yields, and she will not only get enough food for her family but will also sell the surplus and obtain money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Galaty

texts.ru: Галати разведена и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Она работает более 26 лет в государственном учреждении, уборщицей. Галати очень чистоплотная женщина. Она старается наводить порядок и чистоту, как дома, так и на работе. Она живет в старом доме. Ее крыша течет. Она должна отремонтировать крышу своего дома, но не имеет денег, чтобы купить шифер. Во время дождя ей приходится очень трудно. Галати запрашивает займ на сумму 700 сомони для покупки шифера. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Galaty is divorced and has two children. She has been working for more than 26 years as a cleaner in a state facility. Galaty is a very neat woman. She tries to bring order and cleanliness, both at home and at work.

She lives in an old home. Her roof leaks. She must do repairs on the roof of her home, but she does not have money to buy slates. When it is raining, things get very difficult for her. Galaty is requesting a loan of 700 somoni to purchase slates.

loans.use: to buy slate for repairing the roof of her house

loans.name: Ganjina

texts.ru: Ганчина молодая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 25 лет. Она разведена и имеет 1 ребенка, которому 2 года. Ганчина работает в кафе официанткой. Она как честный сотрудник выполняет свою работу отлично. Ганчина получает зарплату каждый месяц и использует для обеспечения своего ребенка. Она живет в родительском доме. Ганчина хочет провести церемонию обрезания своего сына, но не имеет денег. Ганчина запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для проведения церемония обрезания. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Ganjina is a young and determined woman. She is 25 years old. She is divorced and has one small child who is two years old. Ganjina works as a waitress in a cafe. As an honest coworker, she fulfills her job with excellence. Ganjina receives wages every month and uses them to support her child. She lives in her parents' home.

Ganjina wants to conduct a circumcision ceremony for her son, but she does not have money. Ganjina is requesting a loan of 2,500 somoni to conduct a circumcision ceremony.

loans.use: to put on a circumcision ceremony for her son

loans.name: Wilver

texts.en:
Wilver is aged 50, married, and blessed with four children. He has been engaged in the farming business for almost fifteen years. He is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 18,000 to buy fertilizers and seeds to grow for his farming business. 

In the future, Wilver hopes that his agricultural business will continue to grow so that he can cover the needs of his family, most especially the needs of his children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farming business

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina dreams of lifting her family's living status right now. She is 43 years old and operates a “carinderia” or mini-restaurant as a source of income. 

Income generated is used for food, allowances, and the tuition fees of her four children. 

Now her business needs additional capital to purchase rice, raw meat, and vegetables for a variety of viands to sell. Thus, she is asking for a loan of PHP 17,000. She is hoping that generous lenders will grant her loan request.

loans.use: to purchase rice, raw meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is 45 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school, Olga works very hard to provide for them.

Olga runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for one year.

In the future Olga would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 31 years old from Nakuru. He is married to Jane and they are blessed with three children, age 10, 8 and 3 years old.

He owns a posho mill that he uses to grind maize, and he sells flour to his customers. This is a business he has been running for the last 10 years. 

To enable him to buy more stock of maize so as to maximize his profit, he has applied for his sixth loan of KES 50,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Right now, his monthly income is KES 30,000 and he hopes to use the anticipated profit to educate his children and to expand his business further. In future, Elijah hopes to build his plot and buy a public service vehicle.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of cereals like maize to grind and sell flour to his customers.

loans.name: Rene Leodan

texts.es:
RENE tiene 37 años de edad de edad civil unión libre  tiene un hijo de ocho meses, vive con la pareja en casa de unos familiares en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC 27 DE MAYO sus miembros se ddeican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Cadial Practicamente se han criado en esa zona se dedican a labores agrícolas u Pecuarias en su mayoria.

RENE se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, líquido mata maleza, abonos y balanceado de engorde y crianza. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras y para los pollos para luego venderlos.

Las compras y las ventas lo hará en Ventanas cada 15 días dependiendo la siembra y la comida parfa los animales cada semana.

El sueño es seguir trabajado en la agricultura para aumentar los ingresos economicos. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y caminar con la esposa por el campo.
texts.en:
Rene, age 37, lives in a common-law relationship.  He has an eight month-old son and lives with his partner in the house of some family members in Ventanas, Los Ríos province. In his free time, he likes to play sports and walk with his partner through the countryside.

The members of the "27 de Mayo" communal bank work in agriculture.  All of them live in the Cadial community.  Almost everyone raised in this community works in agricultural or ranching when they grow up.

Rene works in farming, sowing corn and raising chickens.  He is asking for this loan to buy urea, insecticides, liquid weed-killer, soil amendments, and balanced feed for raising and fattening animals.  With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy what he needs for the crops and for the chickens so that he can later sell them.

He completes his purchases and sales in Ventanas every two weeks, depending on the crops, and he buys the animal feed each week.

His dream is to keep working in agriculture to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticides, liquid weedkiller, soil amendments and feed for raising and fattening animals

loans.name: Nezar Kleber

texts.es:
Nezar tiene 60 años. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos, 

Nezar es un socio de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Nezar trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz y arroz. Hace sus ventas en el comercial García de Ventanas. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar agricultura de verano para sembrar: comprar semillas, fertilizantes, liquidos para la maleza y abonos. con la ayuda del credito ha podido coprar lo necesario para la siembra. Enfrenta desafios como la falta de mano de obra y la competencia de precios. 

Su sueño es progresar el la agricultura y tener mayor ingresos para dejar a los hijos que sigan trabajando. Le gusta hacer deporte en un equipo que tiene en el barrio ademas de gusta ver la television en especial el noticiero.
texts.en:
Nezar is 60 years old.  He lives in a common-law relationship in the Ventanas region, in the Los Ríos province.  He has four children. He likes to play sports on a team that they have in the neighborhood, and he also likes to watch television, especially the news.

Nezar is a member of the Recinto San Ramón communal bank, which is located in Nuevo San Ramón, 12 kilometers from Ventanas.  There are twenty members in all, who work in short-cycle agriculture (with a harvest in six months). This is the first loan that they are taking out with the Cooperativa San Jose.

Nezar works in agriculture, growing corn and rice.  He makes his sales in the García market in Ventanas.

He is asking for this loan to buy summer crops to sow: to buy seeds, fertilizers, liquid weed-killers, and soil amendments.  With the help of the loan he has been able to buy everything necessary for sowing.  He has faced challenges such as a lack of workers and competitive pricing.

His dream is to progress in agriculture and get a bigger income so that he can allow his children to keep on working.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, liquid weed-killers, and soil amendments

loans.name: Gina Pilar

texts.es:
GINA  tiene 25 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y el conyugue en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

La VRC 27 DE MAYO sus miembros se ddeican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Cadial Practicamente se han criado en esa zona se dedican a labores agrícolas u Pecuarias en su mayoria.

GINA  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, líquido mata maleza semillas y abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes que son necesarios para las siembras.

Enfrenta desafios como la competencia y el clima.

Las compras y las ventas lo realizo en ventanas en Comercial Kit

El sueño es comprar mas terrenos para seguir sembrando y aumentar los ingresos. En el tiempo le gusta leer la biblia y sobre todo reflexionar.
texts.en:
Gina is 25 and lives with her partner and her two children in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province. The members of VRC 27 de Mayo were all born and raised in Recinto el Cadial and most work in agriculture and fishing.

Gina works sowing corn and rice. She is asking for a loan to buy urea, pesticides, liquid weed killer, seeds and fertiliser, which she needs for her job. She faces challenges such as competition and the climate. She trades her produce in Comercial Kit in Ventanas.

Her dream is to buy more land so she can continue sowing more crops and increase her earnings. In her free time she likes to read the Bible and reflect.

loans.use: to buy urea, pesticides, liquid weed killer, seeds and fertiliser

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José tiene 25 años de edad, estado civil soltero vive con sus padres, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama LA PAULINA se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto La Paulina, pertenece al cantón Pueblo Viejo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
José se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años y cría ganado. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de lo necesario para la siembra. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener dos cuadras de cacao con riego.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
José is 25 years old. He is single and lives with his parents. He lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province. The bank is called 
LA PAULINA and is located in the Puerto Pechiche parish in the community of La Paulina, belonging to the Pueblo Viejo canton. This bank is dedicated to agriculture and livestock work. 

José  works in farming. He has grown corn and rice for some years and he raises cattle. He buys his materials in Ventanas and sells his products in the same place.

He asked for the loan to buy what he needs for planting. The loan has helped him increase his income for his family and to invest. His dream is to have two plots of cacao with irrigation. He likes to play sports.

loans.use: to grow corn and rice.

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Everlyn is married with six school-going children. For the past four years, she has operated a poultry business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Everlyn owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for her family. Her major business challenge is the high cost of transportation. Everlyn decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

Everlyn is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is a married man with four children, two in school and two not yet old enough for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a poultry selling business. He sells to his neighbours and passersby. His major challenge is the high cost of transportation to his place of operation.

With the Ksh 10,000 he wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Mapenzi

texts.en:
Mapenzi is a married woman with three children who all go to school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity.

She has operated a kerosene selling business for the past one year. She cites transportation costs as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is married and has four school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a poultry-selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a woman who does tailoring to support her family. She has done the business for some time and she has established customers. The previous loan she took out was very beneficial to her and she intends to expand the business by requesting a loan of Kshs 10,000 to buy additional sewing thread, needles and material for the business. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy additional sewing thread, needles and material for the business

loans.name: Sultana Group

texts.en:
The Sultana Group consists of four ladies from Sana`a, Yemen. Each member has her own type of business. They have requested a group loan of 250,000 Yemeni rials (YER) and they will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment. 

Sultana is a 47-year-old mother of four children. She has been selling ladies' clothes and perfumes. The income from this business was not enough to cover her children's school fees and other important household expenses.  She would like to expand her business in order to meet her clients' needs. So she is asking for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB in order to buy clothes, perfumes, incense and other items that will be used to earn more profit. Her dream is to one day diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes and incense and other items that will be used to earn more profit.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with three children, all of whom go to school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has been selling pigs at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds.  She is requesting a loan of  20,000 KES to purchase more pigs for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs for her business

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is  taking out a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as beer, Fanta, Coca-Cola. noodles and cigarettes. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $100.  She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy beer, Fanta, Coca-Cola, noodles and cigarettes

loans.name: Ana Emelina

texts.es:
Ana, es parte de una familia compuesta por su esposo y sus dos hijos, por la necesidad de buscar un mejor estilo de vida para su familia y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares ella emprendió el negocio de venta de pupusas en el mercado se su localidad, lo hace de 6:00 a.m. a 11:00 p.m., hasta la fecha no se le dificulta administrarlo.
El capital que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, maíz, gas propano y otros, productos necesarios para elaborar sus productos, espera mejorar el servicio, aumentar su clientela y mejorar la economía familiar, con la que cancelara sus deudas.
Sueña con mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda y salir adelante junto a su familia
texts.en:
Ana's family is made up of her, her husband and their two children. Out of need to seek out a better lifestyle for her family and support her husband with the household expenses, she started a business selling pupusas in her neighborhood market. Her business is open from 6:00 am to 11:00 pm. She has not yet faced difficulty managing the business. 

The capital that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of soft cheese, pork rinds, cooking oil, corn, propane gas and other items necessary to make her pupusas. She hopes to improve her service, increase her clientele and improve her family's economic conditions while paying back her loans. Ana dreams of improving her home's infrastructure and getting ahead alongside her family.

loans.use: to buy soft cheese, pork rinds, cooking oil, corn, and propane gas.

loans.name: Ivette Del Rosario

texts.es: Ivette tiene 36 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Casada y madre de dos hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio en este negocio hace cinco años, vendiendo una variedad de cosméticos; luego con la ayuda de su esposo, quien le proporciono el dinero para establecer  el negocio de pulpería. Poco a poco fue creciendo y actualmente cuenta con un negocio prospero.  Su meta es mantener surtido el negocio. Solicita el crédito para la compra de granos básicos: Arroz, Frijoles, Aceite, Azúcar entre otros, con el fin de ofrecer los productos más demandados de su cartera. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias. Seguir creciendo para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Ivette is 36 and from Granada. She is married with two children. She is a merchant and has a general store.
She started her business five years ago, selling a variety of cosmetics. Later, with the help of her husband, who gave her the money to establish her business, she started her general store. 
Bit by bit, her store has been growing, and she now has a prosperous business. Her goal is to keep her business stocked. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of basic staples: rice, beans, oil, sugar, etc. Her goal is to offer the most highly-demanded products. She thinks that the loan will help her to increase her sales and obtain a greater income. It will help her to keep growing and to improve the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to purchase basic staples: rice, beans, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is 60 years of age and married. She has three children who are all married. She manages planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables on her own land. Madina has been involved in farming for 17 years. She is the only breadwinner of the family. 

To meet her family's everyday needs, she is working every day. Her husband and elder son assist her greatly in her horticultural activities.
 
To be able to continue her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Madina needs a loan of 500 AZN to purchase seeds and fertilizer. She and her family are very thankful to all the lenders for helping them sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and  fertilizer.

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.en:
Tofiq is 38 years of age and married. He is raising three children with his wife. 

When he was 30, he started to learn to work in agriculture. His parents were the ones who taught him to grow fruits and vegetables, since it was their only source of income. 

Tofiq sells his crops in the central bazaar to make profits in order to support his family. His  income from his business is 150 AZN. 

In order to improve the living conditions of his family, he plans to expand his business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. He believes in the near future his sons will help him to expand the business. Since the vegetable and fruits business is profitable and a fun business, he wants the business to continue and prosper.

Tofiq needs a 1,500 AZN loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and fruit trees. His biggest wish is to offer his children an education so that they can have good careers and help their family. His full thanks go to Aqroinvest and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and fruit trees.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 24 years old and married. He has one child, 3 1/2 years old, whom he supports. 

He has a butchery.  He was introduced to Visionfund Kenya by an officer.  He has been in this business for six years, located at Gongoni.  In his business he earns a monthly income of KES 21,000. 

He is taking his second loan of KES 30,000, which he intends to use to bjuy more meat.  Alfred will use the anticipated profit to expand his business.

His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to open a butchery and educate his child.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 26 years old, and she runs a boutique shop in Oloitoktok town. She sells clothes and shoes, and she has been in this business for four years now. 

She is married and together with her spouse, she has been blessed with two children. She currently makes an income of KES 9,500.

She plans to use the loan to buy more stocks of clothes, shoes, and handbags for resale. She will use the generated profits to educate her children. 

This is her first loan term.  In the future she hopes to build her own home and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of new clothes, handbags, and shoes for resale

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama operates a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. 

She is requesting for KES 20,000 to boost her kiosk by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and tea leaves. She appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu.

loans.use: to boost her kiosk by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and tea leaves.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 38 years old and widowed with two children. She has a business selling fruits and vegetables and has been running it for four years. She currently gets a monthly income of 4,000 KES and it has been profitable.

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables for resale; these include oranges, mangoes and cabbages. She will use the anticipated income to expand her business by opening another grocery business.

This is her first loan term and she hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru: Елена торгурет на рынке мужской одеждой. У нее большой опыт работы и три тогровые точки. Она уже пользовалась кредитами от КИВЫ и считает их удобными и полезными для своего бизнеса. В этот раз Елена хочет обновить свой товар - закупить новый ассортимент зимних мужских джиносовых брюк и курток. Большой и свежий ассортимент даст Елене конкурентное преимущество и увеличит ее продажи. Также Елена сможет сохранить два рабочих места, т.к. у Елены работает два продавца. Часть прибыли Елена хочет вложить обратно в бизнес, а часть пойдет на повседневные расходы для ее семьи, т.к. бизнес Елены является основным источником дохода в семье.
texts.en:
Yelena trades men's clothing at the market. She has a lot of work experience and three trading posts. She has already used loans from KIVA and considers them convenient and useful for her business.

At this time, Yelena wants to renew her inventory: to purchase a new variety of winter men's denim trousers and jackets. A large and fresh assortment gives Yelena a competitive advantage and increases her sales. Similarly, Yelena will be able to maintain two work sites since she works for two sellers. Yelena wants to invest part of the profits back in the business, and part will go to living expenses for her family since Yelena's business is the main source of income in the family.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal denim clothing for winter

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 52-year-old single mother of two children who are 24 and 18 years old.

She has a farming business in Ndunyu Njeru which she has operated for twenty three years. She is appling for an eighth loan from Vision Fund ltd to  buy a buy fertilizer, seeds, a heifer, and pay labor costs. She will use the profit to repay the loan and pay school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to expand her farming business to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, a heifer, and pay labor costs.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a widower with two children. He earns an income by selling grocery items in his village. With his revenue, he is able to provide for his children. James wants his children to have a better future and he always finds a way to meet their needs. 

In addition to his retail business, he also rents chairs and tables. James is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to restock beverages, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste to sell. 

James hopes to expand his business and increase his profits.

loans.use: to restock beverages, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste  to sell.

loans.name: Yenny Evelyn

texts.es:
Yenny, es casada, vive junto a su esposo, por la necesidad de generar ingresos para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar por iniciativa propia instalo un atienda en su casa de habitación, abre su negocio a las 7:00 a.m. y lo cierra a las 4:00 p.m., por su ubicación no se le hace difícil atenderlo.
Con la inversión comprara bebidas, dulces, azúcar, galletas, entre otro tipo de golosinas, con lo que su tienda estará mucho más surtida y ofrecerá variedad de productos, espera aumentar sus ventas generar más ingresos y cancelar su deuda.
Sueña con tener un negocio más rentable para poder tener un local más grande y así aumentar y mantener su cleintela.
texts.en:
