Yenny, is married and lives with her husband. Because of the need to generate income to help her husband with the household expenses, she opened a store in her home. It is open from 7 am until 4 pm. It is easy to run due to it's location.

Yenny will use the loan to buy soft drinks, sweets, sugar, cookies and other kinds of candies so her store will be better stocked and offer a variety of products. She hopes to expand her sales, generating more income so she can pay off her debt. She dreams of owning a more profitable business and have a bigger store so she can maintain and increase her clientele.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sweets, sugar and cookies.

loans.name: Sandra Lisbet

texts.es:
Sandra, se dispone a adquirir materia prima para su negocio, con el capital comprara maíz, frijol, quesillo, chicharrón, repollos, aceite, gas propano, para seguir trabajando y dar una buen atención a sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior fortaleció su negocio de venta de tortillas, aumento ventas, sus ingresos fueron mejores, sigue contando con la fidelidad de sus clientes, tambien hoy tiene pupuseria y a cancelado sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Sandra is ready to obtain more products for her business. With the loan money she wishes to buy corn, beans, quesillo (tortilla with cream cheese filling), pork crackling, cabbage, oil, propane gas so she can keep her business going and satisfy her customers.

With her previous loan, she improved her tortilla business, increased sales and earned more money. She can count on regular regular customers. Sandra now has her own business and has paid off her debts.

loans.use: Buy corn, beans, tortillas, pork crackling, cabbage, oil and propane gas

loans.name: Arther

texts.en:
Arther is 39 years old and married to Lucy. They are blessed with four children between the ages of 17 and 2.

He has been in a quarry business in Ndunyu Njeru for eight years. This is Arther's fourth loan from Vision Fund Kenya which he will use to pay for quarry laborers and school fees . He will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for his children.

In the near future, he hopes to expand his quarry business and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for quarry laborers and school fees.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 61 years old, widowed,  and no one is supported by him.

He is in a farming business in Ndunyu Njeru which he has practiced for seven years. He has applied for his eighth loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy fertilizer, seeds and pay for labor. With anticipated profit, he plans to repay the loan and expand his farming business.

In the near future, he hopes to expand his farming business so as to increase his income.

loans.use: To  buy fertilizer, seeds and pay for labor.

loans.name: Barasengo B Group

texts.en:
This group of six farmers is called Barasengo B. It is a group of Nuru International farmers who are based within the Kuria West District. The group members came together to grow socially and economically through agriculture. Zachary, who is has his hand on his head, is the chairperson of the group and has been a member since 2011. He is 40 years old and is married with four children.

Zachary will use his portion of the Kiva loan to acquire hybrid seed and fertilizer which will enable him obtain high yields. Zachary, just like other members of his group, will take input loans for one acre and will grow maize on 1/2 acre and sorghum and millet on a ¼ acre each. He will sell his surplus and use the profit to pay school fees for his children. Zachary plans to join a savings program to save some of his money to obtain a good loan to start a clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen lives with his big family in Gogaran village of Lori region. His family consists of his parents, sister, and his wife and three little children who appear in this photo. Arsen is an agronomist with 20 years of experience running his farm. He has a small plot of land and some livestock including four cows, four pigs, two calves and 30 chickens. His family sells the meat and milk they produce with the help of re-sellers. Despite this, Arsen’s family’s living conditions are very poor and they have many financial problems. 

Arsen is requesting a loan to purchase two more cows and forage for his livestock. He hopes that his loan will be successful for him and will increase his family’s agricultural income. He would like to ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and forage for his livestock

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima, 46, is a married woman; she has been running a business selling animals for many years. She buys baby goats at low prices, brings them up and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). Now she has three goats. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation; currently she is requesting a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase two more goats. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Saleeman

texts.en:
Saleeman is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 3 years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she is on her sixth loan and has applied for a loan of 20,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR). With this loan she will be able to purchase stocks of grains, rice and cleaning products such as shampoos and soaps. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of grains, rice and cleaning products such as shampoos and soaps.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 33 years old and married. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the past six years. 

She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She is motivated to provide her family. 

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy stocks of rice, flour, and sugar from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and part to increase business capital. She is in her sixth loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Eleazar

texts.es: Eleazar, a sus 50 años de edad, es casado y padre de dos hijos. Desde hace 30 años se dedica a la fabricación y comercialización de molduras en yeso, actividad que aprendió de manera empírica y que con el paso del tiempo fue perfeccionando su técnica; actualmente tiene un local abierto al público pero, con el ideal de expandirse, desea abrir otra sucursal en un municipio del oriente antioqueño, pues vio en esta zona una gran posibilidad de hacer crecer su negocio y tener más aceptación de sus productos y sus servicios, por esta razón solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que podrá culminar el montaje de su nuevo local, el dinero será invertido en las adecuaciones locativas, compra de materias primas al por mayor (yeso en polvo y otros químicos), así podrá dar inicio a su nuevo proyecto con el que espera generar una mejor rentabilidad, ofreciendo productos novedosos y de excelente calidad con los que sus compradores podrán decorar de forma moderna sus casas; aunque es consciente que llegar a un público nuevo, tener aceptación y acogida es un desafío grande, él está dispuesto a asumir el reto con perseverancia, actitud positiva y mucha dedicación. Es así como Eleazar desea cumplir su principal objetivo que es lograr un reconocimiento en todos los municipios del Oriente Antioqueño y, garantizarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Eleazar, at the age of 50, is married and the father of two children. For the past 30 years, he has worked making and selling plaster moldings. He learned this profession through hands-on practice, and over time he continued to perfect his technique. He currently has a shop open to the public, but with the aim of expanding, he wants to open another branch in a municipality in the eastern part of Antioquia, since he sees great opportunity in that area for expanding his business and gaining recognition for his products and services. For this reason, he is requesting support through the loan, which will allow him to finish setting up his new shop. The funds will be invested in improvements to the shop and buying wholesale supplies (powdered plaster and other chemicals). In this way, he will be able to start his new project, through which he hopes to achieve greater profitability, offering innovative and high-quality products which his customers will use to decorate their homes in a modern style. Although he knows that reaching new customers and gaining their attention and acceptance is a significant challenge, he is ready to take on this task with perseverance, a positive attitude and great dedication. Thus, Eleazar wants to achieve his main goal, which is to gain recognition in all of the municipalities of East Antioquia and to ensure a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to set up a new shop and to buy wholesale supplies (powdered plaster and other chemicals).

loans.name: Elsa Clementina

texts.es: Elsa, tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 5 hijos, vive en el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Hace tres años que ella tiene su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende granos básicos manteca, jabón, jugos, pan, huevos, azúcar, harina, refrescos, golosinas, azúcar etc. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para invertirlo en su negocio  y contar con un mayor inventario, comprara arroz, azúcar, manteca, pan, frijoles, huevos, café, refrescos, churros etc. Su meta es tener un negocio más fuerte de la aldea y obtener ingresos para darle mejor vida a su familia
texts.en:
Elsa is 40 years old. She is married and has 5 children. She lives in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. For the last 3 years she has run her own business, a small store, where she sells basic grains, lard, soap, juices, bread, eggs, sugar, flour, soft drinks, sweets, sugar etc.

Elsa is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL to invest in her business buying rice sugar, lard, bread, beans, eggs, coffee, soft drinks, churros, etc. Her goal is to have the biggest store in her community and generate the money to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to stock her business with products like rice, sugar, lard, bread, beans, eggs, coffee, soft drinks, churros, etc.

loans.name: Milimani A Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru international group comprised of two farmers. The group is called Milimani A and its members are based within the Kuria West District. The group members came together to grow socially and economically through agriculture. As a group, the members of Milimani A collectively guarantee their loan. Dismas, who is holding a client waiver up, is the chairperson of the group and has been a member since 2011. He is married with six children who all go to school. 

Dismas will use his portion of the Kiva loan to acquire hybrid seed and fertilizer which will enable him obtain high yields. Dismas, just like the other member of his group, will take input loans for one acre and will grow maize on 1/2 acre and sorghum and millet on a ¼ acre each. He plans to sell his surplus crop and use the profit to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Patricia Maribel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San José se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señorita Patricia, tiene 28 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres.
Doña Patricia para obtener y con esto ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar desde hace 5 años adecuo un local en el centro de la ciudad en el cual puso en un principio una copiadora y luego con la ayuda de los créditos ha ido surtiendo una pequeña papelería, trabaja todos los días y todo el día con la ayuda de su mamá. Este negocio  le permite salir adelante y forjarse un mejor porvenir.
Este nuevo crédito es para comprar cuadernos, lápices, hojas y todo tipo de útiles escolares. Lleva más de tres años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho en su negocio. Sus sueños son aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
San José Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Jaramijo Canton, known for its pretty beaches that bathe the coast of the beautiful area.  The majority of people there are very hardworking and work in jobs relating to the sea.

This is where Patricia lives.  She's 28 years old and single, and lives in her parents' house.

Patricia set up a space in the center of town five years ago to earn a living and help her parents with the household expenses.  In the beginning she installed a photocopier; later, with the help of loans, she started supplying a small paper store.  She works all day every day with the help of her mother.  This business allows her to get ahead and make a better future for herself.

This new loan is to buy notebooks, pencils, paper, and all types of school supplies.

Patricia has been in the communal bank for three years and she likes it because the loans have helped her a lot in her business.  Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, paper, and school supplies

loans.name: Stalin Fernando

texts.es:
Stalin tiene 20 años de edad, estado civil soltero vive con sus padres, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama LA PAULINA se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto La Paulina, pertenece al cantón Pueblo Viejo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Stalin  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en Agroquímica Carlita y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abonos agrícolas para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para su familia y para invertir. Su sueño es salir adelante con la familia y comprar cacao.
Le gusta ser responsable en su trabajo y viajar.
texts.en:
Stalin is 20 years old and is single.  He lives with his parents in the Ventanas canton, in the Los Ríos province of Ecuador.

This group is called "La Paulina" and is based in the Puerto Pechiche parish, in the La Paulina area.  La Paulina is part of Pueblo Viejo and, here, the people mainly work in agriculture and raising livestock.

Stalin has been working in agriculture, growing rice and corn, for some years.  He buys his supplies in Agroquímica Carlita, in Ventanas and sells his product in the same market.

Stalin is applying for this loan in order to buy manure to sow rice and corn.  This loan will help Stalin to increase his income to support his family and invest more.  Stalin's dream is to prosper with his family and to buy cacao.

Stalin likes to be responsible with his work and enjoys travelling.

loans.use: to sow corn.

loans.name: Ruth Marisol

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 38 años de edad es viuda, vive con los cuatro hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC 27 DE MAYO sus miembros se deican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Cadial Practicamente se han criado en esa zona se dedican a labores agrícolas u Pecuarias en su mayoria.

Ruth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y al engorde de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, líquido mata maleza, semilla y alimento como balanceados y polvillo para los cerdos.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembra y para criar a los animales.

Las compras y las ventas lo hará en Ventanas.

El sueño es comprar terreno para seguir cultivando y aumentar la produccion. Le gusta leer la biblia y conversa con la esposa.
texts.en:
Ruth is 38 years old and a widow.  She lives with her four children in the Ventanas canton of the Los Ríos province in Ecuador.

The members of the "27 de Mayo" communal bank all work in agriculture and they all live in the Cadial area. Most people in this area work in agriculture and raising livestock.

Ruth makes a living in agriculture, growing corn, and also fattening up pigs.  She is applying for this loan in order to buy urea, insecticides, weed killer, seeds, and feed for pigs.

With the help of this loan, Ruth will be able to buy the necessary supplies to sow her crop and to raise her animals.

Ruth makes her purchases and her sales in Ventanas.

Ruth's dream is to buy land to continue growing crops and to increase her production.  Ruth likes reading the Bible and talking to her husband.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticides, weed killer, seeds and feed for pigs.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a mother who stays at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

She has operated a food and utensils selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition from other sellers. 

With the KES 5,000 she wants to purchase cups, sweets and plates at wholesale and resell them at a profit. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase cups, sweets and plates at wholesale to resale at a profit.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
José, tiene una mayor demanda de su servicio en estas fechas de fin de año e inicios del próximo año, ya que la temporada escolar está por comenzar, el solicita capital para comprar telas, broches, hilos, botones, zippers, etc., son materiales necesarios para laborar sin problema alguno.
El efecto que le dio el crédito anterior en su negocio fue positivo ya que le permitió entregar en menor tiempo sus encargos, por lo que sus ganancias las percibió antes de lo previsto, ha cancelado sus deudas y gano más clientes.
texts.en:
José has higher demand at the beginning and the end of the year as the new school year is about to begin.  José is applying for a loan in order to buy material, clasps, threads, buttons, zips and more. These are all materials which he needs to work without any problems.

José previous loan had a very positive effect on his business as it allowed him to fulfil orders more quickly.  This resulted in profits coming earlier than anticipated and so José has paid off his debts and now has more customers.

loans.use: to buy material, clasps, threads, buttons, zips and more.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa was born in 1979 and is married with 4 children. Her husband is in the military. 

Sanaa helps her husband to meet their children's needs by selling food products.  She has done this for 1 year. She started the business at home and then opened her own mini market. She needs to purchase additional food products and items. However, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase additional items for her mini market.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan was born in 1974. She is the married mother of 4. Hanan decided to support her husband in covering their children's needs by starting a business selling food products. She started it at home one year ago and opened her own mini-market later on. Now she needs to stock her mini-market with food products and buy a freezer where she can store meat. However, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more food products and a freezer to store meat.

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Because Salwa is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. 

Salwa was born in 1982. She is married and a mother of four. Salwa has been trying her best to support her children and to cover their needs by running her project of selling birds for three years now. It started with selling a small quantity of birds. Then she started expanding it by buying a larger quantity of birds. Now she needs to open her bird store where she can sell her birds, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To open a bird store

loans.name: Al-Sharif Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Sharif and consists of four members who are all women. All of them are friends from Taiz, Yemen. The group took a loan of 160,000 YER. 

Asia is the leader of the group. She is 44 years old, married, has two children and lives in Taiz, Yemen. Her main business is selling ladies' fabrics, incenses and perfumes. She has been in business for one year.  She has a good command of her activity. 

Asia is taking out a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB and intends to use her loan to better develop her business by purchasing incense and perfumes to increase her profits. Her profits will allow her to help meet her family’s needs. In the future, she would like to have a big center where she could sell products such as incense, perfumes and different clothes.

loans.use: to purchase incense and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Hamda Jama

texts.en:
Hamda Jama is 21 years old. She studies at Admas University College, faculty of Information Technology. 

She needs a laptop to create IT programs. Her good news was when she got the Kaaba-Kiva laptop loan. 

She approached Kaaba MFI and Kaaba will provide the laptop to Hamda as a loan that she will pay for in installments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is married and she has three children. Her husband is a teacher. This is her first loan. 

Rita is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as flour, coffee and water. 

Rita opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $200. She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

She is happy with this loan because it is offered for poor people to improve their living condition in the future.

loans.use: To buy flour, coffee and water.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia, age 46, is a responsible mother living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her sixth loan with BRAC and her first with Kiva.
 
Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with the scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, etc. He makes buys scrap goods from people and sells them to the recycling factories. 

Nowadays, due to household expenses, he does not have enough to buy scrap goods for resale. Therefore, Razia requested a loan for her husband, so he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents.
 
She is will be very thankful with this honorable support; she thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy scrap goods to sell for recycling.

loans.name: Warda Essa

texts.en: Warda Essa is a 21-year-old. She studies Information Technology at Admass University College. Her problem is that she has no laptop, and it’s difficult for her to have practical practice. She approached Kaaba MFI and Kaaba will provide her with a laptop that she will pay for in installments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for educational purposes.

loans.name: Yasin Mahamoud

texts.en: Yasin Mahamoud is 19 years old. He studies at the University of Hargeisa, faculty of Information Technology . He faces a major problem in his learning. His problem is the lack of a laptop to learn. He needs a laptop to prepare university assignments and read lessons when given in soft copy. He cannot pay the money all at one time, so he approached Kaaba MFI and Kaaba will provide him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for educational purposes.

loans.name: Future Star Group

texts.en:
Ivonia is one of the members of Future Star Group, and the word "Future Star" in a local language means" Hope."

She is taking out the loan to add to her own working capital in order to buy some additional supplies such as  vegetables, onions, garlic and fruit. She is a hard-working woman. She started her business a year ago with her own working capital of $50 dollars.

loans.use: To buy  vegetables, onions, garlic, and fruit

loans.name: Hamda Muse

texts.en: Hamda Muse is 19 years old.  She studies at Shifa Medical College, in the faculty of medicine. Her main challenge is the lack of a laptop to prepare her assignments and lessons. She approached Kaaba Microfinance Institution to get a laptop as a loan. Kaaba will provide the laptop to Hamda as a loan, and she will make monthly repayments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Pacha Yllari  De Huandar Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PACHA YLLARI  DE HUANDAR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Pisaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana Paula ella es casada y tiene 57 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de piedras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to a communal bank called "Pacha Yllari de Huandar". This group is located in the Pisaq district, which is in the Calca province in the department of Cusco.

Juana Paula is married, is 57 years old, and has 2 children. She has a business in which she raises and sells animals. She cares for guinea pigs and chickens, lets them grow and fatten, and then sells them at various festivals. 

Through this business, she is able to move her children forward. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell guinea pigs and chickens. She is requesting this loan to purchase guinea pigs, chickens, and food for the guinea pigs and chickens.

The other members of the communal bank make a living through agriculture, selling blocks, running convenience stores, and selling animals.

Juana Paula thanks those who have made this dream possible and promises to make the payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs, chickens, and food for the guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Nashehe

texts.en:
Nashehe is a 50-year-old married woman. She has three children 25, 20 and 18 years, whom she supports. 

Nashehe runs a grocery business that has lasted for three years now, and it is located at Gongoni. She earns a monthly income of KES 14,150. 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a KADET officer and she is taking a second loan of KES 40,000, which she intends to use to buy more vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, brinjals (eggplant), mangoes and carrots. 

Her previous loan of KES 20,000 she paid back to KADET successfully. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business by making it a wholesale business. Her hopes for her future business are to open another grocery business and also to make sure her children get better education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, brinjals, mangoes and carrots to sell to her buyers.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is 27 years old and is married with a five-year-old child who she supports. For the past three years, she has run a tailoring shop and earns a monthly income of 7,000 KES. Hilda was introduced to Visionfund Kenya by a loan officer.

Hilda is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to add stock to her business and buy materials, zippers, sewing threads, and canvas. This will be her second loan. Hilda will use the anticipated profit from her loan to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her tailoring shop and educate her child.

loans.use: buy materials, zippers, sewing threads, and canvas to make clothes for her customers

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Isabel, tiene la necesidad de invertir en su negocio, para estar preparada en esta temporada que las ventas aumentan significativamente, comprara uvas, manzanas, jocotes, papayas, peras, etc., tendrá su negocio surtido y podrá responder a las demandas de sus clientes.
Con la capital anterior ella compro variedad de frutas y verduras que le ayudaron a tener clientes más satisfechos, aumentar sus ventas, tener ganancias mayores, con las que ha mejorado las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en: Isabel needs to invest in her business to be prepared in this season of significantly higher sales. She will buy grapes, apples jocote, papayas, pears, etc. to stock her store and need the demand from clients. With the last loan she bought a variety of fruit and vegetables which helped keep her customers happy and increased her sales and income. So she has been able to improve her family's situation.

loans.use: to buy grapes, apples, jocote, papayas, pears, etc.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis tiene 51 años, está casada con Tiofila  y tiene 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa hecha a base de madera. Desde muy  joven se dedica a la agricultura gracias a una parcela de 3 hectáreas que adquirió gracias al fruto de muchos años de trabajo. Realiza su labor conjuntamente con su esposo y sus hijos quienes  lo apoyan en tiempos libres. Alrededor de sus parcelas podemos hallar una gran variedad de productos tales como cacao orgánico, café, árboles frutales, entre otros. Para el normal desempeño de sus labores debe contar necesariamente con capital de trabajo que le permite obtener insumos como abonos orgánicos, herramientas y el pago a los jornaleros que le apoyan en tareas complicadas como es el retiro de maleza y cosecha de sus productos en la campaña productiva correspondiente. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Desea en esta oportunidad contar 1,500 nuevo soles para invertirlos en el mantenimiento de sus parcelas con la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Luis is 51 years old. He is married to Tiofila and has 4 children with whom he lives in a house made out of wood. Since he was young he has farmed thanks to 3 hectares of land he bought through long years of hard work. He works along with his wife and his children who support him in their spare time. Around his plots you can find a variety of crops like organic cocoa, coffee, fruit trees, etc.

To carry out his activities he needs working capital which permits him to buy supplies like organic fertilizer, tools and to pay for day labor. They help him with the more complicated tasks like clearing the underbrush and harvesting his product. This is his first loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the financial support that he will receive to get ahead. He promises to pay his installments on time. At this time he is asking for a loan of 1,500 PEN to invest in the maintenance of his plots buying organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a widow with two children. When her husband died, she worked hard to feed her children and give them a better future. She gained work experience and earned enough money to provide her children's school allowances. When she gained enough experience in managing a business, Imelda started a retail store near her church. 

To earn additional income, she direct sells beauty products, shoes and clothing. Sometimes, she can not meet her customer's needs because of insufficient capital to increase her inventory. Hence, she requests 50,000 PHP to buy pants, shirts and grocery items to sell in her retail store.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts and grocery items to sell in her retail store.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is 55 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lina has a business selling kitchen wares in the Philippines. Lina requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Lina has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge, es acompañado, actualmente el vive en la localidad donde tiene ubicado su negocio, debido a la necesidad de generar los ingresos familiares tiene su negocio lejos de su hogar el visita a su familia cada cierto tiempo, tiene un taller electricista automotriz, es un oficio que aprendió hace ya 20 años, lo atiende de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m., es apoyado por un empleado.
Comprará, luces, cables, sensores, alternadores entre otro tipo de repuestos para vehículos, con lo que tendrá un inventario bien surtido para hacer un buen trabajo a sus clientes, espera mejorar su economía y optimizar su servicio.
Sueña con mantener siempre activo el negocio para dar a su familia lo mejor, así como también seguir generando empleo.
texts.en:
Jorge is married and currently lives in the community where his business is located. Due to the need for him to generate income for his family, his business is located far from his family's home. He visits them every so often. 

He has an automotive and electrician workshop, which is a trade that he learned 20 years ago. He works from 7 am until 4 pm and has one employee.

He will purchase lights, cables, gauges, and alternators, along with other supplies for vehicles. This way, he will have a well-stocked inventory to do good work for his clients.

He hopes to improve his financial situation and optimize his services. He dreams of keeping his business running so that he can provide the best for his family and continue creating jobs.

loans.use: to purchase lights, cables, gauges, and alternators.

loans.name: Edgar Omar

texts.es:
Edgar, tiene la necesidad del invertir más en el cultivo de maíz, por lo que solicita capital para comprar abono, fertilizantes, semillas plaguicidas, con los que preparara el terreno donde sembrara.
Con el crédito anterior incremento su cosecha por lo que sus ganancias son mejores, su familia goza de muy buena salud y todos viven en un mejor estilo familiar.
texts.en: Edgar needs to invest more into his corn cultivation, which is why he is seeking this loan to purchase compost, fertilizers, seed and pesticides.  He will use these supplies to prepare the land he uses for his crops.  With the previous loan, he increased his harvest which improved his earnings.  His family is in good health and they are living in better conditions.

loans.use: purchase compost, fertilizers, seed, and pesticides.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es: Luz María, tiene 29 años de edad, es casada, tiene una hija y vive en el municipio de Morazan, Yoro.  Ella tiene su propio negocio de venta de helados como conos, ice crean, paletas, copitas, y golosinas como confites y chicles de toda clase, churros galletas etc. el negocio lo tiene establecido desde hace 5 años en un local que alquila en el centro de la comunidad. Esta solicitando actualmente otro préstamo por 27,000 Lempiras, con el cual comprara más producto para la venta como ser conos, paletas, dulces, galletas etc.. Quiere mantener surtido el negocio para poder incrementar las ventas y sus ingresos. Su plan es continuar con el negocio, mantenerlo surtido para obtener ingresos y ayudar a su hija con la educación.
texts.en:
29-year old Luz María is married and has a daughter. She lives in the municipality of Morazon, Yoro. She has her own business selling different kinds of ice cream such as cornets, popsicles etc. She also sells candy and all types of gum, doughnuts, and cookies. She's run the business for five years now from a stall she rents in the centre of the community. 

Luz María is now seeking another loan of 27,000 lempiras to buy more products to sell such as cones, popsicles, candy, cookies etc. She wishes to keep her stall well-stocked so can increase sales and earn more money. Her plan is to continue with the business, keep it well-stocked, and provide her daughter with an education.

loans.use: Buy stock such as candy, ice cream, cookies etc.

loans.name: Nema

texts.en:
Nema was born in 1968. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour with her retired husband and 8 sons and daughters. Her husband currently works as a bus driver. 

Nema has sold cosmetic products and accessories for 4 years. She started her business as a result of the financial problems she faced. She first sold a small amount  and then she expanded it. She plans to buy a larger quantity and variety of accessories and cosmetic products in order to increase her profit. Nema has applied for this loan because she doesn't have enough money to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products and accessories for her business.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She is 39 years old, a diligent woman and a mother of six children. Her husband is an excellent tailor by profession. He can stitch a variety of ladies' and gents' clothing. All of his customers appreciate his talent and hard work. His customers are increasing day by day and he has only one sewing machine to complete the orders. 

He wants to purchase one more sewing machine to meet the increased demand of his customers on time. However he doesn't have savings to purchase a machine. Therefore, his wife wants to help her husband by asking for a KIVA loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of loan amount her husband can purchase a new tailoring machine and he will easily complete his orders on time. Naseem sends best wishes to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine for her husband to use to stitch up clothing.

loans.name: Ekhlas

texts.en: Ekhlas is a married woman who was born in 1984. She is a mother of three. Her husband works at a government entity and at the same time works as a personal driver. She decided to help her husband financially by selling clothes since one year ago and has found it profitable. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of clothes that suit the winter season to raise her sales to help her husband in covering their children's needs, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more winter clothes for her business

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es: José Andrés tiene 55 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Granada. Casado y padre de dos hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio este negocio hace varios años, vendiendo una variedad de productos y con la ayuda de su suegra logro salir adelante. Su meta es hacer crecer la pulpería con productos que tengan una fuerte demanda y así lograr que el negocio prospere.  Solicita el crédito para realizar compras de productos: Arroz, Frijoles, Detergentes entre otros, con el fin de surtir la pulpería. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas en las diversas temporadas. Su plan futuro es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
José Andrés is a 55 year old native of the city of Granada.  He is married and a father of two children who are now independent.  He is a business man who has a general store.  He started this business a few years ago, selling a variety of products.  With the help of his mother-in-law he was able to succeed.  His goal is for his store to grow by selling products that have a strong demand, which will allow his business to prosper.  

He is seeking this loan to purchase products such as: rice, beans, detergents and other items, with the goal of stocking his store.  He believes that the loan will help him to increase his sales throughout the different seasons.  His future plan is to continue growing his business.

loans.use: purchase merchandise such as: rice, beans, detergent and other items.

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en:
Nighat is a 48-year-old married woman living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a butcher by trade; he sells chickens in his shop. His daily practice is to buy broilers from the market and sell them in his shop. Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills which weakened his purchasing power for new inventory of his butcher shop.
 
Therefore, Nighat requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy broilers to sell in his shop. Her dream is to provide all facilities of life to her children.

loans.use: To buy broilers for her husband to resell.

loans.name: Ahmed Hussein

texts.en:
Ahmed Hussien is 22 years old. He studies at Gollis University College, in the school of civil engineering. He needs a laptop to prepare his assignments, read his lessons when given in soft copy, and to download extra lessons. 

Ahmed Hussien requested that Kaaba Microfinance Institution (Kaaba) give him a laptop as a loan and now he is waiting for the laptop. Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan and Ahmed Hussien will make monthly payments.

loans.use: to obtain a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Emilio Argenis

texts.es:
Emilio Agenis, es un joven estudiante de medicina, él solicita un préstamo para poder pagar sus estudios, esta es su historia:Soy Emilio Argenis, tengo 3 hermanos, mi madre es una madre soltera que ha tratado de sacarnos adelante sola pero ya se le ha dificultado por la escasez de recursos que estamos pasando en estos momentos. Vivimos apartados de la ciudad en una casa humilde; de los 19 años de mi vida tengo 15 años que no veo a mi padre, no se de él y nunca se ha preocupado por mi y mis hermanos.
Esto ha impulsado mis deseos de estudiar, para salir adelante y sacar a mi madre y hermanos de la situación que estamos atravesando actualmente, a través del estudio de la medicina, área en la cual según mis notas y profesores hasta el momento he sido muy bueno.
Les ruego humildemente que me bendigan con la oportunidad de obtener estos recursos para poder estudiar; prometo no decepcionarles.
texts.en:
Emilio Argenis is a young medical student.  He is asking for a loan so that he can pay for his studies.  This is his story: 

I am Emilio Argenis.  I have three siblings and my mother is a single mother who has tried to get us ahead in life alone but has been hindered due to the lack of resources that we are undergoing at this time.  We live isolated from the city in a humble house.  Out of the 19 years of my life, I have not seen my father in 15 of them.  I know nothing of him and he has never been concerned with me and my siblings.

This has propelled my desire to study and to be successful in life, and to get my mother and siblings out of the situation which we are currently going through; all through studying medicine which, according to my grades and professors, is going well so far.  

I ask you humbly to bless me with the opportunity to get the resources I need to be able to study; I promise to not dissappoint you.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of his studies in medicine.

loans.name: Barasengo A Group

texts.en:
This group of three farmers is called Barasengo A. It is a group of Nuru International farmers and is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

The person holding the client waiver is Daniel. He is 38 years old, married, and has five children; four of whom attend school. Daniel has been a member of the group since 2008 and he is the group’s chairperson.

Daniel has been learning better farming methods within his group and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on his farm to grow maize, sorghum and millet during the 2014 long rains seasons. He is constrained financially, however, and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable him purchase these farm inputs. He believes that the use of hybrid seeds and fertilizers will increase his yields and he will not only get enough food for his family but will also sell the surplus and obtain money to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Janepher's Group

texts.en:
Janepher is a member of Epeneza Group in Chwele District.  She is pictured here in a group of six One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 65 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Janepher has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.					

Janepher is 47 years old and has been a farmer for 20 years. She works hard to provide for her two children. Her community and other farmers know Janepher as friendly. Other than farming, she is also involved in community activities such as the women's and prayer groups. Janepher described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.

The 2014 Long Rains season won’t be Janepher’s first season with One Acre Fund.  She joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and has continued working with them to get new farming methods, fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and to earn enough to feed her family. As an active member in her community, Janepher also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she wants to help more farmers. Janepher also became a One Acre Fund group leader because she was elected and this shows that farmers in her group have confidence in her. 
 
Janepher and the Epeneza Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
Janepher plans on using future profits from her harvest to repair her home and buy a cow.  Her life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because she has more profits from her harvest and is able to save money and feed her family. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en: Tasleem is a 40-year-old, vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, Tasleem is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 43-year-old, married woman doing business selling milk for the past five years. She has 5 milk cows. She sells milk to many of her neighbors along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life.

Shameem has two children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

It’s her first year with Kashf Foundation; currently Shameem requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is 29 years old and a vigorous lady.  She has been stitching clothes for many years. 

She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 from the Kashf Foundation. 

She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. 

She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en:
Zulfiya is is an experienced farmer from Agdash. She has a large family consisting of her husband, son, daughter-in-law, 11-year-old granddaughter, and 10- and 4-year-old grandsons. Zulfiya's husband works in government. 

To assist her family members in earning a living, she cultivates potatoes and eggplant. She sells her agricultural products in the local market. This is an important source of income for the family. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, she needs a loan of 1,500 AZN to purchase a steer, to buy cellophane for greenhouse construction, to purchase potato, tomato, and cucumber seeds, to buy fertilizers and to pay for harvesting services. 

Zulfiyya and her family will be grateful to lenders for their help in providing the amount they need for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a steer, seeds and cellophane for greenhouse construction, and to pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: Doris De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Doris de Jesús   de   47 años de edad, tiene un hijo que depende de ella, vive con su esposo en su casa en la comunidad de San Lorenzo valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Doris De Jesús  se dedica desde hace 03 años  al negocio de pulpería en donde vende frescos, pollo, embutidos, granos básicos, huevos y detergentes, su venta es con los amigos y personas que a diario le visitan, se levanta muy temprano todo los días para preparar la venta que realiza también en las fincas de melón de la zona.
Doña Doris De Jesús es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que su sueño es tener un buen negocio, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de productos como frescos, detergentes, granos básicos, churros, verduras y jugos, con el apoyo e este préstamo  pretende mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida. Su sueño es mejorar su casa y tener un mejor negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Dora de Jesús is 47 years old. She has one child who she supports. She lives with her husband in their home in the San Lorenzo valley in southern Honduras. 

Dora de Jesús has owned a small grocery store for the past 3 years, where she sells drink mixes, chicken, sausages, staple grains, eggs, and detergent. Her customers are friends and people who visit the store every day. She wakes up very early each day to prepare for sales. She also sells her products at the melon farms in the area.

Dora de Jesús is a humble and hardworking woman whose dream is to have a good business. She requests this loan to purchase products like drink mixes, detergent, staple grains, churros, vegetables, and juice. With the support of this loan, she hopes to improve her income and, as a result, her quality of life. Her dream is to improve her home and her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - December 2012

loans.use: to purchase drink mixes, detergent, staple grains, churros, vegetables, and juice for her business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La señora Alicia tiene 42 años, casada con 1 hijos que tienen la edad de 6 años ella trabaja vendiendo cosméticos por catalogo, este préstamo es el primero  que tiene con la institución, La señora Alicia va a usar este préstamo para culminar la instalación de agua a su domicilio ya que esta solo con pozo y es mucho trabajo trasladar el agua así que hará una conexión para baños, ducha y cocina  y así de esta manera brindara mayor comodidad a su familia ya que por muchas razones la zona no cuenta con servicios básicos pero esto no impedirá que la señora Alicia tenga agua potable en su domicilio. Se siente muy feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Alicia is 42 and is married with a six-year-old son. She works selling cosmetics through a catalogue. This is the first loan she has had with the institution. She will use it to finish installing water in her house as she currently has to use a well, and it's a lot of work to fetch the water. She will connect her bath, shower and kitchen with water and make her family more comfortable. For a variety of reasons her area is lacking in basic services, but Alicia will not let this stop her from having drinking water in her home. She is very happy to have the opportunity to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to finish installing water in her house

loans.name: Ulker

texts.en:
Ülker is a widow with two children: a daughter in high school and a son in college. Since the death of her husband, she has brought in a small income. She had to work to provide for the needs of her two children.   

From a friend she learned about Amway and began selling Amway products (linens, kitchen appliances, cosmetics and detergent). Her neighbors, relatives and friends became her customers. Since she knew a lot of people, making sales wasn’t a problem. Later, she sold products from other companies the same way. 

With her loan from Maya, she will order products to sell to her clients. When she applied for the loan, she already had customers waiting to order.  Because she sells from catalogs, she took orders from customers without the products on hand and ordered them wholesale. When she has the money in advance, she can order the products from the company at a discount. This way her profits are greater.  

She wants to continue doing this work as long as she is in good health. When she meets friends and neighbors, she can show them the products in the catalogs easily. She has the items they order shipped to her home and then delivers them to her clients. This type of work has advantages for Ülker, who also has time to spend on her home and children. 

Because Ülker wasn’t able to study, she wants her children to stay in school and she wants to give them a better life. Her son is currently enrolled in college and his goal is to study four more years. She wants her daughter to qualify for university, study and have a profession.  

Ülker is a determined woman and skillful at working and selling.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Ülker Hanım,dul ve 2 çocuğu var.  Kızı lisede,oğlu da yüksekokulda okuyor.  Eşi öldükten sonra kendisine az bir maaş bağlanmış.  İki çocuğu olduğundan  ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak zorunda ve çalışmalıydı.  Arkadaşında gördü ve  amway(çamaşır,mutfak gereçleri,kozmetik ürünler,deterjan) ürünleri satmaya başladı.  Çevresindeki komşuları,akrabaları,arkadaşları müşterileri oldu.  Çevresi çok olduğundan satış yapmakta zorluk çekmedi.  Daha sonra çeşitli firmaların ürünlerini aynı şekilde sattı.  Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile ürün siparişi alıp müşterilerine satacak.  Krediye müracaat ettiğinde ,sipariş bekleyen müşterileri vardı .  Katologtan satış yaptığı için, ürün elinde olmasa da müşterilerden sipariş alıyor ve bu siparişleri firmadan toplu istek yaparak satış yapıyor.  Elinde toplu para olduğunda, ürünleri firmadan indirimli olarak daha avantajlı bir şekilde alıyor.  Böyle olunca karı daha çok oluyor.  Gelecekte bu işi sağlığı el verdikçe yapmak istiyor.  Çünkü katologtan sattığı için ,gittiği arkadaş toplantılarında,komşularına ürünü rahatlıkla gösterebiliyor.  Aldığı ürünler  kargo ile evine geliyor.  Sonra müşterilerine teslim ediyor.  Ülker Hanım  için avantajlı bir iş ,hem evine hem çocuklarına vakit ayırabiliyor.  Ülker Hanım okumadığından,çocukları okusun hayatlarını kurtarsınlar istiyor.  Oğlu şu an da yüksek okulda ,hedefi dört yıllık daha okumak.  Kızı  lisede üniversiteyi kazanıp ,okusun mesleği olsun istiyor.  Azimli,iş yapma ve satma becerisine sahip.

loans.use: to buy products to resell.

loans.name: Caro's Group

texts.en:
Caro is a member of Inuka Group in Chwele District. She is pictured here in a group of three One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 39 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Caro has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Caro is 38 years old and has been a farmer for 20 years. Caro works as a farmer to provide for her five children. The community and other farmers know Caro as reliable and hardworking. Other than farming, she is also involved in community activities such as the women's group and the prayer group.  Caro described her harvest last year as excellent, but she hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.
														
Caro first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Caro joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, new farming methods and fertilizer and hybrid seeds. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes being a leader and wants to help more farmers. 

Caro plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Caro’s own life was improved because she has more profits from harvest, has more farm group support and is able to feed the family.  
							
Caro and the Inuka Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Adala's Group

texts.en:
Adala is a member of Eagles Farmers Group in Busia District.  She is pictured here in a group of 4 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 45 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Adala has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.							

Adala is married and has 2 children.  She is 50 years old and is known as a friendly and hardworking farmer.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group and prayer group.  Adala has been a farmer for 35 years.  She described her harvest as poor last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  				

Adala first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  She joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices and get new farming methods to enable her to earn enough to feed her family and send her children to school.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes being a leader and wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Adala plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and invest in a business.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Adala’s own life was improved because she has more farm training and was able to feed the family.  							

Adala and the Eagles Farmers Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize, millet and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 4 years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. Shehnaz is a mother of 4 children and is motivated to provide them with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good repayment history. Shehnaz is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 50 years old, a female, and married. She has six(6) children whom she supports. Paulina was introduced to Visionfund Kenya by an officer, and she runs a grocery business which has lasted for three years now. In her business she earns a monthly income of about KES 3,550. 

She is taking her first loan of KES 10,000 which she intends to use to add stock to her business. That includes tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages and mangoes. Paulina will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and her family are to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages and mangoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: James' Group

texts.en:
Namatunzo is a group of four farmers in the Matete district with James selected as the Kiva representative. James has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right in the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 44 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant a quarter-acre of maize and a quarter-acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 KES.							

James joined One Acre Fund in 2009, and he is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  James joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices and get fertilizers and hybrid seeds.  Because he is an active community member, James has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved James's life because he has more profits from his harvest.  In the future, James hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school and save for the future. 						

James and the Namatunzo Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizers through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizers when prices are low and passes on the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seeds and fertilizers for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 29 years old and married. He supports three members of his family. He runs a motorcycle transport business in the town of Kapsabet. He has been in this business for the last five years; he earns an average monthly income of KES 32,000. 

John plans to use the amount borrowed of KES 20,000 to add to his personal savings and buy his own motorcycle. He will use the profits from the  business to expand his business and provide for his family.

loans.use: To purchase his own motorcycle.

loans.name: Leticia Isabel

texts.es: Leticia tiene 22 años, vive en casa familiar, es soltera.  Estudia contabilidad en un Instituto, para solventar sus gastos trabaja en una empresa de su localidad como asistente contable, también vende ropa a domicilio a sus familiares y amigos. Beneficiaria utilizará el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería (vestidos, polos, blusas, pantalones). Su sueño es culminar su carrera y ser una gran profesional para mejorar la calidad vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Leticia is 20 years old. She lives in her family’s home and is single. She studies accounting at an institute. To pay her expenses she works in a business in her area as an assistant accountant. She also sells clothing to her relatives and friends in their homes. 

The beneficiary will use the loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise (dresses, polo shirts, blouses, pants). Her dream is to finish her studies and be a great professional to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (dresses, blouses, polo shirts, pants).

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es:
Julio, disfruta de una vida familiar junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos, de 3, 5 y 7 años de edad, hace mucho tiempo aprendió de un amigo el oficio de estructuras metálicas y también se dedica a la construcción, desde hace 10 años lo hace de forma 9 independiente, hasta la fecha no ha tenido ningún problema en administrar su negocio.
Con el préstamo comprara láminas, tubos, hierro, pintura, etc., estos implementos son parte de las herramientas que necesita para elaborar los trabajos que le encargan sus clientes, espera cumplir con los pedidos en menor tiempo, tener la satisfacción de sus clientes, mejorar su sus ingresos y cancelar deuda.
Sueña con tener un negocio más rentable, cumplir con todos sus compromisos económicos, ofrecer a su familia una mejor alimentación, salud, vestuario y una educación superior a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julio enjoys the family life with his wife and three children, who are 3, 5, and 7 years old. A long time ago, he learned the metal structures trade from a friend, and he also makes a living in construction. For 10 years he has worked independently. Until now he has not had any problems managing his business.

With the loan, he will buy corrugated metal, pipes, iron, paint, etc. These implements are part of the tools that he needs to produce the work that his customers order. He hopes to fill the orders in less time, have his customers’ satisfaction, increase his income, and pay his debt.

He dreams of having a more profitable business, carrying out all of his economic obligations, offering a better diet, health, and clothing to his family, and providing a higher education to his children.

loans.use: to purchase corrugated metal, pipes, iron, paint, etc.

loans.name: Cherure Group

texts.en:
Cherare is a Nuru International group of four farmers in Kuria West District in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge of improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm supplies. As a group, the members of Cherare collectively guarantee the loan.

Daniel, pictured with the hand raised, is a representative of the group. He is 28 years old and married with three children. Daniel has been a member of this group for two years now. 

The loan from KIVA in this coming season will enable him to obtain hybrid seeds and fertilizer which he believes will increase his farm yields. Daniel, just like other members of his group, will take input loans for one acre. He will grow maize in 1/2 acre, sorghum and millet in ¼ acre each. He will obtain food for his household as well as sell the surplus and obtain money to purchase local building materials to set up a family house.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina, age 39, is a married woman and the mother of five children. She has been involved in a business of sewing gloves for a period of about five years. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently, she applied for a loan of Rs. 15,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads and wool along with packs of needles. This will help her to inflate her sales. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads and wool along with packs of needles.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees, age 41, is a married woman and the mother of six children. She has been involved in a business sewing gloves for about three years. She has a good client list and makes enough money to contribute to the family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, Balqees has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 with the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread and wool along with packs of needles. This will help her to increase her sales. Balqees is in her sixth loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread and wool along with packs of needles.

loans.name: Gloris Grisela

texts.es:
La señora Gloris  de 34  años de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene 02 hijos que dependen de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 10 años  a la venta de abarrotería como ser café, huevos, granos básicos, carnes y más.
 Doña Gloris es una mujer bien trabajadora es un ejemplo en la comunidad de trabajo y dedicación, con los préstamo ha mejorado su casa y también su condición económica, ahora tiene carro y bacas.
Doña Gloris está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de más productos como huevos, azúcar, pan, café. Arroz, frijoles, carnes, etc. para su negocio ya que desea surtirlo porque la demanda es bastante fuerte para esta época de navidad.  Con el apoyo del préstamo mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida.
Doña Gloris su sueño es comprar  bacas lecheras para a si vender más cuajada y más leche logrando tener mejores ingresos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Gloris is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children who depend on her.  They live in the San Lorenzo community in the southern valley of Honduras.  She owns her own home, and for the past 10 years she has dedicated herself to selling groceries such as: coffee, eggs, basic grains, meats and other foods.  Gloris is a hardworking woman who is an example of dedication in the work community.

With the loans she has been able to improve her home and financial situation; she now has a car and cows.  Gloris is seeking a loan to purchase more products such as: eggs, sugar, bread, coffee, rice, beans, meat, etc. for her business as she hopes to stock the store since her demand is very high during the Christmas season.  With the help of this loan, she will improve her business and through that, her quality of life.  Gloris's dream is to purchase dairy cows in order to sell more curd and milk so she can increase her earnings.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - December, 2013.

loans.use: purchase eggs, sugar, bread, coffee, rice, beans, meat, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina, aged 60, is married to a company laborer and is blessed with seven children. She has been selling fish in their village for almost five years and earns a net income of PHP 300 per day. Her profits are usually spent on their food allowances. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 to purchase fish to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that she can improve her business and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 31 years old and unmarried.  He has operated a farming business in Ndunyu Njeru for two years.  He is applying for a first loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizer and seeds. 

With anticipated profit, he plans to repay the loan and expand his farming business.

In the near future, he hopes to apply for bigger loans from Vision Fund Kenya to increase his farming business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 32-year-old man from Nakuru.  He is married to Esther and they are blessed with four children who are 13, 9, 2 and 1 years old.

He operates a business as a charcoal vendor and dealer.  He has been in the business for three years.  He earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES.  He has applied for his third loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya.  He plans to use the loan to buy more farm supplies.

He anticipates using his profits to repay this loan and educate his children.  In the future, he hopes to buy a plot of land and build his own house.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 34 years old and comes from Nakuru, She is married and they are blessed with  three children aged 10, eight and five years old.

Catherine owns and operates a business as a caterer. She has been in the business for three years and earns a monthly income of KES.15,000. She has applied for her first loan of KES. 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the loan to boost and expand her catering business.

She plans  to use her anticipated profits to repay her loan, educate her children, and also expand her business. In future she hopes to have a restaurant in order to maximize her catering skills and increase her income as well as having a better living standard.

loans.use: To boost her catering business by increasing her stock of ingredients like eggs and flour.

loans.name: Ma. Belena

texts.en:
Ma. Belena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Belena requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 25 years now.

Ma. Belena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 46 years old and is from Nakuru, Kenya. She is married and is blessed with five children, ages 28, 26, 22, 19 and 12.

She owns a green grocery where she buys and sells fruits and vegetables. She has had this business for four years, and earns a monthly income of KES. 5,000. She has applied for her second loan of KES. 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the loan to increase her stock of fruits and vegetables to boost her business.

Salome anticipates using the profits from her business to pay her loan, educate her children, and boost her business. In the future, she hopes to buy a plot of land and build houses for rent to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad was born in 1992. He is single and lives with his parents at a sector in Jordan called Salt. He is a student at the university and has worked as a photographer for 5 years. He opened his own studio. He began his business with 2 cameras. Mohammad would like to repair and redecorate his studio  to attract customers and to increase his profit.  He needs money to do this. For this reason, he has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to repair his photography studio.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Eslam

texts.en:
